Therefore he said: “Because of the indication of the grasping of what is not deficient, not excessive, and not erroneous.”

original: Atha vā saddantaratthāpohanavasena saddo atthaṃ vadatīti sutanti assutaṃ na hotīti🔽ayametassa atthoti vuttaṃ – “assavanabhāvappaṭikkhepato”ti. Iminā diṭṭhādivinivattanaṃ
analyzed: atha vā sadda antara ttha apohana vasena saddo attham vadati iti sutam na hoti iti  ayam etassa atthaḥ ti vuttam assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti iminā diṭṭha ādi vinivattanam
translated: Or else, because of the exclusion of what is other than the sound, the sound speaks the meaning. Therefore it is not unheard.

original: karoti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – na idaṃ mayā diṭṭhaṃ, na sayambhuñāṇena sacchikataṃ, atha
analyzed: karoti idam vuttam hoti na idam mayā diṭṭham na sayambhu ñāṇena sacchikatam atha
translated: This is the meaning of it. He said: “Because of the exclusion of the state of not having heard.” By this he makes the distinction from what is seen, etc. This is what is said: This is not seen by me, nor is it realized by self-knowledge, but rather it is heard. And that rightly.

original: kho sutaṃ, tañca sammadevāti. Tenevāha – “anūnādhikāviparītaggahaṇanidassana”nti.
analyzed: kho sutam tat ca sammat eva ati tena iva āha anūna adhika aviparīta ggahaṇa nidassanam ti
translated: Therefore he said: “Because of the indication of the grasping of what is not deficient, not excessive, and not erroneous.”

original: Avadhāraṇatthe vā evaṃ-sadde ayamatthayojanā – “karīyatī”ti tadapekkhassa suta-saddassa
analyzed: avadhāraṇa atthe vā evaṃsadde ayam attha yojanā tad apekkhassa suta saddassa
translated: Or else, the meaning of the word eva is this: “It is done.” The word suta, which requires that,

original: ayamattho vutto “assavanabhāvappaṭikkhepato”ti. Tenevāha – “anūnādhikāviparītaggahaṇanidassana”nti.
analyzed: ayam atthaḥ vuttaḥ assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti tena iva āha anūna adhika aviparīta ggahaṇa nidassananti
translated: This is the meaning stated in the words “by the exclusion of the state of non-hearing.” Hence he says: “to show the apprehension of what is not deficient and not excessive and not erroneous.”

original: Savana-saddo cettha kammattho veditabbo “suyyatī”ti.
analyzed: savana saddaḥ ca ittha kammatthaḥ veditabbo
translated: And the word “hearing” should be understood here in the sense of the cause of hearing, as in the expression “it is heard.”

original: Evaṃ savanahetusavanavisesavasena padattayassa ekena pakārena atthayojanaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: evam savana hetu savana visesa vasena pada ttayassa ekena pakārena attha yojanam dassetvā
translated: Having thus shown the interpretation of the three terms in one way by way of the cause of hearing and the distinction in hearing,

original: idāni pakārantarehi taṃ dassetuṃ – “tathā eva”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tassāti yā sā
analyzed: idāni pakāra antarehi tam dassetum tathā eva ntiādi vuttam tattha tassa ati yā sā
translated: he now sets forth that interpretation by other ways, saying “Likewise, etc.” Herein, of that means of that

original: bhagavato sammukhā dhammassavanākārena pavattā manodvāraviññāṇavīthi, tassā. Sā hi
analyzed: bhagavato sammukhā dhamma ssavana ākārena pavattā manaḥ dvāra viññāṇa vīthi tassā sā hi
translated: mind-door adverting which occurred in the form of hearing the Dhamma face to face with the Blessed One. For that

original: nānappakārena ārammaṇe pavattituṃ samatthā. Tathā ca vuttaṃ – “sotadvārānusārenā”ti.
analyzed: nānā pakārena ārammaṇe pavattitum samatthā tathā ca vuttam sota dvāra anusārena ati
translated: is able to occur with respect to an object in various ways. And that is said thus: “By following the ear door” .

original: Nānappakārenāti vakkhamānānaṃ anekavihitānaṃ byañjanatthaggahaṇānaṃ nānākārena. Etena
analyzed: nānā pakārena ati vakkhamānānam aneka vihitānam byañjana attha ggahaṇānam nānā ākārena etena
translated: In various ways means in various ways of the various kinds of apprehension of the letter and the meaning that will be mentioned. By this

original: imissā yojanāya ākārattho evaṃ-saddo gahitoti dīpeti. Pavattibhāvappakāsananti pavattiyā
analyzed: imissā yojanāya ākāra atthaḥ evaṃsaddaḥ gahitaḥ iti dīpeti pavatti bhāva pakāsanam ti pavattiyā
translated: he shows that in this interpretation the word “thus” is taken in the sense of mode. Of the occurrence means of the occurrence of the

original: atthibhāvappakāsanaṃ. Sutanti dhammappakāsananti yasmiṃ ārammaṇe vuttappakārā viññāṇavīthi
analyzed: atthi bhāva ppakāsanam sutanti dhamma ppakāsanam ti yasmin ārammaṇe vutta ppakārā viññāṇa vīthi
translated: and the demonstration of the existence of the object.

original: nānappakārena pavattā, tassa dhammattā vuttaṃ, na sutasaddassa dhammatthattā. Vuttassevatthassa
analyzed: nānappakārena pavattā tassa dhamma ttā vuttam na suta saddassa dhamma ttha ttā vuttassa iva atthassa
translated: As to “heard”: the demonstration of the idea is that of the object in virtue of which the consciousness process occurs in the various ways stated above. It is not that the word “heard” is a word for the idea.🔽The demonstration of the object already stated is “This is here” .

original: pākaṭīkaraṇaṃ “ayañhetthā”tiādi. Tattha viññāṇavīthiyāti karaṇatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, mayāti kattuatthe.
analyzed: pākaṭīkaraṇam ayam ha itthā atiādi tattha viññāṇa vīthiyā iti karaṇa atthe karaṇa vacanam mayā iti kattu atthe
translated: Herein, “consciousness process” is a verbal noun in the sense of instrument ; “I” is a verbal noun in the sense of agent .

original: Evanti niddisitabbappakāsananti nidassanatthaṃ evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ nidassetabbassa
analyzed: evam ti niddisitabba ppakāsanam ti nidassana attham evaṃsaddam gahetvā vuttam nidassetabbassa
translated: As to “thus”: the word “thus” is stated by way of the demonstration of what is to be demonstrated.🔽Because of the non-existence of what is to be demonstrated,

original: nidassitabbattābhāvābhāvato. Tena evaṃ-saddena sakalampi suttaṃ paccāmaṭṭhanti dasseti.
analyzed: nidassitabba ttā bhāva abhāvataḥ tena evaṃsaddena sakalam pi suttam paccāmaṭṭhanti dasseti
translated: by that word “thus” the whole sutta is demonstrated.

original: Sutasaddassa kiriyāsaddattā savanakiriyāya ca sādhāraṇaviññāṇappabandhappaṭibaddhattā
analyzed: suta saddassa kiriyā sadda ttā savana kiriyāya ca sādhāraṇa viññāṇa ppabandha ppaṭibaddha ttā
translated: Because of the word “heard” being a verbal noun and because of the act of hearing being common to all the various consciousness processes,🔽and because of the expression of the person in that , it is said: “As to ‘heard’: the demonstration of the function of the person” .

original: tattha ca puggalavohāroti vuttaṃ – “sutanti puggalakiccappakāsana”nti. Na hi puggalavohārarahite
analyzed: tattha ca puggala vohāraḥ ti vuttam sutan ti puggala kicca ppakāsanan ti na hi puggala vohāra rahite
translated: For in the absence of the expression of the person,

original: dhammappabandhe savanakiriyā labbhatīti.
analyzed: dhammappabandhe savana kiriyā labbhati iti
translated: the act of hearing is not possible in the series of ideas.

original: Yassa cittasantānassātiādipi ākāratthameva evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā purimayojanāya aññathā🔽atthayojanaṃ dassetuṃ vuttaṃ. Tattha ākārapaññattīti upādāpaññatti eva dhammānaṃ🔽pavattiākārupādānavasena tathā vuttā. Sutanti visayaniddesoti sotabbabhūto dhammo
analyzed: yassa citta santānassa ati ādi pi ākāra attham eva evaṃsaddam gahetvā purima yojanāya aññathā  attha yojanam dassetum vuttam tattha ākāra paññatti iti upādā paññatti eva dhammānam  pavatti ākāra upādāna vasena tathā vuttā sutam nti visaya niddesaḥ ti sotabba bhūtaḥ dhammo
translated: The words “and of the continuity of consciousness” and so on are said in order to show the meaning of the word “thus” in another way, having taken it as meaning “mode,” in the way already stated.🔽Herein, “mode-description” is clinging-description, which is so called because of the clinging to the mode of occurrence of dhammas.

original: savanakiriyākattupuggalassa savanakiriyāvasena pavattiṭṭhānanti katvā vuttaṃ. Cittasantānavinimuttassa🔽paramatthato kassaci kattuabhāvepi saddavohārena buddhiparikappitabhedavacanicchāya🔽cittasantānato aññaṃ viya taṃsamaṅgiṃ katvā vuttaṃ – “cittasantānena taṃsamaṅgīno”ti.
analyzed: savana kiriyā kattu puggalassa savana kiriyā vasena pavatti ṭṭhānam ti katvā vuttam citta santāna vinimuttassa  paramatthataḥ kassaci kattu abhāve pi sadda vohārena buddhi parikappita bheda vacanicchāya  citta santānato aññam viya taṃsamaṅgim katvā vuttam citta santānena taṃsamaṅgīno ti
translated: “Sound” is the designation of the object. The object that is fit to be heard is said to be the “sound” because it is the basis for the occurrence of the person who performs the act of hearing by way of the act of hearing.🔽Although there is no real doer apart from the continuity of consciousness, still, by way of conventional expression, as if it were different from the continuity of consciousness, the continuity of consciousness is spoken of as the doer, having been made to possess the quality of the doer, by the desire to express the distinction that is imagined by the intellect.

original: Savanakiriyāvisayopi sotabbadhammo savanakiriyāvasena pavattacittasantānassa idha🔽paramatthato kattubhāvato, savanavasena cittapavattiyā eva vā savanakiriyābhāvato
analyzed: savana kiriyā visayaḥ api sotabba dhammo savana kiriyā vasena pavatta citta santānassa idha 🔽paramatthataḥ kattu bhāvato savana vasena citta pavattiyāḥ eva vā savana kiriyā bhāvato
translated: The object that is fit to be heard, which is the domain of the act of hearing, is said to be the “sound” because the continuity of consciousness that occurs by way of the act of hearing is the doer in the ultimate sense.🔽Or else, the act of hearing is the occurrence of consciousness by way of hearing, because there is no separate act of hearing apart from the occurrence of consciousness.

original: taṃkiriyākattu ca visayo hotīti katvā vuttaṃ – “taṃsamaṅgīno kattuvisaye”ti. Sutākārassa🔽ca therassa sammānicchitabhāvato āha – “gahaṇasanniṭṭhāna”nti. Etena vā avadhāraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ca visayaḥ hoti iti katvā vuttam suta ākārassa  ca therassa sammā nicchita bhāvataḥ āha gahaṇa sanniṭṭhānam ti etena vā avadhāraṇa attham
translated: and the object is the doing of that, thus it was said: “The doing of that is the object of the doing of that.”🔽And because the Elder Sāriputta’s mode of delivery was correct, it was said: “The determining of the apprehension.” By this

original: evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā ayamatthayojanā katāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: evaṃsaddam gahetvā ayam attha yojanā katā iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: the word eva is taken as having the meaning of “determining.” The interpretation should be regarded as follows.

original: Pubbe sutānaṃ nānāvihitānaṃ suttasaṅkhātānaṃ atthabyañjanānaṃ upadhāritarūpassa ākārassa
analyzed: pubbe sutānam nānā vihitānam sutta saṅkhātānam attha byañjanānam upadhārita rūpassa ākārassa
translated: The word eva has the meaning of “showing” or “determining” the mode of delivery of the various kinds of things heard, that is to say, the meaning of the text and the letters, which have been borne in mind,

original: nidassanassa, avadhāraṇassa vā pakāsanasabhāvo evaṃ-saddoti tadākārādiupadhāraṇassa
analyzed: nidassanassa avadhāraṇassa vā pakāsana sabhāvaḥ evaṃsaddaḥ ti tad ākāra ādi upadhāraṇassa
translated: or it has the meaning of “determining” that mode of delivery, etc., because it extends over the collection of states that are the basis for the designation of a person.

original: puggalapaññattiyā upādānabhūtadhammappabandhabyāpāratāya vuttaṃ – “evanti puggalakiccaniddeso”ti.
analyzed: puggala paññattiyāḥ upādāna bhūta dhamma ppabandha byāpāra tāya vuttam evam ti puggala kicca niddesaḥ ti
translated: Thus it was said: “Thus is the showing of the function of a person.”

original: Savanakiriyā pana puggalavādinopi viññāṇanirapekkhā natthīti visesato viññāṇabyāpāroti
analyzed: savana kiriyā pana puggala vādino pi viññāṇa nirapekkhā natthi iti visesataḥ viññāṇa byāpāraḥ ti
translated: But the act of hearing is not independent of consciousness even for one who holds the doctrine of the person, thus the function of consciousness is shown in particular.🔽Thus it was said: “Heard is the showing of the function of consciousness.”

original: āha – “sutanti viññāṇakiccaniddeso”ti. Meti saddappavattiyā ekanteneva sattavisayattā
analyzed: āha sutam ti viññāṇa kicca niddeso ti mā iti sadda ppavattiyā ekantena iva satta visaya ttā
translated: The word me is used because the occurrence of the word eva is exclusively the province of a person.

original: viññāṇakiccassa ca tattheva samodahitabbato “meti ubhayakiccayuttapuggalaniddeso”ti
analyzed: viññāṇa kiccassa ca tattha iva samodahitabbataḥ mā iti ubhaya kicca yutta puggala niddeso ti
translated: and the function of consciousness is included there too, so the expression “me” is a designation of a person who has both functions.

original: vuttaṃ. Avijjamānapaññattivijjamānapaññattisabhāvā yathākkamaṃ evaṃsaddasutasaddānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam avijjamāna paññatti vijjamāna paññatti sabhāvāḥ yathākkamam evaṃsadda suta saddānam
translated: The meaning of the words “thus” and “heard” is respectively the nature of a designation that is not found and the nature of a designation that is found.

original: atthāti te tathārūpapaññattiupādānabyāpārabhāvena dassento āha – “evanti puggalakiccaniddeso,
analyzed: attha iti te tathārūpa paññatti upādāna byāpāra bhāvena dassentaḥ āha evam ti puggala kicca niddeso
translated: Showing the meaning of these two words as the act of the person and the act of consciousness respectively, he says: “Thus is a designation of the person’s function,

original: sutanti viññāṇakiccaniddeso”ti. Ettha ca karaṇakiriyākattukammavisesappakāsanavasena
analyzed: sutam ti viññāṇa kicca niddeso ti ettha ca karaṇa kiriyā kattu kamma visesa pakāsana vasena
translated: heard is a designation of the function of consciousness.” And here the four interpretations of the second and following words should be understood as shown by the following method:🔽by pointing out the difference between the act of doing and the act of causing to be done,🔽by pointing out the difference between the act of the person and the object of the act of the person,

original: puggalabyāpāravisayapuggalabyāpāranidassanavasena gahaṇākāraggāhakatabbisayavisesaniddesavasena
analyzed: puggala byāpāra visaya puggala byāpāra nidassana vasena gahaṇa ākāra ggāhaka tad visaya visesa niddesa vasena
translated: by pointing out the difference between the object and the act of grasping, and

original: kattukaraṇabyāpārakattuniddesavasena ca dutiyādayo catasso atthayojanā dassitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: kattu karaṇa byāpāra kattu niddesa vasena ca dutiya ādayo catasso attha yojanā dassitā iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: by pointing out the difference between the act of the doer and the act of the instrument.

original: Sabbassapi saddādhigamanīyassa atthassa paññattimukheneva paṭipajjitabbattā sabbapaññattīnañca
analyzed: sabbassa api sadda adhigamanīyassa atthassa paññatti mukhena iva paṭipajjitabba ttā sabba paññattīnam ca
translated: The meaning of all the words that are to be understood from the sound must be approached by way of the designations only, and all the designations are included in the four truths.

original: vijjamānādivasena chasu paññattibhedesu antogadhattā tesu “eva”ntiādīnaṃ paññattīnaṃ🔽sarūpaṃ niddhārento āha – “evanti ca meti cā”tiādi. Tattha evanti ca meti ca vuccamānassatthassa
analyzed: vijjamāna ādi vasena chasu paññatti bhedesu tesu eva nti ādīnam paññattīnam  sarūpam niddhārentaḥ āha evam iti ca mā iti ca atiādi tattha evam iti ca mā iti ca vuccamānassa atthassa
translated: The words “thus” and “mine” are included among the six kinds of determinations, namely, those that are existent, etc., according to their nature.🔽The words “thus” and “mine” are determinations that do not exist in the ultimate sense of reality.

original: ākārādino dhammānaṃ asallakkhaṇabhāvato avijjamānapaññattibhāvoti āha – “saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasena
analyzed: ākāra ādinaḥ dhammānam asat lakkhaṇa bhāvataḥ avijjamāna paññatti bhāvo ti āha saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena
translated: The words “thus” and “mine” are determinations that do not exist in the ultimate sense of reality.🔽The words “thus” and “mine” are determinations that do not exist in the ultimate sense of reality.

original: avijjamānapaññattī”ti. Tattha saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasenāti bhūtatthauttamatthavasena.🔽Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yo māyāmarīciādayo viya abhūtattho, anussavādīhi gahetabbo viya🔽anuttamattho ca na hoti, so rūpasaddādisabhāvo, ruppanānubhavanādisabhāvo vā attho
analyzed: a vijjamāna paññatti iti tattha saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena ati bhūtattha auttamattha vasena  idam vuttam hoti yaḥ māyā marīci ādayaḥ viya abhūta atthaḥ anussava ādīhi gahetabbaḥ viya  anuttama atthaḥ ca na hoti saḥ rūpa sadda ādi sabhāvaḥ ruppana anubhavana ādi sabhāvaḥ vā attho
translated: The words “thus” and “mine” are determinations that do not exist in the ultimate sense of reality.🔽The words “thus” and “mine” are determinations that do not exist in the ultimate sense of reality.

original: saccikaṭṭho paramattho cāti vuccati, na tathā “evaṃ me”tipadānaṃ atthoti. Etamevatthaṃ
analyzed: saccikaṭṭhaḥ paramattho ca ati vuccati na tathā evam mā iti padānam attho ti etam eva attham
translated: The words “thus” and “mine” are determinations that do not exist in the ultimate sense of reality.

original: pākaṭataraṃ kātuṃ “kiñhettha ta”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Sutanti pana saddāyatanaṃ sandhāyāha
analyzed: pākaṭataram kātum kiñha ittha tanti ādi vuttam su tanti pana sadda āyatanam sandhāya āha
translated: In order to make this clearer, he says, “What is there in that?”🔽“The heard is the sound base” is said with reference to the sound base.

original: – “vijjamānapaññattī”ti. Teneva hi “yañhi taṃ ettha sotena upaladdha”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vijjamāna paññattī iti tena iva hi yat hi tam ettha sotena upaladdhan ti vuttam
translated: For it is said, “What is here apprehended by the ear” .

original: “Sotadvārānusārena upaladdha”nti pana vutte atthabyañjanādi sabbaṃ labbhati. Taṃ🔽taṃ upādāya vattabbatoti sotapathamāgate dhamme upādāya tesaṃ upadhāritākārādino
analyzed: sota dvāra anusārena pana vutte attha byañjana ādi sabbam labbhati tam  tam upādāya vattabbato ti sota pathama āgate dhamme upādāya tesam upadhārita ākāra ādinaḥ
translated: But if it is said, “apprehended by the sound door,” then the meaning, the letter, etc., are all included.🔽Because it must be stated with reference to this or that,🔽when the dhammas have come into the ear’s range, it must be stated with reference to the aggregates included in one’s own continuity, in the manner of recollecting their aspects, etc.,

original: paccāmasanavasena evanti, sasantatipariyāpanne khandhe upādāya meti vattabbattāti🔽attho. Diṭṭhādisabhāvarahite saddāyatane pavattamānopi sutavohāro “dutiyaṃ tatiya”ntiādiko
analyzed: pacca āmasana vasena evanti sa santati pariyāpanne khandhe upādāya mā iti vattabbattā ti  atthaḥ diṭṭha ādi sabhāva rahite sadda āyatane pavattamānaḥ api suta vohāraḥ dutiyam tatiya nti ādiko
translated: by way of the mode of apprehension.🔽The heard mode of expression, which occurs in the sound base devoid of the nature of the seen, etc.,🔽like the expression “the second, the third,” etc., occurs with reference to the seen, the heard, and the cognized, etc., beginning with the first.

original: viya paṭhamādīni diṭṭhamutaviññāte apekkhitvā pavattoti āha – “diṭṭhādīni upanidhāya
analyzed: viya paṭhama ādīni diṭṭha muta viññāte apekkhitvā pavatto ti āha diṭṭha ādīni upanidhāya
translated: Therefore he says, “Because it must be stated with reference to the seen, etc.”

original: vattabbato”ti. Assutaṃ na hotīti hi sutanti pakāsito ayamatthoti.
analyzed: vattabbataḥ ti assutam na hoti iti hi sutam ti pakāsitaḥ ayam attho ti
translated: “The heard is not the unheard” is the meaning that is made clear.

original: Attanā paṭividdhā suttassa pakāravisesā evanti therena paccāmaṭṭhāti āha – “asammohaṃ🔽dīpetī”ti. Nānappakārappaṭivedhasamattho hotīti etena vakkhamānassa suttassa nānappakārataṃ
analyzed: attanā paṭividdhā suttassa pakāra visesā evanti therena paccāmaṭṭhā ti āha asammoham  dīpeti iti nānā pakāra paṭivedha samatthaḥ hoti iti etena vakkhamānassa suttassa nānā ppakāra taṃ
translated: The Elder replied: “The Elder’s reply is a particular way of answering the question asked. The meaning is: ‘The Elder has answered by way of his own penetration of the sutta.’ ”🔽“He becomes capable of penetrating the various aspects” : this shows that the sutta to be expounded has various aspects and is difficult to penetrate.

original: duppaṭivijjhatañca dasseti. Sutassa asammosaṃ dīpetīti sutākārassa yāthāvato dassiyamānattā
analyzed: duppaṭivijjhatam ca dasseti sutassa asammosam dīpeti iti suta ākārassa yāthāvataḥ dassiyamāna ttā
translated: “He shows the non-forgetting of the sutta” : this is said because the form of the sutta is shown as it really is.

original: vuttaṃ. Asammohenāti sammohābhāvena, paññāya eva vā savanakālasambhūtāya taduttarikālapaññāsiddhi.
analyzed: vuttam asammohena ati sammoha abhāvena paññāya eva vā savana kāla sambhūtāya tad uttari kāla paññā siddhi
translated: “By non-forgetting” : by the absence of forgetting, or by the wisdom arisen at the time of hearing, which is the establishment of wisdom at a later time.

analyzed: evam me sutam ti vadantena ayam pi atthaḥ vibhāvito ti dassanato keci pana devatānam
translated: because it shows that the meaning is also implied by the words “Thus have I heard.” But some say that the words “Thus have I heard”🔽are spoken by the Elder Ānanda in order to inspire confidence in the listeners.

original: parivitakkāpekkhaṃ tathāvacananti edisī codanā anavakāsā”ti vadanti. Tasmiṃ kira🔽khaṇe ekaccānaṃ devatānaṃ evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi “bhagavā parinibbuto, ayañca
analyzed: parivitakka apekkham edisī codanā anavakāsā iti vadanti tasmin kira  khaṇe ekaccānam devatānam evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi bhagavā parinibbutaḥ ayam ca
translated: “Such a charge is impossible, since it is the thought of the devas that is expressed in the words of the Buddha.”

original: āyasmā desanākusalo idāni dhammaṃ deseti, sakyakulappasuto tathāgatassa bhātā cūḷapituputto,
analyzed: āyasman desanā kusalaḥ idāni dhammam deseti sakya kula ppasutaḥ tathāgatassa bhātā cūḷa pitu putto
translated: At that moment, it is said, the following thought occurred to some devas: “The Exalted One has attained final Nibbāna, and this venerable one, who is skilled in teaching, is now teaching the Dhamma. He is the cousin of the Tathāgata, the son of his paternal aunt, born after the Exalted One.

original: kiṃ nu kho sayaṃ sacchikataṃ dhammaṃ deseti, udāhu bhagavato eva vacanaṃ yathāsuta”nti,
analyzed: kim nu kho sayam sacchikatam dhammam deseti udāhu bhagavataḥ eva vacanam yathāsutam ti
translated: Does he teach the Dhamma that he himself has realized, or is he teaching the words of the Exalted One as he has heard them?”

original: evaṃ tadāsaṅkitappakārato asappurisabhūmisamokkamādito atikkamādi vibhāvitanti. Attano🔽adahantoti “mameda”nti attani aṭṭhapento. Appetīti nidasseti. Diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthesu
analyzed: evam tad āsaṅkita ppakārataḥ asappurisa bhūmi samokkama āditaḥ atikkama ādi vibhāvitanti attanaḥ  a dahantaḥ ti mama idam ti attani aṭṭhapentaḥ appeti iti nidasseti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthesu
translated: Thus the Netti was expounded in order to remove the doubts of those devas, in order to lead them to the stage of a true man, and in order to transcend the stage of the worldling.

original: yathārahaṃ satte netīti netti, dhammoyeva netti dhammanetti.
analyzed: yathāraham satte neti iti netti dhammoyā iva netti dhamma netti
translated: “Not appropriating as his own”: not establishing as his own by thinking “mine.” “He guides”: he shows. He guides beings in accordance with their worthiness in regard to the highest good in this life and in future lives. “The guide of the Dhamma”: the Dhamma itself is the guide.

original: Daḷhataraniviṭṭhā vicikicchā kaṅkhā. Nātisaṃsappanaṃ matibhedamattaṃ vimati. Assaddhiyaṃ
analyzed: daḷhatara niviṭṭhā vicikicchā kaṅkhā na ati saṃsappanam mati bheda mattam vimati
translated: Doubt is a wavering of the mind that is firmly fixed. Uncertainty is a mere difference of opinion, not a wavering. Lack of faith is a lack of confidence.

original: vināseti bhagavatā bhāsitattā sammukhā cassa paṭiggahitattā khalitaduruttādiggahaṇadosābhāvato🔽ca. Ettha ca pañcamādayo tisso atthayojanā ākārādiatthesu aggahitavisesameva evaṃ-saddaṃ
analyzed: vināsā iti bhagavatā bhāsita ttā sammukhā ca ssa paṭiggahita ttā khalita durutta ādi ggahaṇa dosa abhāvato  ca ettha ca pañcama ādayaḥ tissaḥ attha yojanāḥ ākāra ādi atthesu agga hita visesam eva evaṃsaddam
translated: because it is spoken by the Blessed One, and because it is accepted by him face to face, and because it is free from the faults of faltering, mispronunciation, etc.

original: gahetvā dassitā, tato parā catasso ākāratthameva evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā vibhāvitā, pacchimā
analyzed: gahetvā dassitā tatas parā catassaḥ ākāra attham eva evaṃsaddam gahetvā vibhāvitā pacchimā
translated: And here the three interpretations of the word “only” beginning with the fifth are shown by taking the word “only” as referring to the meaning of “mode,” etc., without any distinction. The next four are demonstrated by taking the word “only” as referring to the meaning of “mode.”

original: pana tisso yathākkamaṃ ākāratthaṃ nidassanatthaṃ avadhāraṇatthañca evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā🔽yojitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Eka-saddo aññaseṭṭhaasahāyasaṅkhādīsu dissati. Tathā hesa “sassato attā ca loko ca,🔽idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti ittheke abhivadantī”tiādīsu aññatthe dissati, “cetaso
analyzed: pana tissaḥ yathākkamam ākāra attham nidassana ttham avadhāraṇa attham ca evaṃsaddam gahetvā  yojitā iti daṭṭhabbam  eka saddaḥ añña seṭṭha asahāya saṅkha ādīsu dissati tathā ha isa sassataḥ attā ca loko ca  idam eva saccam mogham aññanti itthā ike abhivadanti iti ādīsu aññatthe dissati cetasaḥ
translated: But the last three should be regarded as being applied by taking the word “only” as referring to the meaning of “mode,” “indication,” and “restriction” respectively.🔽The word “one” is found in the sense of “another,” “best,” “without a companion,” “a part,” and so on. Thus it is found in the sense of “another” in such passages as “The self and the world are eternal,

original: ekodibhāva”ntiādīsu seṭṭhe, “eko vūpakaṭṭho”tiādīsu asahāye “ekova kho, bhikkhave,
analyzed: eka udi bhāvanti ādīsu seṭṭhe ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ ti ādīsu asahāye ekaḥ uva kho bhikkhave
translated: this alone is the truth, other ideas are silly” . In such passages as “Unification of mind” it is found in the sense of “best.” In such passages as “Alone, secluded” it is found in the sense of “without a companion.” In such passages as “Bhikkhus, there is the one-way path” it is found in the sense of “a part.”

original: khaṇo ca samayo ca brahmacariyavāsāyā”tiādīsu saṅkhāyaṃ. Idhāpi saṅkhāyanti dassento
analyzed: khaṇo ca samayo ca brahmacariya vāsāya ati ādīsu saṅkhāyam idha api saṅkhāyanti dassento
translated: in the sense of reckoning, as in the passage: “The time and the occasion are out of joint for the life of chastity” . Here too he shows that they are reckoned thus.

original: āha – “ekanti gaṇanaparicchedaniddeso”ti. Kālañca samayañcāti yuttakālañca paccayasāmaggiñca.
analyzed: āha ekam ti gaṇana pariccheda niddeso ti kālañca samayañca ati yutta kālañca paccaya sāmaggiñca
translated: He says: “The word ‘time’ is a term for reckoning and delimiting” . “Time and occasion”: suitable time and the coming together of conditions.

original: Khaṇoti okāso. Tathāgatuppādādiko hi maggabrahmacariyassa okāso tappaccayappaṭilābhahetuttā.
analyzed: okāsaḥ tathāgata uppāda ādikaḥ hi magga brahmacariyassa okāsaḥ tad paccaya ppaṭilābha hetu ttā
translated: “Moment”: opportunity. For the appearance of a Buddha, etc., is the opportunity for the life of purity, the path, because it is the cause for the obtaining of its conditions.

original: Khaṇo eva ca samayo. Yo khaṇoti ca samayoti ca vuccati, so eko evāti hi attho. Mahāsamayoti
analyzed: khaṇaḥ eva ca samayaḥ yaḥ khaṇo ti ca samayo ti ca vuccati saḥ ekaḥ evā ati hi atthaḥ mahāsamayo ti
translated: And the moment is the occasion. The meaning is that what is called “moment” and “occasion” is one and the same thing.🔽“Great occasion”: a great multitude.🔽“Occasion” is also a cause for fulfilling the training precepts.

original: mahāsamūho. Samayopi khoti sikkhāpadapūraṇassa hetupi. Samayappavādaketi diṭṭhippavādake.
analyzed: mahā samūhaḥ samayaḥ api kho ti sikkhāpada pūraṇassa hetu pi samaya ppavādake iti diṭṭhi ppavādake
translated: “Occasion-proclaimers”: proponents of views.🔽For the sectarians sit there proclaiming their own occasions.

original: Tattha hi nisinnā titthiyā attano attano samayaṃ pavadantīti. Atthābhisamayāti hitappaṭilābhā.
analyzed: tattha hi nisinnā titthiyā attanaḥ attanaḥ samayam pavadanti iti attha abhisamayā ati hita paṭilābhā
translated: “Attainment of the good”: the obtaining of the good.

original: Abhisametabboti abhisamayo, abhisamayo attho abhisamayaṭṭhoti pīḷanādīni abhisametabbabhāvena
analyzed: abhisametabbo ti abhisamayaḥ abhisamayaḥ atthaḥ abhisamaya ṭṭho ti pīḷana ādīni abhisametabba bhāvena
translated: “Attainment” is that which is to be attained, the meaning of attainment. The meaning of attainment is the afflictions, etc., which are to be attained.

original: ekībhāvaṃ upanetvā vuttāni. Abhisamayassa vā paṭivedhassa visayabhūto attho abhisamayaṭṭhoti
analyzed: ekībhāvam upanetvā vuttāni abhisamayassa vā paṭivedhassa visaya bhūtaḥ atthaḥ abhisamaya ṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: and so they are called “the meaning of penetration.” Or the meaning that is the province of penetration, of penetration-comprehension, is the meaning of penetration.

original: tāneva tathā ekattena vuttāni. Tattha pīḷanaṃ dukkhasaccassa taṃsamaṅgino hiṃsanaṃ
analyzed: tāni eva tathā ekattena vuttāni tattha pīḷanam dukkha saccassa tad samaṅginaḥ hiṃsanam
translated: and so they are called “the meaning of penetration” in that they are so in the sense of unity. Herein, oppressing is the meaning of the truth of suffering. For the truth of suffering oppresses by oppressing with the oppression of pain, etc.,

original: avipphārikatākaraṇaṃ. Santāpo dukkhadukkhatādivasena santapanaṃ paridahanaṃ.
analyzed: a vipphārika tā karaṇam santāpaḥ dukkha dukkha tā ādi vasena santapanam paridahanam
translated: and by preventing spreading out. Burning is the meaning of the truth of origin. For the truth of origin burns by burning with the burning of pain, etc., and by not allowing the escape of the heat generated.

original: Tattha sahakārikāraṇe sanijjhaṃ sameti samavetīti samayo, samavāyo. Sameti samāgacchati
analyzed: tattha sahakāri kāraṇe sanijjham sameti samaveti iti samayaḥ samavāyaḥ sameti samāgacchati
translated: Herein, the condition that is a co-arisen cause is a conjunction, a concurrence, a concurrence-condition. It is a conjunction, a concurrence, because it comes together, it comes together, with that.🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .🔽Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .

original: ettha maggabrahmacariyaṃ tadādhārapuggalehīti samayo, khaṇo. Sameti ettha, etena🔽vā saṃgacchati satto, sabhāvadhammo vā sahajātādīhi, uppādādīhi vāti samayo, kālo.
analyzed: ettha magga brahmacariyam tad ādhāra puggalehi iti samayaḥ khaṇo sameti ettha etena  vā saṃgacchati sattaḥ sa bhāva dhammaḥ vā sahajāta ādīhi uppāda ādīhi vā ati samayaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Herein, the life of purity that is the path is the opportunity for the person who is the basis of that . It is an opportunity because it comes together, it comes together, with that .

original: Dhammappavattimattatāya atthato abhūtopi hi kālo dhammappavattiyā adhikaraṇaṃ karaṇaṃ🔽viya ca kappanāmattasiddhena rūpena voharīyatīti. Samaṃ, saha vā avayavānaṃ ayanaṃ
analyzed: dhamma ppavatti matta tāya atthataḥ abhūtaḥ api hi kālaḥ dhamma ppavattiyāḥ adhikaraṇam karaṇam 🔽ca kappanā matta siddhena rūpena voharīyati iti samam saha vai avayavānam ayanam
translated: Herein, the life

original: pavatti avaṭṭhānanti samayo, samūho yathā “samudāyo”ti. Avayavasahāvaṭṭhānameva hi
analyzed: pavatti avaṭṭhānanti samayaḥ samūhaḥ yathā samudāyaḥ iti avayava saha avaṭṭhānam eva hi
translated: “Time” is the non-disappearance of the occurrence, as “collection” is. For a collection is just the non-disappearance of the combination of the parts.

original: samūhoti. Avasesapaccayānaṃ samāgame eti phalaṃ etasmā uppajjati pavattati cāti samayo,
analyzed: samūhaḥ ti avasesa paccayānam samāgame eti phalam etasmai uppajjati pavattati ca ati samayaḥ
translated: “Time” is the fruit that arises and occurs from the combination of the remaining conditions,

original: hetu yathā “samudayo”ti. Sameti saṃyojanabhāvato sambaddho eti attano visaye pavattati,
analyzed: hetu yathā sameti saṃyojana bhāvato sambaddhaḥ eti attanaḥ visaye pavattati
translated: as “arising” is from a cause. “Time” is that by which beings are bound by the state of being fettered, and go, occur, in their own sphere,

original: daḷhaggahaṇabhāvato vā saṃyuttā ayanti pavattanti sattā yathābhinivesaṃ etenāti samayo,
analyzed: daḷha ggahaṇa bhāvataḥ vā saṃyuttāḥ ayanti pavattanti sattāḥ yathā abhinivesam etena ati samayaḥ
translated: or by which they are bound by the state of firm grasping, and go, occur, according to their own adherence.

original: diṭṭhi. Diṭṭhisaṃyojanena hi sattā ativiya bajjhantīti. Samiti saṅgati samodhānanti
analyzed: diṭṭhi diṭṭhi saṃyojanena hi sattāḥ ativiya bajjhanti iti samiti saṅgati samodhānanti
translated: “Time” is view. For beings are greatly fettered by the fetter of views. “Time” is the meeting, the gathering together, the combination,

original: samayo, paṭilābho. Samassa yānaṃ, sammā vā yānaṃ apagamoti samayo, pahānaṃ. Abhimukhaṃ🔽ñāṇena sammā etabbo abhisametabboti abhisamayo, dhammānaṃ aviparīto sabhāvo. Abhimukhabhāvena
analyzed: samayaḥ paṭilābhaḥ samassa yānam sammā vā yānam apagamaḥ ti samayaḥ pahānam abhimukham  ñāṇena sammā etabbaḥ abhisametabbaḥ ti abhisamayaḥ dhammānam aviparītaḥ sabhāvaḥ abhimukha bhāvena
translated: of the conditions. “Time” is the attainment. “Time” is the going of the same, or the right going, or the departure.🔽“Time” is the abandoning. “Time” is the right penetration by knowledge, the right reaching, the right understanding.🔽“Time” is the unperverted individual essence of dhammas. “Time” is the right going, the right occurrence, the right awakening, by the state of being faced to.

original: sammā eti gacchati bujjhatīti abhisamayo, dhammānaṃ aviparītasabhāvāvabodho. Evaṃ
analyzed: sammā eti gacchati bujjhati iti abhisamayaḥ dhammānam aviparīta sabhāva avabodhaḥ evam
translated: Thus “time” is the understanding of the unperverted individual essence of dhammas.

original: tasmiṃ tasmiṃ atthe samayasaddassa pavatti veditabbā. Samayasaddassa atthuddhāre🔽abhisamayasaddassa udāharaṇaṃ vuttanayena veditabbaṃ. Assāti samayasaddassa. Kālo
analyzed: tasmin tasmin atthe samaya saddassa pavatti veditabbā samaya saddassa attha uddhāre  abhisamaya saddassa udāharaṇam vutta nayena veditabbam assa ati samaya saddassa kālo
translated: The word “occasion” should be understood to occur in this and that sense.🔽The word “realization” should be understood to be used in the same way as the word “occasion.”

original: attho samavāyādīnaṃ atthānaṃ idha asambhavato, desadesakaparisānaṃ viya suttassa
analyzed: atthaḥ samavāya ādīnam atthānam idha asambhavataḥ desa desaka parisānam viya suttassa
translated: The meaning of “time” is the meaning of “occasion.”

original: nidānabhāvena kālassa apadisitabbato ca.
analyzed: nidāna bhāvena kālassa ca
translated: The meaning of “occasion” is the meaning of “time.”

original: Kasmā panettha aniyamitavaseneva kālo niddiṭṭho, na utusaṃvaccharādivasena niyametvāti
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha a niyamita vasena iva kālaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ na utu saṃvacchara ādi vasena niyametvā ati
translated: Why is time stated here in a general way, and not specified as “season,” “year,” etc.?

original: āha – “tattha kiñcāpī”tiādi. Utusaṃvaccharādivasena niyamaṃ akatvā samayasaddassa
analyzed: āha tattha kiñcāpi itiādi utu saṃvacchara ādi vasena niyamam a katvā samaya saddassa
translated: He says, “Although it is so,” etc.🔽By stating the word “occasion” without specifying it as “season,” “year,” etc., this advantage is gained:🔽he shows that the word “occasion” is used in the sense of “time.”

original: vacane ayampi guṇo laddho hotīti dassento “ye vā ime”tiādimāha. Sāmaññajotanā hi
analyzed: vacane ayam pi guṇaḥ laddhaḥ hoti iti dassentaḥ ye vā ime iti ādim āha sāmañña jotanā hi
translated: The general indication

original: visese avatiṭṭhatīti. Tattha diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārasamayo devasikaṃ jhānasamāpattīhi
analyzed: visese avatiṭṭhati iti tattha diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra samayaḥ devasikam jhāna samāpattīhi
translated: remains in the particular.

original: vītināmanakālo, visesato sattasattāhāni. Suppakāsāti dasasahassilokadhātuyā pakampanaobhāsapātubhāvādīhi
analyzed: vītināmana kālaḥ visesataḥ satta satta ahāni dasa sahassi lokadhātuyā
translated: The time of fulfilment is especially the seven weeks. It is well proclaimed: it is evident through the quaking, the lighting up of the world, and so on, of the ten-thousandfold world-element.🔽In order to show that in the various occasions mentioned above a part is included in another, he said, “And the occasion for the exercise of knowledge” .🔽For the occasion for the exercise of knowledge and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself are the occasion of enlightenment;

original: pākaṭā. Yathāvuttabhedesu eva samayesu ekadesaṃ pakārantarehi saṅgahetvā dassetuṃ
analyzed: pākaṭāḥ yathā vutta bhedesu eva samayesu eka desam pakāra antarehi saṅgahetvā dassetum
translated: the occasion for the noble silence is the occasion for abiding in bliss here and now; the occasion for the exercise of compassion and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others are the occasion for teaching the Dhamma and the occasion for preaching.🔽The compound “occasion for the exercise of knowledge” is to be resolved as “the occasion for the exercise of knowledge and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself.”🔽The compound “occasion for the exercise of compassion” is to be resolved as “the occasion for the exercise of compassion and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others.”🔽The compound “occasion for preaching” is to be resolved as “the occasion for preaching and the occasion for teaching the Dhamma.”🔽The compound “occasion for the exercise of knowledge” is to be resolved as “the occasion for the exercise of knowledge and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself.”

original: “yo cāya”ntiādimāha. Tathā hi ñāṇakiccasamayo attahitappaṭipattisamayo ca abhisambodhisamayo,
analyzed: yaḥ ca ayanti ādim āha tathā hi ñāṇa kicca samayaḥ atta hita paṭipatti samayaḥ ca abhisambodhi samayaḥ
translated: For the occasion for the exercise of knowledge and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself are the occasion of enlightenment;

original: ariyatuṇhībhāvasamayo diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārasamayo, karuṇākiccaparahitappaṭipattidhammikathāsamayo desanāsamayoyeva.
analyzed: ariya tuṇhībhāva samayaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra samayaḥ karuṇā kicca para hita ppaṭipatti dhammikathā samayaḥ desanā samayaḥ yeva
translated: the occasion for the noble silence is the occasion for abiding in bliss here and now; the occasion for the exercise of compassion and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others are the occasion for teaching the Dhamma and the occasion for preaching.

original: Karaṇavacanena niddeso katoti sambandho. Tatthāti abhidhammavinayesu. Tathāti bhummakaraṇehi.
analyzed: karaṇa vacanena niddeso kato ti sambandho tattha āti abhidhamma vinayesu tathā iti bhumma karaṇehi
translated: The compound “occasion for preaching” is to be resolved as “the occasion for preaching and the occasion for teaching the Dhamma.”🔽The compound “occasion for the exercise of knowledge” is to be resolved as “the occasion for the exercise of knowledge and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself.”

original: Adhikaraṇattho ādhārattho. Bhāvo nāma kiriyā, kiriyāya kiriyantaralakkhaṇaṃ bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇaṃ.🔽Tattha yathā kālo sabhāvadhammaparicchinno sayaṃ paramatthato avijjamānopi ādhārabhāvena
analyzed: adhikaraṇa atthaḥ ādhāra atthaḥ bhāvaḥ nāma kiriyā kiriyāya kiriya antara lakkhaṇam bhāvenabhāva lakkhaṇam 🔽tattha yathā kālaḥ sabhāva dhamma paricchinno sayam paramatthataḥ a vijjamānaḥ api ādhāra bhāvena
translated: For the occasion for the exercise of knowledge and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself are the occasion of enlightenment;🔽the occasion for the noble silence is the occasion for abiding in bliss here and now; the occasion for the exercise of compassion and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others are the occasion for teaching the Dhamma and the occasion for preaching

original: paññāto taṅkhaṇappavattānaṃ tato pubbe parato ca abhāvato “pubbaṇhe jāto, sāyanhe🔽gacchatī”ti ca ādīsu, samūho ca avayavavinimutto avijjamānopi kappanāmattasiddho🔽avayavānaṃ ādhārabhāvena paññāpīyati “rukkhe sākhā, yavarāsiyaṃ sambhūto”tiādīsu,
analyzed: paññātaḥ taṅkhaṇa ppavattānam tatas pubbe paratas ca abhāvato pubbaṇhe jātaḥ sāyanhe  gacchati iti ca ādīsu samūhaḥ ca avayava vinimuttaḥ avijjamānaḥ api kappanā matta siddho  avayavānam ādhāra bhāvena paññāpīyati rukkhe sākhā yavarāsiyam sambhūtā uti ādīsu

original: cittassa uppādakiriyā, phassādīnaṃ bhavanakiriyā ca lakkhīyatīti. Yasmiṃ samayeti
analyzed: cittassa uppāda kiriyā phassa ādīnam bhavana kiriyā ca yasmin samaye ti
translated: and the characteristic of the arising of consciousness and the characteristic of the occurrence of contact, etc., are discerned.

original: yasmiṃ navame khaṇe, yasmiṃ yonisomanasikārādihetumhi, paccayasamavāye vā sati kāmāvacaraṃ
analyzed: yasmin navame khaṇe yasmin yoni somanasikāra ādi hetumhi paccaya samavāye vā sati kāmāvacaram
translated: In the same moment: in the same ninth moment, in the same cause consisting of right reflection, etc., or in the same concurrence of conditions.

original: kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, tasmiṃyeva khaṇe hetumhi paccayasamavāye ca phassādayopi
analyzed: kusalam cittam uppannam hoti tasmiṃ yeva khaṇe hetumhi paccaya samavāye ca phassa ādayaḥ api
translated: When a profitable consciousness of the sense sphere has arisen, in that same moment, in that same cause, and in that same concurrence of conditions, contact, etc.,

original: hontīti ubhayattha samayasadde bhummaniddeso kato lakkhaṇabhūtabhāvayuttoti dassento
analyzed: honti iti ubhayattha samaya sadde bhumma niddeso kataḥ lakkhaṇa bhūta bhāva yuttaḥ ti dassento
translated: also occur. So the words “in the same moment” are used to show that the exposition of the plane is combined with the characteristic of being.

original: āha – “khaṇa…pe… lakkhīyatī”ti.
analyzed: āha khaṇape lakkhīyati iti
translated: He said: “In the same moment … are discerned” .

original: Hetuattho karaṇattho ca sambhavati “annena vasati, ajjhenena vasati, pharasunā chindati,🔽kudālena khaṇatī”tiādīsu viya. Vītikkamañhi sutvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā otiṇṇe
analyzed: hetu attho karaṇa attho ca sambhavati annena vasati ajjhenena vasati pharasunā chindati  kudālena khaṇati iti ādīsu viya vītikkaman hi sutvā bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā otiṇṇe
translated: The meaning of cause and the meaning of instrument are applicable here, as in such passages as “He lives by alms” , “He lives by medicine” , “He cuts with a knife” ,🔽“He digs with a hoe” . For after hearing of the transgression, the bhikkhu should assemble the community of bhikkhus, and after questioning the individual concerned about the matter he has transgressed,

original: vatthusmiṃ taṃ puggalaṃ paṭipucchitvā vigarahitvā ca taṃ taṃ vatthuṃ otiṇṇakālaṃ
analyzed: vatthusmim tam puggalam paṭipucchitvā vigarahitvā ca tam tam vatthum otiṇṇa kālam
translated: and after rebuking him, he should announce the time of the transgression, saying:

original: anatikkamitvā teneva kālena sikkhāpadāni paññāpento bhagavā viharati sikkhāpadapaññattihetuñca🔽apekkhamāno tatiyapārājikādīsu viya.
analyzed: an atikkamitvā tena iva kālena sikkhāpadāni paññāpentaḥ bhagavā viharati sikkhāpada paññatti hetuñca  apekkhamāno tatiya pārājika ādīsu viya
translated: The Blessed One, in laying down the training rules, does not wait until the time has passed beyond the scope of the training rules.

original: Accantameva ārambhato paṭṭhāya yāva desanāniṭṭhānaṃ parahitappaṭipattisaṅkhātena
analyzed: accantam eva ārambhataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva desanā niṭṭhānam para hita paṭipatti saṅkhātena
translated: He does so, looking to the reason for laying down the training rules, as in the case of the third offense entailing expulsion, etc.

original: karuṇāvihārena. Tadatthajotanatthanti accantasaṃyogatthajotanatthaṃ. Upayogavacananiddeso
analyzed: karuṇā vihārena tad attha jotana ttham ti upayoga vacana niddeso
translated: From the time of the origin of the offense until the conclusion of the teaching, he dwells in compassion, which is the practice for the benefit of others.🔽The purpose of the explanation is to show the meaning of “absolute connection.” The expression “use” is explained

original: kato yathā “māsaṃ ajjhetī”ti. Porāṇāti aṭṭhakathācariyā. Abhilāpamattabhedoti vacanamattena
analyzed: kataḥ yathā māsam ajjheti iti porāṇāḥ ati aṭṭhakathā cariyāḥ abhilāpa matta bhedo ti vacana mattena
translated: as “to take up,” as in “he takes up a month.” “The ancient teachers” are the teachers of the commentaries. “The difference is merely verbal” means that the difference is merely in the words.

original: viseso. Tena suttavinayesu vibhattibyattayo katoti dasseti.
analyzed: visesaḥ tena sutta vinayesu vibhatti byattayaḥ kato ti dasseti
translated: This shows that the analysis and the explanation are done in the discourses and the Monastic Law.

original: Idāni “bhagavā”ti imassa atthaṃ dassento āha – “bhagavāti garū”tiādi. Bhagavāti vacanaṃ
analyzed: idāni bhagavā iti imassa attham dassentaḥ āha bhagavā iti garu uti ādi bhagavā iti vacanam
translated: Now, in order to show the meaning of “the Blessed One,” he says, “The Blessed One is the teacher.” The word “Blessed One”

original: seṭṭhanti seṭṭhavācakaṃ vacanaṃ, seṭṭhaguṇasahacaraṇaṃ seṭṭhanti vuttaṃ. Atha vā
analyzed: seṭṭham ti seṭṭha vācakam vacanam seṭṭha guṇa sahacaraṇam seṭṭham iti vuttam atha vā
translated: is the best word. It is a word that expresses the best, and it is said to be associated with the best qualities. Or else,

original: vuccatīti vacanaṃ, attho. Yasmā yo “bhagavā”ti vacanena vacanīyo attho, so seṭṭhoti
analyzed: vuccati iti vacanam atthaḥ yasmai yaḥ bhagavā ati vacanena vacanīyaḥ attho so seṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: “The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is this: the meaning that is to be expressed by the word ‘Blessed’ is the best,🔽since the Blessed One is the best of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the highest,🔽since the word ‘Blessed’ is the highest of all words. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most excellent,

original: attho. Bhagavāti vacanamuttamanti etthāpi eseva nayo. Gāravayuttoti garubhāvayutto
analyzed: atthaḥ bhagavā ati vacanam uttaman ti ettha api esā iva nayaḥ gārava yutto ti garu bhāva yuttaḥ
translated: since the Blessed One is the most excellent of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most sublime,🔽since the Blessed One is the most sublime of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of offerings,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of offerings of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of gifts,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of gifts of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being worshipped,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being worshipped of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of reverential salutation,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of reverential salutation of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being looked at with unwavering eyes,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being looked at with unwavering eyes of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being attended upon,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being attended upon of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being honoured,

original: garuguṇayogato. Garukaraṇaṃ vā sātisayaṃ arahatīti gāravayutto, gāravārahoti attho.🔽Sippādisikkhāpakā garū honti, na ca gāravayuttā, ayaṃ pana tādiso na hoti, tasmā
analyzed: garu guṇa yogataḥ garu karaṇam vā sa atisayam arahati iti gārava yuttaḥ gārava ārahaḥ ti attho  sippa ādi sikkhāpakāḥ garū honti na ca gārava yuttāḥ ayam pana tādisaḥ na hoti tasmā
translated: since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being honoured of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being revered,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being revered of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being extolled,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being extolled of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being venerated,🔽since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being venerated of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being praised,

original: garūti vatvā gāravayuttoti vuttanti keci. Vuttoyeva, na idha vattabbo visuddhimaggassa
analyzed: vatvā gārava yuttaḥ ti vuttanti keci vuttaḥ yeva na idha vattabbaḥ visuddhi maggassa
translated: since the Blessed One is the most worthy of being praised of all beings. The meaning of the word ‘Blessed’ is the most worthy of being esteemed,

original: imissā aṭṭhakathāya ekadesabhāvatoti adhippāyo.🔽Dhammasarīraṃ paccakkhaṃ karotīti “yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito🔽paññatto, so vo mamaccayena satthā”ti vacanato dhammassa satthubhāvapariyāyo vijjatīti
analyzed: imissā aṭṭhakathāya eka desa bhāvato ti adhippāyo 🔽dhamma sarīram paccakkham karoti iti yaḥ vaḥ ānanda mayā dhammo ca vinayaḥ ca desito 🔽paññattaḥ saḥ vaḥ mamaccayena satthā ati vacanataḥ dhammassa satthu bhāva pariyāyaḥ vijjati iti
translated: since the Blessed One is the most worthy

original: katvā vuttaṃ. Vajirasaṅghātasamānakāyo parehi abhejjasarīrattā. Na hi bhagavato rūpakāye🔽kenaci sakkā antarāyo kātunti. Desanāsampattiṃ niddisati vakkhamānassa sakalasuttassa
analyzed: katvā vuttam vajira saṅghāta samāna kāyaḥ parehi abhejja sarīra ttā na hi bhagavataḥ rūpa kāye  kenaci sakkā antarāyaḥ kātunti desanā sampattim niddisati vakkhamānassa sakala suttassa
translated: and so it is said. His body is like adamant, his physical frame being incapable of being harmed by others. For no one can create an obstacle for the Blessed One’s material body.

original: evanti niddisanato. Sāvakasampattiṃ niddisati paṭisambhidāpattena pañcasu ṭhānesu
analyzed: evam ti niddisanataḥ sāvaka sampattim niddisati paṭisambhidā pattena pañcasu ṭhānesu
translated: He shows the excellence of the teaching by the words “Thus have I heard” at the beginning of the sutta.🔽He shows the excellence of the disciple by the words “by the Elder Mahā Kassapa, who was placed at the head by the Blessed One among the disciples endowed with the analytical knowledges”

original: bhagavatā etadagge ṭhapitena mayā mahāsāvakena sutaṃ, tañca kho mayā sutaṃ, na anussutikaṃ,🔽na paramparābhatanti imassa atthassa dīpanato. Kālasampattiṃ niddisati “bhagavā”ti
analyzed: bhagavatā etad agge ṭhapitena mayā mahāsāvakena sutam tat ca kho mayā sutam na anussutikam  na imassa atthassa dīpanato kāla sampattim niddisati bhagavā iti
translated: and “I heard it from him, not from another.”🔽He shows the excellence of the time by the word “once” in the phrase “once the Blessed One was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.”

original: padassa sannidhāne payuttassa samayasaddassa kālassa buddhuppādappaṭimaṇḍitabhāvadīpanato.
analyzed: padassa sannidhāne payuttassa samaya saddassa kālassa buddhuppāda ppaṭimaṇḍita bhāva dīpanato
translated: The word “once” is used to show that the time was embellished by the Buddha’s appearance.

original: Buddhuppādaparamā hi kālasampadā. Tenetaṃ vuccati –
analyzed: buddha uppāda paramā hi kāla sampadā tena itam vuccati
translated: For the excellence of the time is the appearance of a Buddha. Therefore it is said:

original: “Kappakasāye kaliyuge, buddhuppādo aho mahacchariyaṃ;
analyzed: kappa kasāye kali yuge buddhuppādaḥ aho mahat śariyam
translated: “In the age of decline, in the Kali age, the appearance of a Buddha is a great wonder.

original: Hutāvahamajjhe jātaṃ, samuditamakarandamaravinda”nti. ;
analyzed: hutāvaha majjhe jātam samudita makarandam aravindanti
translated: Like a lotus in a blazing fire, he is born in the midst of the world’s ills.”

original: Bhagavāti desakasampattiṃ niddisati guṇavisiṭṭhasattuttamagarugāravādhivacanabhāvato.🔽Evaṃnāmake nagareti kathaṃ panetaṃ nagaraṃ evaṃnāmakaṃ jātanti? Vuccate, yathā kākandassa
analyzed: desaka sampattim niddisati guṇa visiṭṭha sattu ttama garu gārava adhivacana bhāvataḥ  evaṃnāmake nagara iti katham pana itam nagaram evaṃnāmakam jātanti vuccate yathā kākandassa
translated: “Bhagavā” : this shows the excellence of the teacher, in the sense of one who is worthy of reverence and worship as the most excellent of all beings.

original: isino nivāsaṭṭhāne māpitā nagarī kākandī, mākandassa nivāsaṭṭhāne māpitā mākandī,🔽kusambassa nivāsaṭṭhāne māpitā kosambīti vuccati, evaṃ savatthassa isino nivāsaṭṭhāne
analyzed: isinaḥ nivāsa ṭṭhāne māpitā nagarī kākandī mākandassa nivāsa ṭṭhāne māpitā mākandī  kusambassa nivāsa ṭṭhāne māpitā kosambī iti vuccati evam savatthassa isino nivāsa ṭṭhāne
translated: “In the city named Sāvatthī”: how did this city come to have this name? It is said that a city built in the dwelling place of the sage Kākandī was called Kākandī, one built in the dwelling place of the sage Mākandī was called Mākandī,🔽and one built in the dwelling place of the sage Kusambī was called Kosambī. In the same way, a city built in the dwelling place of the sage Savatthi

original: māpitā nagarī sāvatthīti vuccati. Evaṃ tāva akkharacintakā vadanti. Aṭṭhakathācariyā🔽pana bhaṇanti – “yaṃ kiñci manussānaṃ upabhogaparibhogaṃ, sabbamettha atthī”ti sāvatthi.
analyzed: māpitā nagarī sāvatthī iti vuccati evam tāva akkhara cintakāḥ vadanti aṭṭhakathā cariyā  pana bhaṇanti yam kiñci manussānam upabhoga paribhogam sabbam ettha atthi iti sāvatthi
translated: was called Sāvatthī. This is how the etymologists explain it. But the teachers of the commentaries say: “Sāvatthī is so called because ‘all’ is here .

original: Satthasamāyoge ca ‘kiṃ bhaṇḍamatthī’ti pucchite ‘sabbamatthī’ti vacanamupādāya sāvatthi.
analyzed: sattha samāyoge ca kim bhaṇḍam atthi iti pucchite sabbam atthi iti vacanam upādāya sāvatthi
translated: And when the army was assembled, when asked ‘What goods are there? ‘, the answer was ‘All’ .

original: “Sabbadā sabbūpakaraṇaṃ, sāvatthiyaṃ samohitaṃ;
analyzed: sabbadā sabba upakaraṇam sāvatthiyam samohitam
translated: ‘All’ the requisites of men are stored in Sāvatthī,

original: Tasmā sabbamupādāya, sāvatthīti pavuccati. ;
analyzed: tasmā sabbam upādāya sāvatthī iti pavuccati
translated: therefore it is called Sāvatthī because of all .

original: “Kosalānaṃ puraṃ rammaṃ, dassaneyyaṃ manoramaṃ;
analyzed: kosalānam puram rammam dassaneyyam manoramam
translated: Worth seeing, charming,🔽Not lacking in the ten sounds,

original: Dasahi saddehi avivittaṃ, annapānasamāyutaṃ.
analyzed: dasahi saddehi avivittam anna pāna samāyutam
translated: Supplied with food and drink.🔽“It has attained growth, increase,

original: “Vuddhiṃ vepullataṃ pattaṃ, iddhaṃ phītaṃ manoramaṃ;
analyzed: vuddhim iddham phītam manoramam
translated: And abundance, and is delightful,🔽Like Alakamanda of the gods,

original: Āḷakamandāva devānaṃ, sāvatthipuramuttama”nti. ;🔽Avisesenāti na visesena, vihārabhāvasāmaññenāti attho. Iriyāpathavihāro…pe… vihāresūti
analyzed: āḷakamandāva sāvatthi puram  avisesena ati na visesena vihāra bhāva sāmaññena ati attho iriyāpatha vihāra upe vihāresu ti
translated: The supreme city of Savatthi.”🔽Without distinction: without distinction, without making a difference, as to the state of being a dwelling. In the postures: in the dwelling in the postures, in the divine dwelling, in the divine dwelling, in the noble dwelling.

original: iriyāpathavihāro dibbavihāro brahmavihāro ariyavihāroti etesu catūsu vihāresu. Samaṅgiparidīpananti🔽samaṅgibhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Etanti viharatīti etaṃ padaṃ. Tathā hi taṃ “idhekacco gihisaṃsaṭṭho
analyzed: iriyāpatha vihāraḥ dibba vihāraḥ brahma vihāraḥ ariya vihāraḥ ti etesu catūsu vihāresu samaṅgi paridīpanam ti  samaṅgi bhāva paridīpanam etat ti viharati iti etam padam tathā hi tam idha ekaccaḥ gihi saṃsaṭṭhaḥ
translated: In these four dwellings. In the explanation of the complete:🔽in the explanation of the state of being complete. This: the word “dwells.” For this word occurs in the dwelling in the postures thus, “Here someone dwells in association with householders”

original: viharati sahanandī sahasokī”tiādīsu iriyāpathavihāre āgataṃ, “yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave,
analyzed: viharati saha nandī saha sokī iti ādīsu iriyāpatha vihāre āgatam yasmin samaye bhikkhave
translated: and so on, in the divine dwelling thus, “Bhikkhus, when a bhikkhu

analyzed: bhikkhu vivicca iva kāmehi paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati itiādīsu dibba vihāre
translated: is quite secluded from sense desires … and enters upon and abides in the first jhāna” ,🔽and so on,

original: “so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharatī”tiādīsu brahmavihāre, “so
analyzed: saḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati itiādīsu brahmavihāre saḥ
translated: In the passages beginning, “He dwells pursuing the practice of universal love” , the divine abodes are stated.

original: khohaṃ, aggivessana, tassāyeva kathāya pariyosāne tasmiṃyeva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte🔽ajjhattameva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi, samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ
analyzed: kho ham aggivessana tassāya iva kathāya pariyosāne tasmin yeva purimasmin samādhi nimitte  ajjhattam eva cittam saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi eka ūdim karomi samādahāmi yena sudam
translated: In the passages beginning, “He dwells suffusing one direction with a mind filled with loving- kindness” , etc., it is the divine abidings that are called “divine abidings” . In the passages beginning, “Then, Aggivessana, at the end of that talk, I, having risen from my seat, went to the Eastern Park, to the Palace of Migāra’s Mother, for the day’s abiding, and having gone there I, by means of the prior cause,

original: niccakappaṃ viharāmī”tiādīsu ariyavihāre.
analyzed: nicca kappam viharāmi itiādīsu ariya vihāre
translated: by means of the prior condition, entered upon an attainment of concentration, and I dwelt perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive and perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive” , it is the noble one’s abidings that are called “divine abidings” .

original: Tattha iriyanaṃ pavattanaṃ iriyā, kāyappayogo. Tassā pavattanūpāyabhāvato ṭhānādi
analyzed: tattha iriyanam pavattanam iriyā kāya ppayogo tassā pavattana upāya bhāvataḥ ṭhāna ādi
translated: Herein, the postures are the going, the occurring, of the body’s action. Standing, etc., are postures because they are the means for that going.

original: iriyāpatho. Ṭhānasamaṅgī vā hi kāyena kiñci kareyya gamanādīsu aññatarasamaṅgī vā.
analyzed: iriyāpathaḥ ṭhāna samaṅgī vā hi kāyena kiñci kareyya gamana ādīsu aññatara samaṅgī vā
translated: For one who is standing does something with the body, or one who is sitting, or one who is lying down, or one who is walking.

original: Atha vā iriyati pavattati etena attabhāvo, kāyakiccaṃ vāti iriyā, tassā pavattiyā
analyzed: atha vā iriyati pavattati etena atta bhāvaḥ kāya kiccam vāti iriyā tassā pavattiyā
translated: Or alternatively, the postures are the going, the occurring, of the selfhood by means of the body’s action. They are postures because they are the means for that occurrence.

original: upāyabhāvato pathoti iriyāpatho, ṭhānādi eva. So ca atthato gatinivattiādiākārena
analyzed: upāya bhāvato patho ti iriyāpathaḥ ṭhāna ādi eva so ca atthataḥ gati nivatti ādi ākārena
translated: And they are the postures of standing, etc., in the sense of the going of the selfhood in the mode of the occurrence of that.

original: pavatto catusantatirūpappabandho eva. Viharaṇaṃ, viharati etenāti vā vihāro. Divi
analyzed: eva viharaṇam viharati etena ati vā vihāraḥ divi
translated: and the occurrence is the mere occurrence of a series of four-aggregate materiality.

original: bhavo dibbo, tattha bahulappavattiyā brahmapārisajjādidevaloke bhavoti attho. Tattha
analyzed: bhavaḥ dibbaḥ tattha bahula ppavattiyā brahma pārisajja ādi deva loke bhavaḥ ti atthaḥ tattha
translated: The divine life is the divine life because of the abundance of the divine there, the meaning being that it is the life of the Brahmā retinue and so on.

original: yo dibbānubhāvo, tadatthāya saṃvattatīti vā dibbo, abhiññābhinīhāravasena mahāgatikattā
analyzed: yaḥ dibba anubhāvaḥ tad atthāya saṃvattati iti vā dibbaḥ abhiññā abhinīhāra vasena mahāgatikattā
translated: Herein, it is divine because it is for the purpose of the divine power, or it is divine because it is the great destiny by the undertaking of direct-knowledge.

original: vā dibbo, dibbo ca so vihāro cāti dibbavihāro, catasso rūpāvacarasamāpattiyo. Arūpasamāpattiyopi
analyzed: vā dibbaḥ dibbaḥ ca so vihāro ca ati dibbavihāro catasso rūpāvacara samāpattiyaḥ arūpa samāpattiyaḥ pi
translated: And it is a life and it is divine, thus it is a divine life. It is the four jhānas of the fine-material sphere.🔽The immaterial jhānas are included here too.

original: ettheva saṅgahaṃ gacchanti. Brahmānaṃ, brahmāno vā vihārā brahmavihārā, catasso appamaññāyo.
analyzed: etthā iva saṅgaham gacchanti brahmānam brahmānaḥ vā vihārāḥ brahmavihārā catasso appamaññāyaḥ
translated: The divine abidings are the divine abidings because of the abundance of the divine there.

original: Ariyo, ariyānaṃ vā vihāro ariyavihāro, cattāri sāmaññaphalāni. So hi ekaṃ iriyāpathabādhanantiādi
analyzed: ariyaḥ ariyānam vā vihāraḥ ariyavihāro cattāri sāmañña phalāni so hi ekam iriyāpatha bādhana ntiādi
translated: The noble one’s abidings are the noble one’s abidings because of the abundance of the noble one there.

original: yadipi bhagavā ekenapi iriyāpathena cirataraṃ kālaṃ attabhāvaṃ pavattetuṃ sakkoti,
analyzed: yadi pi bhagavā ekena api iriyāpathena cirataram kālam atta bhāvam pavattetum sakkoti
translated: Although the Blessed One is able to continue his existence for a long time with any one posture,

original: tathāpi upādinnakasarīrassa ayaṃ sabhāvoti dassetuṃ vuttaṃ. Yasmā vā bhagavā yattha
analyzed: tathā api upādinnaka sarīrassa ayam sabhāvaḥ ti dassetum vuttam yasmai vā bhagavā yattha
translated: Still, it is said in order to show that this is the nature of a body that has been appropriated.

original: katthaci vasanto veneyyānaṃ dhammaṃ desento nānāsamāpattīhi ca kālaṃ vītināmento
analyzed: katthaci vasantaḥ veneyyānam dhammaṃ desentaḥ nānā samāpattīhi ca kālam vītināmentaḥ
translated: Or else, since the Blessed One, while living anywhere, teaches the Dhamma to disciples and spends his time in various attainments,

original: vasatīti sattānaṃ attano ca vividhahitasukhaṃ harati upaneti uppādeti, tasmā vividhaṃ🔽haratīti viharatīti evamettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: vasati iti sattānam attano ca vividha hita sukham harati upaneti uppādeti tasmai vividham  harati iti viharati iti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: he “lives” in the sense that he “takes away” and “brings” and “produces” various kinds of welfare and pleasure for beings and for himself.🔽Thus the meaning here should be understood as follows: he “lives” in the sense that he “takes away” various kinds of welfare and pleasure.

original: Jetassa rājakumārassāti ettha attano paccatthikajanaṃ jinātīti jeto. Sotasaddo viya🔽hi kattusādhano jetasaddo. Atha vā raññā pasenadikosalena attano paccatthikajane
analyzed: jetassa rāja kumārassa ati ettha attanaḥ paccatthika janam jināti iti jeto sota saddaḥ viya  hi kattu sādhanaḥ jeta saddaḥ atha vā raññā pasenadi kosalena attano paccatthika jane
translated: Prince Jeta: he is called Jeta because he “conquers” the people who are his enemies.🔽For the word “Jeta” is a verbal noun formed from the root jī, “to conquer,” like the word “sota” formed from the root “su,” “to hear.”🔽Or alternatively, he is called Jeta because he was born after King Pasenadi of Kosala had conquered his enemies.🔽For the prince was called Jeta because he was born after the king had conquered his enemies. Or it was given him as a mere name out of a desire for good luck,

original: jite jātoti jeto. Rañño hi jayaṃ āropetvā kumāro jitavāti jetoti vutto. Maṅgalakāmatāya🔽vā tassa evaṃnāmameva katanti jeto. Maṅgalakāmatāya hi jeyyoti etasmiṃ atthe jetoti
analyzed: jite jātaḥ iti jeto raññaḥ hi jayam āropetvā kumāraḥ jitavā ati jeto ti vuttaḥ maṅgala kāma tāya 🔽vā tassa evaṃnāmam eva jeto maṅgala kāmatāya hi jeyyaḥ ti etasmin atthe jetoti
translated: for the word “Jeta” is used in the sense of “one who is to be conquered” .

original: vuttaṃ. Vitthāro panātiādinā “anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme”ti ettha sudatto nāma so, gahapati,
analyzed: vuttam vitthāraḥ pana ati ādinā anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme ti ettha sudattaḥ nāma saḥ gahapati
translated: “The Anāthapiṇḍika Park” is explained in the following way. The householder Anāthapiṇḍika was so called because he gave alms to the helpless,

original: mātāpitūhi katanāmavasena, sabbakāmasamiddhatāya pana vigatamaccheratāya karuṇādiguṇasamaṅgitāya🔽ca niccakālaṃ anāthānaṃ piṇḍamadāsi. Tena anāthapiṇḍikoti saṅkhaṃ gato. Āramanti🔽ettha pāṇino, visesena vā pabbajitāti ārāmo, tassa pupphaphalādisobhāya nātidūranaccāsannatādipañcavidhasenāsanaṅgasampattiyā
analyzed: mātā pitūhi kata nāma vasena sabba kāma samiddha tāya pana vigata macchera tāya karuṇā ādi guṇa samaṅgi tāya  ca nicca kālam piṇḍam adāsi tena saṅkham gataḥ āramanti  ettha pāṇinaḥ visesena vā pabbajitā ti ārāmo tassa puppha phala ādi sobhāya na atidūra nacca āsanna tā ādi pañcavidha senāsana aṅga sampattiyā
translated: that is, he gave alms to the helpless at all times because he was endowed with the qualities of compassion, etc., and because he was free from stinginess due to the fulfillment of all his desires.🔽The park is so called because beings, especially the homeless ones, find pleasure there,

original: ca tato tato āgamma ramanti abhiramanti, anukkaṇṭhitā hutvā nivasantīti attho. Vuttappakārāya
analyzed: ca tatas tatas āgamma ramanti abhiramanti an ukkaṇṭhitāḥ hutvā nivasanti iti atthaḥ vutta ppakārāya
translated: or because they find pleasure there, that is, they live there without being discontented, because of the beauty of its flowers, fruits, etc., and because of the excellence of the five requisites for the homeless life, which are not too far away or too near.

original: vā sampattiyā tattha tattha gatepi attano abbhantaraṃyeva ānetvā rametīti ārāmo.
analyzed: vā sampattiyā tattha tattha gate pi attanaḥ abbhantaraṃ yeva ānetvā rameti iti ārāmaḥ
translated: Or the park is so called because he finds pleasure there, that is, he brings even those who have gone elsewhere to the park because of its excellence.

original: So hi anāthapiṇḍikena gahapatinā jetassa rājakumārassa hatthato aṭṭhārasahiraññakoṭīhi
analyzed: saḥ hi anāthapiṇḍikena gahapatinā jetassa rāja kumārassa hatthato aṭṭhārasa hirañña koṭīhi
translated: The park was purchased by the householder Anāthapiṇḍika from Prince Jeta for a price of 18 koṭis of gold coins.

original: santhārena kiṇitvā aṭṭhārasahiraññakoṭīhi senāsanāni kārāpetvā aṭṭhārasahiraññakoṭīhi
analyzed: santhārena kiṇitvā aṭṭhārasa hirañña koṭīhi senāsanāni kārāpetvā aṭṭhārasa hirañña koṭīhi
translated: and having bought it by the square, he had the dwelling places made at the cost of eighteen koṭis of treasure, and having completed the monastery at the cost of eighteen koṭis of treasure,🔽and having given away fifty-four koṭis of treasure, he dedicated it to the Community of monks headed by the Buddha, therefore it is called Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.”🔽Herein, the sentence: “At one time the Fortunate One was dwelling near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Wood, in Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery,”🔽is what is said, here. It may be: some person’s reflection may be like this, the meaning is: perhaps he would rebuke in this way. Then, if he was dwelling there: if he was dwelling in Jeta’s Wood, in Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery. It should not be said: because of the difference of place of Sāvatthī and Jeta’s Wood, and because it is said: “At one time,”🔽is the intention. Now the one who rebukes, with: “For it is not possible,” etc.,🔽 Translation: aṭṭhārasahiraññakoṭīhi senāsanāni kārāpetvā aṭṭhārasahiraññakoṭīhi

translated: and the glorification of the Dhamma body by the glorification of Jeta’s Wood, etc. Likewise, by the former he shows the performance of action dependent on others,🔽and by the latter the performance of action independent of others.
