original: na samayavimutto puggalo”tiādinā ca paramatthakathaṃ kathentopi lokasammutiyā appahānatthaṃ
analyzed: na puggalaḥ ti ādinā ca paramattha katham kathentaḥ api loka sammutiyāḥ a pahāna attham
translated: And when he expounds the ultimate meaning in the way beginning, “The person is not one who is liberated by time” , he expounds the doctrine of the person in order not to abandon the usage current in the world.

original: puggalakathaṃ katheti. Etena vuttāvasesāya kathāya puggalādhiṭṭhānabhāve payojanaṃ
analyzed: puggala katham kathā iti etena vutta avasesāya kathāya puggala adhiṭṭhāna bhāve payojanam
translated: The purpose of the doctrine of the person in the remaining part of the teaching should be regarded as included by this purpose.

original: sāmaññavasena saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Kāmañcetaṃ sabbaṃ apariññātavatthukānaṃ vasena
analyzed: sāmañña vasena saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam kāmañca itam sabbam a pariññāta vatthukānam vasena
translated: And although all this is stated in terms of those whose subject of cognition is not fully understood,

original: vuttaṃ, pariññātavatthukānampi pana evaṃ desanā sukhāvahā hoti.🔽Ekapuggaloti visiṭṭhasamācārāpassayavirahito ekapuggalo. Buddhānañhi sīlādiguṇena
analyzed: vuttam pariññāta vatthukānam pi pana evam desanā sukha āvahā hoti  eka puggalaḥ ti visiṭṭha samācāra apassaya virahitaḥ eka puggalaḥ buddhānam hi sīla ādi guṇena
translated: nevertheless the teaching is given in this way for those whose subject of cognition is fully understood too, and it is easy to understand in this way.🔽One person: one person who is devoid of the desire for distinction in conduct and view. For in the world with its deities, no one is distinguished in virtue, etc.,

original: sadevake loke visiṭṭho nāma koci natthi, tathā sadisopi samānakāle. Tenāha – “na
analyzed: sa devake loke visiṭṭhaḥ nāma koci na atthi tathā sadisaḥ api samāna kāle tena āha na
translated: from the Buddhas, nor is anyone equal to them at the same time. That is why it is said:🔽“In this world with its deities, no one is seen or heard of

original: imasmiṃ loke parasmiṃ vā pana buddhena seṭṭho sadiso ca vijjatī”ti, tasmā sadisopi
analyzed: imasmin loke parasmin vā pana buddhena seṭṭhaḥ sadiso ca vijjati iti tasmā sadisaḥ api
translated: Who is equal or similar to the Buddha” .🔽So there is no one who is equal to them,

original: koci natthi. Hīnopi apassayabhūto nattheva. Tena vuttaṃ – “visiṭṭhasamācārāpassayavirahito
analyzed: koci natthi hīnaḥ api apassaya bhūtaḥ nattha eva tena vuttam visiṭṭha samācāra apassaya virahitaḥ
translated: nor is there anyone who is inferior and devoid of desire.

original: ekapuggalo”ti. Ye ca sīlādiguṇehi natthi etesaṃ samāti asamā, purimakā sammāsambuddhā.
analyzed: eka puggalaḥ ti ye ca sīla ādi guṇehi natthi etesam samā ati asamā purimakā sammāsambuddhā
translated: The former Perfectly Enlightened Ones are unequalled by those who are devoid of the special qualities of virtue, etc., and so they are “unequalled.”

original: Tehi samo majjhe bhinnasuvaṇṇanekkhaṃ viya nibbisiṭṭhoti asamasamaṭṭhenapi ekapuggalo
analyzed: tehi samaḥ majjhe bhinna suvaṇṇa nekkham viya nibbisiṭṭhaḥ ti asamasamaṭṭhena api eka puggalaḥ
translated: He is “unequalled by the unequalled” because he is like a piece of gold that is free from dross and is equal to the former Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: aññassa tādisassa abhāvā. Tena vuttaṃ – “asadisaṭṭhenā”tiādi.
analyzed: aññassa tādisassa abhāvā tena vuttam asadisa ṭṭhena ātiādi
translated: And because there is no one else like him, it is said that he is “unequalled by the equal.”

original: Sattaloko adhippeto sattanikāye uppajjanato. Manussaloke eva uppajjati devabrahmalokānaṃ
analyzed: satta lokaḥ adhippetaḥ satta nikāye uppajjanataḥ manussa loke eva uppajjati deva brahma lokānaṃ
translated: The world of beings is intended, because he appears in the class of beings. He appears only in the human world,🔽because there is no opportunity for the arising of Buddhas in the divine and Brahmā worlds.

original: buddhānaṃ uppattiyā anokāsabhāvato. Kāmadevaloke tāva nuppajjati brahmacariyavāsassa
analyzed: buddhānam uppattiyāḥ anokāsa bhāvato kāmadeva loke tāva nu pajjati brahmacariya vāsassa
translated: He does not appear in the sense-sphere divine world, because the life of celibacy

original: aṭṭhānabhāvato tathā anacchariyabhāvato. Acchariyadhammā hi buddhā bhagavanto. Tesaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ tathā anacchariya bhāvataḥ acchariya dhammāḥ hi buddhāḥ bhagavanto tesam
translated: is not possible there, and because it is not a wonderful place. For the Blessed One is a wonderful person.

original: sā acchariyadhammatā devattabhāve ṭhitānaṃ loke na pākaṭā hoti yathā manussabhūtānaṃ.
analyzed: sā acchariya dhamma tā devatta bhāve ṭhitānam loke na pākaṭā hoti yathā manussa bhūtānam
translated: That wonderfulness of his is not evident in the world to those who are established in the divine state.

original: Devabhūte hi sammāsambuddhe dissamānaṃ buddhānubhāvaṃ devānubhāvatova loke dahati,
analyzed: deva bhūte hi sammāsambuddhe dissamānam buddha anubhāvam deva anubhāvataḥ uva loke dahati
translated: For when the Perfectly Enlightened One appears as a god, the power of the Buddha, which is evident in the world, is attributed to the power of the gods.

original: na buddhānubhāvato. Tathā sati “ayaṃ sammāsambuddho”ti nādhimuccati na sampasīdati,
analyzed: na buddha anubhāvataḥ tathā sati ayam sammāsambuddhaḥ iti na adhimuccati na sampasīdati
translated: not by the Buddha’s power. If that were so, he would not have confidence and be serene, thinking, “This is the Perfect Buddha.”

original: issarakuttaggāhaṃ na vissajjeti, devattabhāvassa ca cirakālāvaṭṭhānato ekaccasassatavādato
analyzed: na vissajjeti devatta bhāvassa ca cira kāla avaṭṭhānataḥ ekacca sassata vādato
translated: He would not give up the view that the world is created by Īsāna, and he would not be freed from the eternalist view that the world is eternal.🔽He would not be reborn in the Brahmā-world. The same method applies here.

original: na parimuccati. Brahmaloke nuppajjatīti etthāpi eseva nayo. Sattānaṃ tādisaggāhavinimocanatthañhi
analyzed: na parimuccati brahma loke nu pajjati iti ettha api esa iva nayaḥ sattānam ta ādisa ggāha vinimocana attham hi
translated: For the purpose of freeing beings from such views,🔽the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, are reborn only in the human world, not in the divine world.

original: buddhā bhagavanto manussasugatiyaṃyeva uppajjanti, na devasugatiyaṃ. Yasmā imaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ
analyzed: buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ manussa sugatiyam yeva uppajjanti na deva sugatiyam yasmai imam cakkavāḷam
translated: Because this world system

original: majjhe katvā iminā saddhiṃ cakkavāḷānaṃ dasasahassasseva jātikkhettabhāvo dīpito
analyzed: majjhe katvā iminā saddhim cakkavāḷānam dasa sahassassa iva jāti khetta bhāvaḥ dīpito
translated: is shown to be the field of the ten-thousand world systems with this one in the middle.

original: ito aññassa buddhānaṃ uppattiṭṭhānassa tepiṭake buddhavacane āgataṭṭhānassa abhāvato.
analyzed: itas aññassa buddhānam uppatti ṭṭhānassa tepiṭake buddha vacane āgata ṭṭhānassa abhāvato
translated: Because there is no other place of the Buddhas’ appearance in the scriptures of the canon.

original: Tasmā vuttaṃ – “imasmiṃyeva cakkavāḷe uppajjatī”ti.
analyzed: tasmā vuttam imasmin yeva cakkavāḷe uppajjati iti
translated: Therefore it is said that he appears in this world system alone.

original: Idha uppajjantopi kasmā jambudīpe eva uppajjati, na sesadīpesūti? Keci tāva āhu –
analyzed: uppajjantaḥ api kasmā jambudīpe eva uppajjati na sesa dīpesu iti keci tāva āhu
translated: Why does he appear in the Rose Apple Continent and not in the other continents? Some say:

original: “yasmā pathaviyā nābhibhūtā buddhabhāvasahā acalaṭṭhānabhūtā bodhimaṇḍabhūmi jambudīpe🔽eva, tasmā jambudīpe eva uppajjatī”ti. Eteneva “tattha majjhimadese eva uppajjatī”ti
analyzed: yasmā pathaviyā buddha bhāva sahāḥ acala ṭṭhāna bhūtāḥ bodhimaṇḍa bhūmi jambudīpe  eva tasmai jambudīpe eva uppajjati iti etena iva tattha majjhima dese eva uppajjati iti
translated: “Because the site of the enlightenment tree is not excelled by the earth, is not surpassed by the state of a Buddha, and is unshaken, it is found only in Jambudīpa.

original: etampi saṃvaṇṇitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ tathā itaresampi avijahitaṭṭhānānaṃ tattheva labbhanato.🔽Yasmā purimabuddhānaṃ mahābodhisattānaṃ paccekabuddhānañca nibbattiyā sāvakabodhisattānaṃ
analyzed: etam pi saṃvaṇṇitanti daṭṭhabbam tathā itaresam pi a vijahita ṭṭhānānam tattha eva labbhanato  yasmai purima buddhānam mahā bodhisattānam paccekabuddhānam ca nibbattiyā sāvaka bodhisattānam
translated: Therefore a Buddha arises only in Jambudīpa.” And by this same reasoning it can be understood that he is also born in the Middle Country, since the other sites not abandoned are found there too.🔽Because the birth of Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and chief disciples,

original: sāvakabodhiyā abhinīhāro sāvakapāramiyā sambharaṇaparipācanañca buddhakkhettabhūte
analyzed: sāvaka bodhiyā abhinīhāraḥ sāvaka pāramiyā sambharaṇa paripācanañca buddhakkhetta bhūte
translated: and the aspiration for enlightenment of disciples and the fulfilment and maturing of their pāramīs for discipleship,

original: imasmiṃyeva cakkavāḷe jambudīpe eva ijjhati, na aññattha. Veneyyajanavinayanattho🔽ca buddhuppādo, tasmā aggasāvakamahāsāvakādiveneyyavisesāpekkhāya imasmiṃ jambudīpe
analyzed: imasmin yeva cakkavāḷe jambudīpe eva ijjhati na aññattha veneyya jana vinayana attho  ca buddhuppādaḥ tasmai aggasāvaka mahāsāvaka ādi veneyya visesa apekkhāya imasmin jambudīpe
translated: all succeed only in this world system, in Jambudīpa, which is a field of merit, and nowhere else.🔽And the appearance of Buddhas is for the purpose of training those who are trainable.🔽So Buddhas are born in Jambudīpa, which is the place where there are the chief disciples, the great disciples, and other such distinguished trainables, and not in the other continents.

original: eva buddhā nibbattanti, na sesadīpesu. Ayañca nayo sabbabuddhānaṃ āciṇṇasamāciṇṇoti
analyzed: eva buddhāḥ nibbattanti na sesa dīpesu ayaṃ ca nayaḥ sabba buddhānam āciṇṇa samāciṇṇaḥ ti
translated: And this is the practice of all Buddhas.

original: tesaṃ uttamapurisānaṃ tattheva uppatti sampatticakkānaṃ viya aññamaññūpanissayatāya
analyzed: tesam uttama purisānam tattha iva uppatti sampatti cakkānam viya aññamaññu upanissaya tāya
translated: They should be regarded as the mutual condition of those who are the highest of men, like the condition of the arising of the eyes in a peacock’s tail.

original: daṭṭhabbā. Tena vuttaṃ – aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “tīsu dīpesu buddhā na nibbattanti, jambudīpe
analyzed: daṭṭhabbā tena vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam tīsu dīpesu buddhāḥ na nibbattanti jambudīpe
translated: Hence it is said in the commentary: “Buddhas do not arise in the three continents, they arise only in the Rose-Apple Island.

original: eva nibbattantīti dīpaṃ passī”ti.🔽Ubhayampidaṃ vippakatavacanameva uppādakiriyāya vattamānakālikattā. Uppajjamānoti
analyzed: eva nibbattanti iti dīpam passi iti  ubhayam pi idam vippakata vacanam eva uppāda kiriyāya vattamāna kālika ttā uppajjamānaḥ ti
translated: Therefore he sees the island.”🔽And both these statements are merely a way of speaking. For the arising of the Buddhas is in the present.🔽Or else, “arising” is the state of being able to arise.🔽And the word “pride” is used here in the sense of “a sharp point.”

original: vā uppajjituṃ samattho. Sattiattho cāyaṃ māna-saddo. Yāvatā hi sāmatthiyena mahābodhisattānaṃ
analyzed: vā uppajjitum samatthaḥ satti atthaḥ ca ayam māna saddaḥ yāvatā hi sāmatthiyena mahā bodhisattānam
translated: For as far as the ability of the great Bodhisattvas to arise in their last existence is concerned,

original: carimabhave uppatti icchitabbā, tatthakena bodhisambhārasambhūtena paripuṇṇena samannāgatoti
analyzed: carima bhave uppatti icchitabbā tatthakena bodhi sambhāra sambhūtena paripuṇṇena samannāgataḥ ti
translated: he is endowed with the complete equipment for enlightenment that has been accumulated by him in that state.🔽This is the meaning.🔽“Distinction” is a difference.

original: attho. Bhedoti viseso. Tameva hi tividhaṃ visesaṃ dassetuṃ – “esa hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: atthaḥ bhedaḥ iti visesaḥ tam eva hi tividham visesam dassetum esa hi itiādi vuttam
translated: In order to show that very distinction in three ways, it is said: “For this … ”

original: Aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgatassa mahābhinīhārassa siddhakālato paṭṭhāya mahābodhisatto buddhabhāvāya
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅga samannāgatassa mahā abhinīhārassa siddha kālataḥ paṭṭhāya mahā bodhisattaḥ buddha bhāvāya
translated: From the time of the accomplishment of the great aspiration endowed with the eight factors, the great Bodhisattvas, for the sake of the attainment of Buddhahood,

original: niyatabhāvappattatāya bodhisambhārapaṭipadaṃ paṭipajjamāno yathāvuttasāmatthiyayogena
analyzed: niyata bhāva ppatta tāya bodhi sambhāra paṭipadam paṭipajjamānaḥ yathāvutta sāmatthiya yogena
translated: Having reached the certainty of his future enlightenment, he was engaged in the practice of the requisites for enlightenment. The meaning is that he was “arisen” by virtue of the possession of the aforementioned ability.

original: uppajjamāno nāmāti attho uppādassa ekantikattā. Pariyesantoti vicinanto. Paripakkagate🔽ñāṇeti iminā tato pubbe ñāṇassa aparipakkatāya eva laddhāvasarāya kammapilotiyā vasena
analyzed: uppajjamānaḥ nāma ati atthaḥ uppādassa ekantika ttā pariyesantaḥ ti vicinantaḥ paripakka gate  ñāṇa iti iminā tatas pubbe ñāṇassa aparipakka tāya eva laddha avasarāya kamma pilotiyā vasena
translated: “Searching” means investigating. “When his knowledge was fully matured”🔽shows that the Bodhisatta had previously undertaken the great endeavour by the power of his kamma-piloting, which he had obtained because his knowledge was not yet fully matured.

original: bodhisatto tathā mahāpadhānaṃ padahīti dasseti. Arahattaphalakkhaṇe uppanno nāma
analyzed: bodhisatto tathā mahā padhānam padahī iti dasseti arahatta phala kkhaṇe uppannaḥ nāma
translated: “Arisen” should be said because it has arisen at the moment of the fruit of arahantship.

original: “uppanno hotī”ti vattabbattā. Āgatova nāma hetusampadāya sammadeva nipphannattā.
analyzed: uppannaḥ hoti iti vattabba ttā āgataḥ va nāma hetu sampadāya sammat eva nipphanna ttā
translated: “Arrived” because it has arisen properly by the perfection of its cause.

original: Hitatthāyāti lokiyalokuttarassa hitassa siddhiyā. Sukhatthāyāti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: hita atthāya ati lokiya lokuttarassa hitassa siddhiyā sukha atthāya ati ettha api esa eva nayo
translated: “For the welfare” means for the accomplishment of welfare in the mundane and supramundane sense. “For the happiness” should be understood in the same way.

original: Tassāti tassa sattalokassa. So panāyaṃ sattaloko yena anukkamena dhammābhisamayaṃ
analyzed: tassa ati tassa satta lokassa saḥ pana ayam satta lokaḥ yena anukkamena dhamma abhisamayam
translated: “For him” means for the world of beings. This world of beings, however, has reached the penetration of the Dhamma in a certain order.

original: pāpuṇi, taṃ teneva anukkamena dassento “mahābodhimaṇḍe”tiādimāha. Yāvajjadivasāti
analyzed: pāpuṇi tam tena iva anukkamena dassentaḥ mahā bodhimaṇḍa iti ādim āha yāvat ja divasā iti
translated: Showing that order, the Buddha says, “at the Great Bodhi Tree.” “From today” means

original: ettha ajja-saddena sāsanassa avaṭṭhānakālaṃ vadati. Devamanussānanti ukkaṭṭhaniddesoti
analyzed: ettha ajja saddena sāsanassa avaṭṭhāna kālam vadati deva manussānam ti ukkaṭṭha niddeso ti
translated: Here the word today indicates the time when the Dispensation will cease to exist. As to the words gods and men, the word gods is a superlative expression.🔽In order to show this, the following is said: “Not only …

original: dassetuṃ – “na kevala”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Etesampīti nāgasupaṇṇādīnampi.
analyzed: dassetum na kevala ntiādi vuttam etesam pi iti nāga supaṇṇa ādīnam pi
translated: but also of nāgas, supaṇṇas, etc.”

original: Ayaṃ pucchāti iminā “katamo”ti padassa sāmaññato pucchābhāvo dassito, na visesatoti
analyzed: ayam pucchā ati iminā katamaḥ ti padassa sāmaññato pucchā bhāvaḥ dassitaḥ na visesato ti
translated: As to the words what kind of, the question is shown by this expression to be a general one, not a particular one.

original: tassa pucchāvisesabhāvañāpanatthaṃ mahāniddese āgatā sabbāpi pucchā atthuddhāranayena
analyzed: tassa pucchā visesa bhāva ñāpana attham mahāniddese āgatā sabbā api pucchā attha uddhāra nayena
translated: In order to show the particular kind of question, all the questions given in the Mahāniddesa are shown by the method of extracting the meaning🔽in the passage beginning, “And this is a question, namely, what kind of.”

original: dasseti “pucchā ca nāmesā”tiādinā. Adiṭṭhaṃ jotīyati etāyāti adiṭṭhajotanā. Diṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: dassa iti pucchā ca nāma isā iti ādinā adiṭṭham jotīyati etāyāti adiṭṭha jotanā diṭṭham
translated: A question that illuminates the unseen is a question that illuminates what has not been seen.

original: saṃsandīyati etāyāti diṭṭhasaṃsandanā. Saṃsandanañca sākacchāvasena vinicchayakaraṇaṃ.🔽Vimatiṃ chindati etāyāti vimaticchedanā. Anumatiyā pucchā anumatipucchā. “Taṃ kiṃ
analyzed: saṃsandīyati diṭṭha saṃsandanā saṃsandanam ca sākacchā vasena vinicchaya karaṇam  vimatim chindati vimati chedanā anumatiyā pucchā anumati pucchā tam kim
translated: A question that connects what has been seen is a question that connects what has been seen. And connecting is the making of a decision by way of discussion.🔽A question that cuts off doubt is a question that cuts off doubt. A question that asks for agreement is a question that asks for agreement. In the question, “What do you think of this, bhikkhus?,”

original: maññatha, bhikkhave”tiādi pucchāya “kā tumhākaṃ anumatī”ti anumati pucchitā hoti.
analyzed: maññatha bhikkhave tiādi pucchāya kā tumhākam anumati iti anumati pucchitā hoti
translated: the asking for agreement is the asking, “What is your agreement?”

original: Kathetukamyatāpucchāti kathetukamyatāya pucchā. Lakkhaṇanti ñātuṃ icchito yo koci🔽sabhāvo. Aññātanti yena kenaci ñāṇena aññātabhāvamāha. Adiṭṭhanti dassanabhūtena🔽ñāṇena paccakkhaṃ viya adiṭṭhataṃ. Atulitanti “ettakaṃ eta”nti tulābhūtena atulitataṃ.🔽Atīritanti tīraṇabhūtena akatañāṇakiriyāsamāpanataṃ. Avibhūtanti ñāṇassa apākaṭabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: kathetu kamyatā pucchā ati kathetu kamyatāya pucchā lakkhaṇanti ñātum icchitaḥ yaḥ koci  sabhāvaḥ aññātanti yena kenacid ñāṇena aññāta bhāvam āha adiṭṭhanti dassana bhūtena  ñāṇena paccakkham viya ettakam etanti tulā bhūtena  a tīritam ti tīraṇa bhūtena a kata ñāṇa kiriyā samāpanatam a vibhūtam ti ñāṇassa apākaṭa bhāvam
translated: Questioning out of a desire to talk is questioning out of a desire to talk. Characteristic is any individual essence that one wants to know. Known is what is known by some means of knowledge. Not seen is what is not seen as though evident by knowledge in the mode of seeing. Not measured is what is not measured by knowledge in the mode of weighing, thinking “It is this much.” Not investigated is what is not completed by knowledge in the mode of investigating. Not discerned is what is not evident to knowledge.

original: Avibhāvitanti ñāṇena apākaṭakatabhāvaṃ.🔽Yehi guṇavisesehi nimittabhūtehi bhagavati “tathāgato”ti ayaṃ samaññā pavattā, taṃdassanatthaṃ
analyzed: avibhāvitam ti ñāṇena apākaṭakata bhāvam  yehi guṇa visesehi nimitta bhūtehi bhagavati tathāgataḥ ti ayam samaññā pavattā tad dassana ttham
translated: Questioning out of a desire to speak is questioning out of a desire to speak. Characteristic is any individual essence of anything that is wished to be known. Known is the state of being known by some kind of knowledge. Not seen is the state of not being seen as though in the very eye by knowledge that is the seeing state. Not measured is the state of not being measured by knowledge that is the measuring state. Not investigated is the state of not having completed the function of knowing by knowledge that is the investigating state. Not discerned is the state of not being evident to knowledge. Not penetrated is the state of not being evident by knowledge.

original: “aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgato”tiādi vuttaṃ. Guṇavisesanemittikāneva hi bhagavato
analyzed: aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgataḥ tiādi vuttam guṇa visesa nemittikān eva hi bhagavataḥ

original: Chattaṃ marū dhārayumantalikkhe;
analyzed: chattam marū dhārayumantalikkhe
translated: The Maruts held a sunshade in the sky,

original: Suvaṇṇadaṇḍā vītipatanti cāmarā,
analyzed: suvaṇṇa daṇḍāḥ vītipatanti
translated: And yak’s-tail fans of gold were waved,

original: Na dissare cāmarachattagāhakā”ti. –🔽Imissā gāthāya. Sabbaññutaññāṇameva sabbattha appaṭihatacāratāya anāvaraṇañāṇanti
analyzed: na dissare cāmara chatta gāhakā ati  imissā gāthāya sabbaññu taññāṇam eva sabbattha appaṭihata cāra tāya anāvaraṇa ñāṇam ti
translated: But none was seen who held the sunshade or the fan” .🔽In this stanza, the knowledge of omniscience itself is called “unimpeded knowledge” because it is unimpeded everywhere.🔽So it is said: “for the attainment of the knowledge of omniscience that is unimpeded everywhere” .

original: āha – “sabbaññutānāvaraṇañāṇapaṭilābhassā”ti. Tathā ayaṃ bhagavāpi gato…pe… pubbanimittabhāvenāti
analyzed: āha sabbaññu tā anāvaraṇa ñāṇa paṭilābhassa ati tathā ayam bhagavā api gata upe pubba nimitta bhāvena ati
translated: In the same way, this Blessed One went … as a sign foretelling .

original: etena abhijātiyaṃ dhammatāvasena uppajjanakavisesā sabbabodhisattānaṃ sādhāraṇāti
analyzed: etena abhijātiyam dhamma tā vasena uppajjanaka visesā sabba bodhisattānam sādhāraṇā ti
translated: By this he shows that the special kind of arising that occurs by the law of nature in the case of a universal being is common to all Bodhisattas.

original: dasseti. Pāramitānissandā hi teti.
analyzed: dasseti pāramitā nissandāḥ hi te iti
translated: For these are the outcome of the perfections.

original: Vikkamīti agamāsi. Marūti devā. Samāti vilokanasamatāya samā sadisiyo. Mahāpuriso
analyzed: vikkamīti devā vilokana sama tāya samā sadisiyaḥ mahā purisaḥ
translated: He stepped: he went. Maruts: gods. Sam: in the same way, because of the equality of his looking.

original: hi yathā ekaṃ disaṃ vilokesi, evaṃ sesadisāpi, na katthaci vilokane vibandho tassa
analyzed: hi yathā ekam disam vilokesi evam sesa disā api na katthaci vilokane vibandho tassa
translated: For a Great Man looks in all directions in the same way; he has no partiality in looking in any direction.🔽Sam also means “suitable to look” .

original: ahosīti. Samāti vā viloketuṃ yuttāti attho. Na hi tadā bodhisattassa virūpabībhacchavisamarūpāni
analyzed: ahosi iti samā ati vā viloketum yuttā ati atthaḥ na hi tadā bodhisattassa virūpa bībhaccha visama rūpāni
translated: For at that time no forms that were ugly, frightening, or repulsive appeared to the Bodhisattas.

original: viloketuṃ ayuttāni disāsu upaṭṭhahantīti.🔽“Evaṃ tathā gato”ti kāyagamanaṭṭhena gatasaddena tathāgatasaddaṃ niddisitvā idāni
analyzed: viloketum ayuttāni disāsu upaṭṭhahanti iti  evam tathā gataḥ ti kāya gamana ṭṭhena gata saddena tathāgata saddam niddisitvā idāni
translated: and they are not fit to be looked at in the directions in which they stand.🔽Having shown the word “thus-gone” by the word “gone” in the sense of bodily going, he now said “Or else” in order to show it by the word “gone” in the sense of going by knowledge.

original: ñāṇagamanaṭṭhena taṃ dassetuṃ – “atha vā”tiādimāha. Tattha nekkhammenāti alobhappadhānena
analyzed: ñāṇa gamana aṭṭhena tam dassetum atha vā ti ādim āha tattha nekkhammena ati alobha ppadhānena
translated: Herein, with renunciation means with non-greed as a mental factor,

original: kusalacittuppādena. Kusalā hi dhammā idha nekkhammaṃ, na pabbajjādayo. “Paṭhamajjhānenā”ti
analyzed: kusala cittuppādena kusalāḥ hi dhammāḥ idha nekkhammam na pabbajja ādayaḥ paṭhama jhānena ati
translated: with the arising of profitable cognizance. For it is profitable ideas that are “renunciation” here, not going forth, etc., and they say that it is “with the first jhāna” .

original: ca vadanti. Pahāyāti pajahitvā. Gato adhigato, paṭipanno uttarivisesanti attho. Pahāyāti
analyzed: ca vadanti pahāya ati pajahitvā gataḥ adhigataḥ paṭipannaḥ attho pahāya ati
translated: Gone by abandoning is gone by giving up, attained, entered upon, and is superior, is the meaning.

original: vā pahānahetu, pahānalakkhaṇaṃ vā. Hetulakkhaṇattho hi ayaṃ pahāyasaddo. Kāmacchandādippahānahetukañhi
analyzed: vā pahāna hetu pahāna lakkhaṇam vā hetu lakkhaṇa atthaḥ hi ayam pahāya saddaḥ kāmacchanda ādi pahāna hetukam hi
translated: Or alternatively, abandoning is the cause of abandoning, or it is the characteristic of abandoning. For this word “having abandoned” has the meaning of cause and characteristic.

original: “gato”ti ettha vuttaṃ gamanaṃ avabodho, paṭipatti eva vā kāmacchandādippahānena ca
analyzed: gataḥ ti ettha vuttam gamanam avabodho paṭipatti eva vā kāmacchanda ādi ppahānena ca
translated: For the going stated here as “gone” is the understanding or the practice that is caused by the abandoning of sensual desire, etc.,🔽or it is characterized by the abandoning of sensual desire, etc. The same method applies in the case of “having analysed the faculties” , etc.

original: lakkhīyati. Esa nayo padāletvātiādīsupi. Abyāpādenāti mettāya. Ālokasaññāyāti vibhūtaṃ
analyzed: lakkhīyati esa nayo padāletvā ati ādīsu pi a byāpādena ati mettāya āloka saññāya ati vibhūtam
translated: With non-ill-will means with loving-kindness. With perception of light means with perception of what is bright

original: katvā manasikaraṇena upaṭṭhitaālokasañjānanena. Avikkhepenāti samādhinā. Dhammavavatthānenāti
analyzed: katvā manasikaraṇena upaṭṭhita āloka sañjānanena avikkhepena ati samādhinā dhamma vavatthānena ati
translated: by giving attention to it. By non-distraction: by concentration. By defining of ideas:

original: kusalādidhammānaṃ yāthāvanicchayena. “Sappaccayanāmarūpavavatthānenā”tipi vadanti.
analyzed: kusala ādi dhammānam yāthāva nicchayena vadanti
translated: by the right seeing of profitable and unprofitable ideas, etc., as they are. Or it can be said that it is by defining of mentality-materiality with its conditions.

original: Evaṃ kāmacchandādinīvaraṇappahānena “abhijjhaṃ loke pahāyā”tiādinā vuttāya paṭhamajjhānassa🔽pubbabhāgappaṭipadāya bhagavato tathāgatabhāvaṃ dassetvā idāni saha upāyena aṭṭhahi
analyzed: evam kāmacchanda ādi nīvaraṇa ppahānena abhijjham loke pahāya ati ādinā vuttāya paṭhama jhānassa  pubbabhāga paṭipadāya bhagavato tathāgata bhāvam dassetvā idāni saha upāyena aṭṭhahi
translated: So the Blessed One’s state of being a Self-awakened One is shown by the preliminary work of the first jhana, which is stated in the way beginning, “Having abandoned hankering for the world” , with the abandoning of the hindrances of lust, etc.,🔽Now, in order to show that by the eight attainments together with their means and by the eighteen principal insights he is a Self-Awakened One, he said, “By knowledge” . For when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of delusion, which is an obstruction to the discernment of mentality-materiality and to the surmounting of doubt, then the perceptions of impermanence, etc., are successful,

original: samāpattīhi aṭṭhārasahi ca mahāvipassanāhi taṃ dassetuṃ – “ñāṇenā”tiādimāha. Nāmarūpapariggahakaṅkhāvitaraṇānañhi🔽vibandhabhūtassa mohassa dūrīkaraṇena ñātapariññāyaṃ ṭhitassa aniccasaññādayo sijjhanti,
analyzed: samāpattīhi aṭṭhārasahi ca mahāvipassanāhi tam dassetum ñāṇena ati ādim āha nāma rūpa pariggaha kaṅkhā vitaraṇānam hi  vibandha bhūtassa mohassa dūrīkaraṇena ṭhitassa anicca saññā ādayo sijjhanti
translated: and when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of the delight that is a cause for the arising of the perception of permanence, etc., then the perceptions of impermanence, etc., are successful,🔽and when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of the delight that is a cause for the arising of the perception of permanence, etc., then the perceptions of impermanence, etc., are successful,🔽and when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of the delight that is a cause for the arising of the perception of permanence, etc., then the perceptions of impermanence, etc., are successful,🔽and when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of the delight that is a cause for the arising of the perception of permanence, etc., then the perceptions of impermanence, etc., are successful,

original: tathā jhānasamāpattīsu abhiratinimittena pāmojjena tattha anabhiratiyā vinoditāya
analyzed: tathā jhāna samāpattīsu abhirati nimittena pāmojjena tattha an abhiratiyā vinoditāya
translated: and when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of the delight that is a cause for the arising of the perception of permanence, etc., then the perceptions of impermanence, etc., are successful,🔽and when he is established in the full-understanding of what is to be known by the abandoning of the delight that is a cause for the arising of the perception of permanence, etc., then the perceptions of impermanence, etc.,

original: jhānādīnaṃ samadhigamoti samāpattivipassanānaṃ arativinodanaavijjāpadālanādiupāyo,🔽uppaṭipāṭiniddeso pana nīvaraṇasabhāvāya avijjāya heṭṭhā nīvaraṇesupi saṅgahadassanatthanti
analyzed: jhāna ādīnam samadhigamaḥ ti samāpatti vipassanānam arati vinodana avijjā padālana ādi upāyaḥ  uppaṭi pāṭi niddeso pana nīvaraṇa sabhāvāya avijjāya heṭṭhā nīvaraṇesu pi saṅgaha dassana tthan ti
translated: The attainment of jhāna, etc., is the means for the removal of dispassion and the breaking of ignorance, and so on.🔽The exposition of the order is given in order to show that ignorance, which is of the nature of the hindrances, is included among the hindrances below.

original: daṭṭhabbo. Samāpattivihārappavesavibandhanena nīvaraṇāni kavāṭasadisānīti āha – “nīvaraṇakavāṭaṃ ugghāṭetvā”ti.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbaḥ samāpatti vihāra pavesa vibandhanena nīvaraṇāni kavāṭa sadisāni iti āha nīvaraṇa kavāṭam ugghāṭetvā iti
translated: The hindrances are like a door-panel because they obstruct the entry of concentration and the jhāna, etc., and so he said, “having removed the panel of the hindrances.”

original: “Rattiṃ vitakketvā vicāretvā divā kammante payojetī”ti vuttaṭṭhāne vitakkavicārā🔽dhūmāyanā adhippetāti āha – “vitakkavicāradhūma”nti. Kiñcāpi paṭhamajjhānūpacāreyeva🔽dukkhaṃ, catutthajjhānopacāreyeva ca sukhaṃ pahīyati, atisayappahānaṃ pana sandhāyāha
analyzed: rattim vitakketvā vicāretvā divā kammante payojeti iti vutta ṭṭhāne vitakka vicārā  dhūmāyanā adhippetā iti āha vitakka vicāra dhūmanti kiñca api  dukkham catuttha jhāna upacāreya iva ca sukham pahīyati atisaya pahānam pana sandhāya āha
translated: In the passage, “having reflected on and explored with thought and exploration by day, he devotes himself to the activities by night” (S V 21), thought and exploration are intended as smoke.🔽And although pain is abandoned in the preliminary stage of the first jhāna and pleasure in the preliminary stage of the fourth, still he said, “With the abandoning of pleasure and pain” referring to their extreme abandonment.

original: – “catutthajjhānena sukhadukkhaṃ pahāyā”ti. Rūpasaññāti saññāsīsena rūpāvacarajjhānāni
analyzed: catuttha jhānena sukha dukkham pahāya ati rūpa saññā ati saññā sīsena rūpāvacara jhānāni
translated: The fine-material-sphere jhānas are intended as the flame of a lamp.

original: ceva tadārammaṇāni ca vuttāni. Rūpāvacarajjhānampi hi “rūpa”nti vuccati uttarapadalopena
analyzed: ca iva tad ārammaṇāni ca vuttāni rūpāvacara jhānam pi hi rūpanti vuccati uttara pada lopena
translated: And the jhānas are called “material” and their objects are called “material” too.🔽For the fine-material jhāna is called “material” in such passages as “Possessed of visible matter he sees instances of visible matter” , where the word “material” is abbreviated.

original: “rūpī rūpāni passatī”tiādīsu. Tassa ārammaṇampi kasiṇarūpaṃ “rūpa”nti vuccati purimapadalopena🔽“bahiddhā rūpāni passati suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇānī”tiādīsu. Tasmā idha rūpe rūpajjhāne taṃsahagatasaññā
analyzed: rūpī rūpāni passati itiādīsu tassa ārammaṇam pi kasiṇa rūpam rūpanti vuccati purima pada lopena  bahiddhā rūpāni passati suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇāni itiādīsu tasmai idha rūpe rūpa jhāne tad sahagata saññā
translated: And its object, the kasiṇa materiality, is called “material” in such passages as “He sees instances of visible matter externally … beautiful and ugly” , where the word “visible” is abbreviated.🔽So the fine-material jhānas are called “perceptions of materiality” in the sense that they are perceptions of that kind.

original: rūpasaññāti evaṃ saññāsīsena rūpāvacarajjhānāni vuttāni. Rūpaṃ saññā assāti rūpasaññaṃ,🔽rūpassa nāmanti vuttaṃ hoti. Evaṃ pathavīkasiṇādibhedassa tadārammaṇassa cetaṃ adhivacananti🔽veditabbaṃ. Paṭighasaññāti cakkhādīnaṃ vatthūnaṃ rūpādīnaṃ ārammaṇānañca paṭighātena
analyzed: rūpa saññā ti evam saññā sīsena rūpa avacara jhānāni vuttāni rūpam saññā assa ati rūpa saññam  rūpassa nāman ti vuttam hoti evam pathavī kasiṇa ādi bhedassa tad ārammaṇassa ca itam adhivacanan ti  veditabbam paṭigha saññā ti cakkha ādīnam vatthūnam rūpa ādīnam ārammaṇānaṃ ca paṭighātena
translated: “Perceptions of materiality” is a bahuvrīhi compound, meaning “having materiality as perception.”🔽So it should be understood that this is a designation for the kasiṇa materiality classed as earth kasiṇa, etc., and for the jhāna classed as having earth kasiṇa, etc., as its object.

original: paṭihananena visayivisayasamodhāne samuppannā dvipañcaviññāṇasahagatā saññā paṭighasaññā.
analyzed: paṭihananena visayi visaya samodhāne samuppannā dvi pañca viññāṇa sahagatā saññā paṭigha saññā
translated: “Perceptions of resistance”: the perceptions that arise together with the five consciousnesses are called “perceptions of resistance” because they arise by impingement on the physical supports of the eye, etc., and on the objects consisting of visible data, etc.

original: Nānattasaññāyoti nānatte gocare pavattā saññā, nānattā vā saññā nānattasaññā, aṭṭha
analyzed: nānatta saññāyaḥ ti nānatte gocare pavattā saññā nānattā vā saññā nānatta saññāḥ aṭṭha
translated: The words “perceptions of variety” are a designation for the forty-four kinds of perception, that is,

original: kāmāvacarakusalasaññā, dvādasa akusalasaññā, ekādasa kāmāvacarakusalavipākasaññā,
analyzed: kāmāvacara kusala saññā dvādasa akusala saññā ekādasa kāmāvacara kusala vipāka saññā
translated: eight kinds of sense-sphere profitable perception, twelve kinds of unprofitable perception, eleven kinds of sense-sphere resultant perception,

original: dve akusalavipākasaññā, ekādasa kāmāvacarakiriyasaññāti etāsaṃ catucattālīsasaññānametaṃ
analyzed: dve akusala vipāka saññāḥ ekādasa kāmāvacara kiriya saññā ati etāsam catucattālīsa saññānam etam
translated: two kinds of unprofitable-resultant perception, and twelve kinds of sense-sphere functional perception.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Etā hi yasmā rūpasaññādibhede nānatte nānāsabhāve gocare pavattanti,🔽yasmā ca nānattā nānāsabhāvā aññamaññaṃ asadisā, tasmā “nānattasaññā”ti vuccanti.🔽Aniccassa, aniccanti vā anupassanā aniccānupassanā, tebhūmakadhammānaṃ aniccataṃ
analyzed: adhivacanam etāḥ hi yasmā rūpa saññā ādi bhede nānatte nānā sabhāve gocare pavattanti  yasmā ca nānattā nānā sabhāvā aññamaññam asadisā tasmā nānatta saññā iti vuccanti  aniccassa aniccanti vā anupassanā anicca anupassanā tebhūmaka dhammānam anicca taṃ
translated: These are called “perceptions of variety” because they occur with variety as their domain, and because they are themselves of various kinds,🔽and because they are various, not alike, one with another.🔽The contemplation of what is impermanent as “impermanent” is the contemplation of impermanence. This is a name for the contemplation that occurs by taking the impermanence of states in the three planes as its object.

original: gahetvā pavattāya anupassanāyetaṃ nāmaṃ. Niccasaññanti saṅkhatadhamme “niccā sassatā”ti
analyzed: gahetvā pavattāya anupassanāya itam nāmam nicca saññanti saṅkhata dhamme niccā
translated: The perception of permanence is a wrong perception that occurs with the idea that formed states are permanent and eternal.

original: pavattaṃ micchāsaññaṃ. Saññāsīsena diṭṭhicittānampi gahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Esa nayo
analyzed: pavattam micchāsaññam saññā sīsena diṭṭhi cittānam pi gahaṇam daṭṭhabbam esa nayo
translated: The word “perception” should be understood to include the view and the cognizance that occur with it.

original: ito paresupi. Nibbidānupassanāyāti saṅkhāresu nibbijjanākārena pavattāya anupassanāya.🔽Nandinti sappītikataṇhaṃ. Virāgānupassanāyāti saṅkhāresu virajjanākārena pavattāya🔽anupassanāya. Nirodhānupassanāyāti saṅkhārānaṃ nirodhassa anupassanāya. “Te saṅkhārā
analyzed: itas paresu pi nibbida anupassanāya ati saṅkhāresu nibbijjana ākārena pavattāya anupassanāya  nandinti sappītika taṇham virāga anupassanāya ati saṅkhāresu virajjana ākārena pavattāya  anupassanāya nirodha anupassanāya ati saṅkhārānam nirodhassa anupassanāya te saṅkhārāḥ
translated: And also in the rest of the section. By contemplation of dispassion: by contemplation occurring in the mode of dispassion for formations.🔽By contemplation of fading away: by contemplation occurring in the mode of fading away of greed in formations.

original: nirujjhantiyeva, āyatiṃ samudayavasena na uppajjantī”ti evaṃ vā anupassanā nirodhānupassanā.
analyzed: nirujjhantiyā iva āyatim samudaya vasena na uppajjanti iti evam vā anupassanā nirodha anupassanā
translated: By contemplation of cessation: by contemplation of the cessation of formations. Or alternatively, contemplation as “formations cease, they do not arise again in the future by way of origination” is contemplation of cessation.

original: Tenevāha – “nirodhānupassanāya nirodheti, no samudetī”ti. Muccitukamyatā hi ayaṃ🔽balappattāti. Paṭinissajjanākārena pavattā anupassanā paṭinissaggānupassanā. Paṭisaṅkhā🔽santiṭṭhanā hi ayaṃ. Ādānanti niccādivasena gahaṇaṃ. Santatisamūhakiccārammaṇānaṃ
analyzed: tena iva āha nirodha anupassanāya nirodheti no samudeti iti muccitu kamya tā hi ayam  bala ppattā ti paṭinissajjana ākārena pavattā anupassanā paṭinissagga anupassanā paṭisaṅkhā  santiṭṭhanā hi ayam ādāna nti nicca ādi vasena gahaṇam santati samūha kicca ārammaṇānam
translated: Hence it is said, “He ceases by contemplation of cessation, not by contemplation of origin” . For this is the desire for deliverance that has reached the state of strength.🔽By contemplation of relinquishment: by contemplation occurring in the mode of relinquishment. For this is the establishment by reflection.🔽By the perception of compactness: by the perception of compactness that is the apprehension of unity by way of continuity, mass, function, and object.

original: vasena ekattaggahaṇaṃ ghanasaññā. Āyūhanaṃ abhisaṅkharaṇaṃ. Avatthāvisesāpatti vipariṇāmo.
analyzed: vasena ekatta ggahaṇam ghana saññā āyūhanam abhisaṅkharaṇam avatthā avisesa āpatti vipariṇāmo
translated: Accumulation is the act of accumulating. Change-of-lineage is the attainment of a different state.

original: Dhuvasaññanti thirabhāvaggahaṇaṃ. Nimittanti samūhādighanavasena sakiccaparicchedatāya🔽ca saṅkhārānaṃ saviggahaggahaṇaṃ. Paṇidhinti rāgādipaṇidhiṃ. Sā panatthato taṇhāvasena
analyzed: dhuva saññanti thira bhāva ggahaṇam nimittam ti samūha ādi ghana vasena sa kicca pariccheda tāya  ca saṅkhārānam sa viggaha ggahaṇam paṇidhim ti rāga ādi paṇidhim sā pana atthataḥ taṇhā vasena
translated: ‘Permanence’ is the apprehension of stability. ‘Sign’ is the apprehension of formations as having a separate individual essence by way of the compactness of the aggregate, etc., and by way of the delimitation of their individual functions.

original: saṅkhāresu nanditā. Abhinivesanti attānudiṭṭhiṃ.🔽Aniccadukkhādivasena sabbadhammatīraṇaṃ adhipaññādhammavipassanā. Sārādānābhinivesanti
analyzed: saṅkhāresu nanditāḥ abhinivesanti attā anudiṭṭhim  anicca dukkha ādi vasena sabba dhamma tīraṇam adhi paññā dhamma vipassanā
translated: ‘Wish’ is the wish for lust, etc. But this, in meaning, is delight in formations by way of craving. ‘Adherence’ is the adherence to the view of self.

original: asāre sāraggahaṇavipallāsaṃ. Issarakuttādivasena loko samuppannoti abhiniveso sammohābhiniveso.
analyzed: asāre sāra ggahaṇa vipallāsam issara kutta ādi vasena loko samuppanno ti abhiniveso sammoha abhiniveso
translated: ‘Insight into the Dhamma through higher wisdom’ is the discernment of all dhammas as impermanent, painful, etc. ‘Adherence to adopting’ is the perversion of apprehending the insubstantial as substantial. ‘Adherence to confusion’ is the adherence to the view that the world arose by chance, etc.

original: Keci pana “ahosiṃ nu kho ahamatītamaddhānantiādinā pavattasaṃsayāpatti sammohābhiniveso”ti🔽vadanti. Saṅkhāresu leṇatāṇabhāvaggahaṇaṃ ālayābhiniveso. “Ālayaratā ālayasammuditā”ti
analyzed: keci pana ahosim nu kho aham atītam addhā an anti ādinā pavatta saṃsaya āpatti sammoha abhinivesaḥ ti  vadanti saṅkhāresu leṇa tāṇa bhāva ggahaṇam ālaya abhinivesaḥ ālaya ratā ālaya sammuditā ati
translated: But some say that the adherence to confusion is the occurrence of doubt in the form of the question, “Did I exist in the past?”🔽‘Adherence to a core’ is the apprehension of formations as a refuge and a protection. ‘Adherence to a core’ is craving, because of the statement, “Delighting in core-making, rejoicing in core-making” .

original: vacanato ālayo taṇhā, sāyeva cakkhādīsu rūpādīsu ca abhinivesavasena pavattiyā ālayābhinivesoti
analyzed: vacanataḥ ālayaḥ taṇhā sāya iva cakkha ādīsu rūpa ādīsu ca abhinivesa vasena pavattiyā ālaya abhiniveso ti
translated: Since it occurs by way of adherence to the eye, etc., and to visible objects, etc., it is called ‘adherence to a core.’

original: keci. “Evaṃvidhā saṅkhārā paṭinissajjīyantī”ti pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ paṭisaṅkhānupassanā.🔽Vaṭṭato vigatattā vivaṭṭaṃ, nibbānaṃ. Tattha ārammaṇakaraṇasaṅkhātena anupassanena
analyzed: evaṃvidhā saṅkhārā paṭinissajjīyanti iti pavattam ñāṇam paṭisaṅkhā anupassanā  vaṭṭataḥ vigata ttā vivaṭṭam nibbānam tattha ārammaṇa karaṇa saṅkhātena anupassanena
translated: “Such are formations” is the knowledge occurring as the contemplation of relinquishment.🔽The “turning away” is Nibbāna because it is the turning away from the round of rebirths. The contemplation of the turning away of occurrence is the supramundane path.

original: pavattiyā vivaṭṭānupassanā, gotrabhū. Saṃyogābhinivesanti saṃyujjanavasena saṅkhāresu🔽abhinivisanaṃ. Diṭṭhekaṭṭheti diṭṭhiyā sahajātekaṭṭhe pahānekaṭṭhe ca. Oḷāriketi
analyzed: pavattiyā saṃyoga abhinivesanti saṃyuj jana vasena saṅkhāresu  abhinivisanam diṭṭhekaṭṭhā iti diṭṭhiyā sahajāta ikaṭṭhe pahāna ikaṭṭhe ca oḷārikā iti
translated: The “clinging to the underlying tendency” is the clinging to formations by way of the underlying tendency to cling.

original: uparimaggavajjhe kilese apekkhitvā vuttaṃ, aññathā dassanapahātabbāpi dutiyamaggavajjhehi🔽oḷārikāti. Aṇusahagateti aṇubhūte. Idaṃ heṭṭhimamaggavajjhe apekkhitvā vuttaṃ. Sabbakileseti
analyzed: upari magga vajjhe kilese apekkhitvā vuttam aññathā dassana pahātabbā api dutiya magga vajjhehi  oḷārikā ati aṇu sahagatā iti aṇu bhūte idam heṭṭhima magga vajjhe apekkhitvā vuttam sabba kilese iti
translated: “The gross” is said with reference to the defilements abandoned by the path of seeing and by the first path. Otherwise, those abandoned by the path of seeing would be gross in relation to those abandoned by the second path.

original: avasiṭṭhasabbakilese. Na hi paṭhamādimaggehipi pahīnā kilesā puna pahīyantīti.
analyzed: avasiṭṭha sabba kilese na hi paṭhama ādi maggehi pi pahīnā kilesā puna pahīyanti iti
translated: “The subtle” is said with reference to the defilements abandoned by the lower path. For the defilements abandoned by the first path, etc., are not abandoned again.

original: Kakkhaḷattaṃ kathinabhāvo. Paggharaṇaṃ dravabhāvo. Lokiyavāyunā bhastāya viya yena
analyzed: kakkhaḷattam kathina bhāvaḥ paggharaṇam drava bhāvaḥ lokiya vāyunā yena
translated: “The gross” is the state of being hard, the state of being solid. “The liquid” is the state of being fluid. “The hot” is the state of being hot. “The mobile” is the state of being light, like the wind that blows by way of the mundane wind element.

original: taṃtaṃkalāpassa uddhumāyanaṃ, thaddhabhāvo vā, taṃ vitthambhanaṃ. Vijjamānepi kalāpantarabhūtānaṃ🔽kalāpantarabhūtehi phuṭṭhabhāve taṃtaṃbhūtavivittatā rūpapariyanto ākāsoti yesaṃ
analyzed: tad tad kalāpassa thaddha bhāvaḥ vā tam vitthambhanam vijjamāne pi  phuṭṭha bhāve taṃ taṃ bhūta vivitta tā rūpa pariyantaḥ yesam
translated: The distension of the respective aggregate is its distension, or its rigidity is its distension.🔽And although the primary elements in one aggregate are in contact with those in another aggregate, the delimitation of the primary elements in one aggregate by those in another is space.

original: yo paricchedo, tehi so asamphuṭṭhova, aññathā bhūtānaṃ paricchedabhāvo na siyā byāpitabhāvāpattito.🔽Yasmiṃ kalāpe bhūtānaṃ paricchedo, tehi asamphuṭṭhabhāvo asamphuṭṭhalakkhaṇaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: yo paricchedo tehi so a samphuṭṭhaḥ u va aññathā bhūtānam pariccheda bhāvaḥ na siyā byāpita bhāva āpattito  yasmin kalāpe bhūtānam paricchedaḥ tehi a samphuṭṭha bhāvaḥ a samphuṭṭha lakkhaṇam tena āha
translated: The delimitation of the primary elements in one aggregate by those in another is the characteristic of non-adhesion.

original: – bhagavā ākāsadhātuniddese “asamphuṭṭho catūhi mahābhūtehī”ti.
analyzed: bhagavā ākāsadhātu niddese asamphuṭṭhaḥ catūhi mahābhūtehi iti
translated: That is why the Blessed One said in the description of the space element: “The space element should be seen as non-adhesion to the four great elements” .🔽The arising of the dissimilar in the presence of the dissimilar is distension.

original: Virodhipaccayasannipāte visadisuppatti ruppanaṃ. Cetanāpadhānattā saṅkhārakkhandhadhammānaṃ
analyzed: virodhi paccaya sannipāte visadisa uppatti ruppanam cetanā apadhāna ttā saṅkhāra kkhandha dhammānam
translated: Since volition is the principal factor in the formations aggregate,

original: cetanāvasenetaṃ vuttaṃ – “saṅkhārānaṃ abhisaṅkharaṇalakkhaṇa”nti. Tathā hi suttantabhājanīye
analyzed: cetanā vasena itam vuttam saṅkhārānam abhisaṅkharaṇa lakkhaṇan ti tathā hi suttanta bhājanīye
translated: it is said that the characteristic of the formations aggregate is the act of forming. For in the Description of the Suttas it is said:

original: saṅkhārakkhandhavibhaṅge “cakkhusamphassajā cetanā”tiādinā cetanāva vibhattā. Abhisaṅkharalakkhaṇā
analyzed: saṅkhāra khandha vibhaṅge cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā ati ādinā cetanā ava vibhattā abhisaṅkhara lakkhaṇā
translated: And volition has the characteristic of causing to become ,

original: ca cetanā. Yathāha – “tattha katamo puññābhisaṅkhāro, kusalā cetanā kāmāvacarā”tiādi.
analyzed: ca cetanā yathā āha tattha katamo puñña abhisaṅkhāro kusalā cetanā kāmāvacarā atiādi
translated: as it is said: “Herein, what is a meritorious formation? It is profitable volition belonging to the sense sphere” .

original: Pharaṇaṃ savipphārikatā. Assaddhiyeti assaddhiyahetu. Nimittatthe bhummaṃ. Esa nayo
analyzed: pharaṇam sa vipphārika tā assaddhiyā iti assaddhiya hetu nimitta atthe bhummam esa nayo
translated: Spreading is the state of having spread. Lack of faith is the cause of lack of faith. The locative case is in the sense of a reason. So too🔽with idleness, etc.

original: kosajjetiādīsu. Vūpasamalakkhaṇanti kāyacittapariḷāhūpasamalakkhaṇaṃ. Līnuddhaccarahite
analyzed: kosajja iti ādīsu vūpasama lakkhaṇanti kāya citta pariḷāha upasama lakkhaṇam līn uddhacca rahite
translated: The characteristic of allaying is the characteristic of allaying the feverish burning of body and mind. When the mind is in a higher stage free from both sluggishness and agitation,

original: adhicitte pavattamāne paggahaniggahasampahaṃsanesu abyāvaṭatāya ajjhupekkhanaṃ paṭisaṅkhānaṃ🔽pakkhapātupacchedato.🔽Musāvādādīnaṃ visaṃvādanādikiccatāya lūkhānaṃ apariggāhakānaṃ paṭipakkhabhāvato pariggāhakasabhāvā
analyzed: adhicitte pavattamāne paggaha niggaha sampahaṃsanesu a byāvaṭa tāya ajjhupekkhanam paṭisaṅkhānam  pakkha pāta upacchedataḥ  musāvāda ādīnam visaṃvādana ādi kicca tāya lūkhānam a pariggāhakānam paṭipakkha bhāvato pariggāhaka sabhāvā
translated: equanimity is the act of looking on indifferently, without taking sides, in regard to the arousing, the restraining, and the encouraging of that mind.🔽It is the act of looking on indifferently, without taking sides, in regard to the arousing, the restraining, and the encouraging of that mind.🔽Because of its function of deceiving, etc., wrong speech, etc., are rough, and because of their function of not deceiving, etc., right speech, etc., are refined.

original: sammāvācā, siniddhabhāvato sampayuttadhamme sammāvācāpaccayasubhāsitānaṃ sotārañca
analyzed: sammā vācā siniddha bhāvataḥ sampayutta dhamme sammāvācā paccaya subhāsitānam sotāram ca
translated: Because of their being the opposite of the former, they are the counterparts of wrong speech, etc.🔽Because of their being the opposite of the former, they are the counterparts of wrong speech, etc.🔽Because of their being the opposite of the former, they are the counterparts of wrong speech, etc.

original: puggalaṃ pariggaṇhātīti sā pariggahalakkhaṇā. Kāyikakiriyā kiñci kattabbaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti,🔽sayañca samuṭṭhahanaṃ ghaṭanaṃ hotīti sammākammantasaṅkhātā viratīpi samuṭṭhānalakkhaṇā
analyzed: puggalam pariggaṇhāti iti sā pariggaha lakkhaṇā kāyika kiriyā kiñci kattabbam samuṭṭhāpeti  sayam ca samuṭṭhahanam ghaṭanam hoti iti sammā kammanta saṅkhātā viratī api samuṭṭhāna lakkhaṇā
translated: Right action is the characteristic of originating, since it originates bodily action, which is a doing of something,🔽and since it is the originating, the bringing about, of the abstention called right action.

original: daṭṭhabbā, sampayuttadhammānaṃ vā ukkhipanaṃ samuṭṭhāpanaṃ kāyikakiriyāya bhārukkhipanaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbā sampayutta dhammānam vā ukkhipanam samuṭṭhāpanam kāyika kiriyāya bhārukkhipanam
translated: Or the characteristic of originating can be regarded as the lifting up of conascent states, as the lifting of a load is for bodily action.

original: viya. Jīvamānassa sattassa, sampayuttadhammānaṃ vā jīvitindriyapavattiyā, ājīvasseva
analyzed: viya jīvamānassa sattassa sampayutta dhammānam vā jīvitindriya pavattiyā ājīvassa iva
translated: The purification or cleansing of a living being’s conascent states, or of the life faculty itself,🔽is the characteristic of right livelihood. “Herein, ‘formations’ are intended as volition” , it is said.

original: vā suddhi vodānaṃ. “Saṅkhārā”ti idha cetanā adhippetāti vuttaṃ – “saṅkhārānaṃ cetanālakkhaṇa”nti.🔽Namanaṃ ārammaṇābhimukhabhāvo. Āyatanaṃ pavattanaṃ. Āyatanavasena hi āyasaṅkhātānaṃ
analyzed: vā suddhi vodānam saṅkhārā ti idha cetanā adhippetā ati vuttam saṅkhārānam cetanā lakkhaṇam ti  namanam ārammaṇa abhimukha bhāvaḥ āyatanam pavattanam āyatana vasena hi
translated: The characteristic of formations is the act of willing.🔽Bending is the facing of the object.🔽The sense base is the occurrence. For the occurrence of the states called mind and matter is by way of the sense bases.

original: cittacetasikānaṃ pavatti. Taṇhāya hetulakkhaṇanti vaṭṭassa janakahetubhāvo, maggassa
analyzed: citta cetasikānam pavatti taṇhāya hetu lakkhaṇan ti vaṭṭassa janaka hetu bhāvaḥ maggassa
translated: The characteristic of craving is the cause. For craving is the cause that generates the round.

original: pana nibbānasampāpakattanti ayametesaṃ viseso.
analyzed: pana nibbāna sampāpaka ttan ti ayam etesam visesaḥ
translated: But the characteristic of the path is the bringing about of Nibbāna. This is the difference between them.

original: Tathalakkhaṇaṃ aviparītasabhāvo. Ekaraso aññamaññanātivattanaṃ anūnādhikabhāvo. Yuganaddhā
analyzed: tatha lakkhaṇam aviparīta sabhāvaḥ ekarasaḥ aññamaññanā ativattanam anūna adhika bhāvaḥ yuga naddhā
translated: The characteristic of that is its non-deceptive individual essence. The single taste is the absence of mutual contradiction. The yoking together is the yoking of serenity and insight.

original: samathavipassanāva. “Saddhāpaññā paggahāvikkhepā”tipi vadanti. Khayoti kilesakkhayo
analyzed: samatha vipassanā ava saddhā paññā paggaha avikkhepā ti pi vadanti khayaḥ ti kilesa kkhayo
translated: Or they say that it is faith and understanding, and the absence of agitation. The “x” is the path, which is the destruction of defilements.

original: maggo. Anuppādapariyosānatāya anuppādo phalaṃ. Passaddhi kilesavūpasamo. Chandassāti🔽kattukāmatāchandassa. Mūlalakkhaṇaṃ patiṭṭhābhāvo. Samuṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ ārammaṇappaṭipādakatāya
analyzed: maggaḥ anuppāda pariyosāna tāya anuppādaḥ phalam passaddhi kilesa vūpasamaḥ chandassa ati  kattu kāma tā chandassa mūla lakkhaṇam patiṭṭhā bhāvo samuṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam ārammaṇa ppaṭipādaka tāya
translated: The non-arising is the fruition, which has the non-arising of defilements as its culmination. The peace is the stilling of defilements. The “desire” is the desire to act.🔽The root characteristic is the state of being a foundation. The originating characteristic is the cause of the arising of the associated states by way of supplying an object.

original: sampayuttadhammānaṃ uppattihetutā. Samodhānaṃ visayādisannipātena gahetabbākāro,
analyzed: sampayutta dhammānam uppatti hetu tā samodhānam visaya ādi sannipātena gahetabba ākāro
translated: The combination is the mode of apprehension that is to be apprehended by the combination of the object, etc.

original: yā saṅgatīti vuccati. Samaṃ, saha odahanti anena sampayuttadhammāti vā samodhānaṃ,
analyzed: yā saṅgati iti vuccati samam saha odahanti anena sampayutta dhammā ati vā samodhānam
translated: This is what is called “association.” The “together” is the associated states, which are “taken together” by this, or the combination is the contact, which “takes together” the associated states.

original: phasso. Samosaranti sannipatanti etthāti samosaraṇaṃ. Vedanāya vinā appavattamānā
analyzed: phassaḥ samosaranti sannipatanti ettha ati samosaraṇam vedanāya vinā appavattamānā
translated: The “meeting” is the meeting-place. The associated states, which do not occur without feeling,

original: sampayuttadhammā vedanānubhavananimittaṃ samosaṭā viya hontīti evaṃ vuttaṃ. Gopānasīnaṃ
analyzed: sampayutta dhammāḥ vedanā anubhavana nimittam samosaṭāḥ viya honti iti evam vuttam gopānasīnam
translated: are as if “taken together” with the feeling, which is the cause of their experiencing. Thus it is said. The “gate” is the eye, etc.

original: kūṭaṃ viya sampayuttānaṃ pāmokkhabhāvo pamukhalakkhaṇaṃ. Tato, tesaṃ vā sampayuttadhammānaṃ
analyzed: kūṭam viya sampayuttānam pāmokkha bhāvaḥ pamukha lakkhaṇam tatas tesam vā sampayutta dhammānam
translated: The characteristic of pre-eminence is the state of being foremost of the associated states, as the peak is of the mountain. “Beyond that” means beyond that,

original: uttari padhānanti tatuttari. Paññuttarā hi kusalā dhammā. Vimuttiyāti phalassa. Tañhi
analyzed: uttari padhānanti tat uttari paññuttarāḥ hi kusalāḥ dhammāḥ vimuttiyā ati phalassa tat hi
translated: for profitable states are pre-eminent in wisdom. “With freedom as their culmination” : the fruit,

original: sīlādiguṇasārassa paramukkaṃsabhāvena sāraṃ. Ayañca lakkhaṇavibhāgo chadhātupañcajhānaṅgādivasena🔽taṃtaṃsuttapadānusārena porāṇaṭṭhakathāyaṃ āgatanayena ca katoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tathā🔽hi pubbe vuttopi koci dhammo pariyāyantarappakāsanatthaṃ puna dassito, tato eva ca🔽“chandamūlakā kusalā dhammā manasikārasamuṭṭhānā phassasamodhānā vedanāsamosaraṇā”ti,
analyzed: sīla ādi guṇa sārassa param ukkaṃsa bhāvena sāram ayam ca lakkhaṇa vibhāgo cha dhātu pañca jhā anaṅga ādi vasena  tad tad sutta pada anusārena porāṇa ṭṭhakathā ayam āgata nayena ca kato ti daṭṭhabbam tathā  hi pubbe vuttaḥ api koci dhammaḥ pariyāya antara ppakāsana ttham puna dassitaḥ tatas eva ca  chanda mūlakā kusalā dhammā manasikāra samuṭṭhānā phassa samodhānā vedanā samosaraṇā ati
translated: for that is the essence since it is the supreme essence of the essence consisting in virtue, etc. And this analysis of the characteristics should be regarded as given in accordance with the method stated in the old commentaries in the way beginning, “The four elements have the characteristic of upholding, as a mountain has” ,

original: “paññuttarā kusalā dhammā”ti, “vimuttisāramidaṃ brahmacariya”nti, “nibbānogadhañhi,
analyzed: paññuttarā kusalā dhammā ati vimutti sāram idam brahmacariyanti nibbāna ogadham hi
translated: and in the way beginning, “The five aggregates are called suffering, as a disease is” , and in the way beginning, “The six bases have the characteristic of revealing, as light has” , and in the way beginning, “The four foundations of mindfulness have the characteristic of establishing, as a foundation has” , and in the way beginning, “The four right endeavours have the characteristic of trying, as a yoke has” , and in the way beginning, “The four bases for success have the characteristic of footing, as a foundation has” , and in the way beginning, “The five spiritual faculties have the characteristic of controlling, as a general has” , and in the way beginning, “The five spiritual powers have the characteristic of overpowering, as a king has” , and in the way beginning, “The seven factors of enlightenment have the characteristic of enlightenment, as wisdom has” , and in the way beginning, “The Noble Eightfold Path has the characteristic of a path, as a road has” , and in the way beginning, “The four fruits of asceticism have the characteristic of a refuge, as a shadow has” , and in the way beginning, “The four establishments of mindfulness have the characteristic of establishing, as a foundation has” , and in the way beginning, “The four right endeavours have the characteristic of trying, as a yoke has” , and in the way beginning, “The four bases for success have the characteristic of footing, as a foundation has” , and in the way beginning, “The five spiritual faculties have the characteristic of controlling, as a general has” , and in the way beginning, “The five spiritual powers have the characteristic of overpowering, as a king has” , and in the way beginning, “The seven factors of enlightenment have the characteristic of enlightenment, as wisdom has” , and in the way beginning, “The Noble Eightfold Path has the characteristic of a path, as

original: āvuso, brahmacariyaṃ nibbānapariyosāna”nti ca suttapadānaṃ vasena “chandassa mūlalakkhaṇa”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: āvuso brahmacariyam nibbāna pariyosānanti ca sutta padānam vasena chandassa mūla lakkhaṇa ntiādi vuttaṃ
translated: and the words “the root characteristic of will” are stated by way of the sutta passage: “The life of purity, friends, has Nibbāna as its culmination.”

original: Tathadhammā nāma cattāri ariyasaccāni aviparītasabhāvattā. Tathāni taṃsabhāvattā,
analyzed: nāma cattāri ariya saccāni aviparīta sabhāvattā tathāni
translated: The words “the truths that are thus” are the four noble truths, because of their non-erroneous nature. They are “thus” because of their nature.

original: avitathāni amusāsabhāvattā, anaññathāni aññākārarahitattā. Jātipaccayasambhūtasamudāgataṭṭhoti
analyzed: avitathāni anaññathāni añña ākāra rahita ttā jāti paccaya sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭhā ti
translated: They are “not otherwise” because of their non-deceptive nature and because of their freedom from otherness. The meaning of “originated and arisen by way of the condition of birth” is

original: jātipaccayā sambhūtaṃ hutvā sahitassa attano paccayānurūpassa uddhaṃ uddhaṃ āgatabhāvo,
analyzed: jāti paccayā sambhūtam hutvā sahitassa attanaḥ paccaya anurūpassa uddham uddham āgata bhāvo
translated: the state of having come up higher and higher by way of the condition of birth, having been originated by way of the condition of birth, and having the nature of being in accordance with the condition.

original: anupavattatthoti attho. Atha vā sambhūtaṭṭho ca samudāgataṭṭho ca sambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho,
analyzed: anupavatta ttho ti attho atha vā sambhūta ṭho ca samudāgata ṭṭho ca sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭho
translated: The meaning is: “having occurred.” Or else, the meaning of “originated” and the meaning of “arisen” is the meaning of “originated and arisen.”

original: na jātito jarāmaraṇaṃ na hoti, na ca jātiṃ vinā aññato hotīti jātipaccayasambhūtaṭṭho,
analyzed: na jātitaḥ jarā maraṇam na hoti na ca jātim vinā aññatas hoti iti jāti paccaya sambhūta ṭṭho
translated: Death and birth do not occur without birth, nor do they occur from anything else. Therefore, the meaning of “originated by way of the condition of birth” is🔽the state of having come up by way of the condition of birth. And the meaning of “arisen thus by way of the condition of birth” is

original: itthañca jātito samudāgacchatīti jātipaccayasamudāgataṭṭho. Yā yā jāti yathā yathā
analyzed: ittham ca jātitaḥ samudāgacchati iti jāti paccaya samudāgata ṭṭhaḥ yā yā jāti yathā yathā
translated: the state of having come up by way of the condition of birth. Whatever birth there is, in whatever way there is birth,

original: paccayo hoti, tadanurūpaṃ pātubhāvoti attho. Avijjāya saṅkhārānaṃ paccayaṭṭhoti etthāpi
