analyzed: karissati ālimpesi iti aggim adāsi aggim jālesi iti attho pekkhāti āgamehi upadhi sampadā ti
translated: “He set fire to it”: he put fire to it; the meaning is, he made the fire burn. “Wait”: come back. “Physical perfection”:

original: sarīrasampatti. Vaṭarukkhaṃ patvāti nigrodharukkhaṃ patvā. Suvaṇṇakaṭaketi suvaṇṇavalaye.
analyzed: sarīra sampatti vaṭa rukkham patvā ati nigrodha rukkham patvā suvaṇṇa kaṭake iti suvaṇṇa valaye
translated: physical excellence. “Having fallen from the fig tree”: having fallen from the banyan tree. “A golden chain”: a golden bracelet.

original: Abbhuṃ meti me avaḍḍhīti attho. Anto asodhetvāti paṇṇasālāya anto kassaci atthibhāvaṃ
analyzed: abbhum mā iti me avaḍḍhi iti atthaḥ antar a sodhetvā iti paṇṇa sālāya antar kassaci atthi bhāvam
translated: The meaning is: I have no regret.

original: vā natthibhāvaṃ vā anupadhāretvā. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: vā natthi bhāvam vā an upadhāretvā sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: Without examining inside: without examining whether there is anything inside the leaf hut. The rest is easy to understand.

original: Uttarānandamātāvatthu🔽262. Pañcame upanissayaṃ disvāti iminā yathā visesādhigamassa satipi paccuppannapaccayasamavāye🔽avassaṃ upanissayasampadā icchitabbā, evaṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyabhāvena vipaccanakassa
analyzed: uttara ānanda mātā avatthu  pañcame upanissayam disvā iti iminā yathā visesa adhigamassa sati pi paccuppanna paccaya samavāye  avassam upanissaya sampadā icchitabbā evam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya bhāvena vipaccanakassa
translated: The story of Uttarānandamātā🔽In the fifth story, “seeing the support,” he shows that just as the presence of the support is required for the acquisition of distinction even when the necessary conditions are present,

original: kammassapi paccuppannasamavāyo viya upanissayasampadāpi savisesā icchitabbāti dasseti.
analyzed: kammassa api paccuppanna samavāyaḥ viya upanissaya sampadā api sa visesā icchitabbā ati dasseti
translated: so too the presence of the support is required for the ripening of kamma that is to be experienced in the next life, just as the presence of the necessary conditions is required.

original: Tathā hi ukkaṃsagatasappurisūpanissayayonisomanasikāresu labbhamānesupi upanissayarahitassa
analyzed: tathā hi ukkaṃsa gata sappurisa upanissaya yoni so manasikāresu labbhamānesu pi upanissaya rahitassa
translated: For even when the support of a great man and the right kind of attention are available, the acquisition of distinction does not occur in the absence of the support.

original: visesādhigamo na sampajjatevāti. Kappiyaṃ katvāti yathā kappiyaṃ hoti, tathā katvā.
analyzed: visesa adhigamaḥ na sampajjate iva ati kappiyam katvā iti yathā kappiyam hoti tathā katvā
translated: Having made it allowable: having made it allowable in the way that is allowable.

original: Patte patiṭṭhapeyyāti āhāraṃ dānamukhe vissajjeyya. Tīhi cetanāhīti pubbabhāgamuñcaanumodanācetanāhi. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: patte patiṭṭhapeyya ati āhāram dāna mukhe vissajjeyya tīhi cetanāhi iti pubbabhāga muñca anumodanā cetanāhi vuttam ha etam
translated: He should place it in the bowl: he should give the gift at the door of alms giving. With three intentions: with the intentions to give, to give up, and to rejoice. For this is said:

original: “Pubbeva dānā sumano, dadaṃ cittaṃ pasādaye;
analyzed: pubbā iva dānā sumanaḥ dadam cittam pasādaye
translated: “Before giving, he is glad; while giving, his mind is serene;

original: Datvā attamano hoti, esā puññassa sampadā”ti. ;
analyzed: da tvā atta manaḥ hoti esā puññassa sampadā ati
translated: After giving, he is not a prey to remorse: this is the perfection of giving.”

original: Tava manaṃ sandhārehīti “ajja bhattaṃ cirāyita”nti kodhato tava cittaṃ sandhārehi,
analyzed: tava manam sandhārehi iti ajja bhattam kodhataḥ tava cittam sandhārehi
translated: You should restrain your mind: you should restrain your mind from anger, thinking, “Today the meal is late.”

original: mā kujjhīti attho. Olokitolokitaṭṭhānaṃ…pe… samparikiṇṇaṃ viya ahosīti tena kasitaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: mā kujjhi iti attho olokita ulokita ṭhānam pe samparikiṇṇam viya ahosi iti tena kasita ṭṭhānam
translated: Do not be angry: the meaning is, do not be annoyed. The place looked as if it had been swept: the place that had been ploughed

original: sabbaṃ suvaṇṇabhāvāpattiyā mahākosātakipupphehi sañchannaṃ viya ahosi. Tādiseti tayā
analyzed: sabbam suvaṇṇa bhāva āpattiyā mahākosātaki pupphehi sañchannam viya ahosi tādisā iti tayā
translated: looked as if it had been covered with great kosātakī flowers all turned into gold. Such as you: like you.

original: sadise. Na kopemīti na vināsemi, jātiyā na hīḷemi. Pūjaṃ karotīti sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: sadise na kopemi iti na vināsemi jātiyā na hīḷemi pūjam karoti iti sammāsambuddhassa
translated: I do not get angry: I do not become annoyed; I do not despise you because of your birth. He makes offerings: he makes offerings to the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: pūjaṃ karoti. Antaravatthunti gehaṅgaṇaṃ. Bhoti sambodhane nipāto. Jeti avaññālapanaṃ.
analyzed: pūjam karoti antara vatthunti gehaṅgaṇam bho ti sambodhane nipātaḥ jeti a vaññā lapanam
translated: In the house: in the house-angle. Bhoti is a particle of exhortation. Jeti is a particle of contempt.

original: Sayaṃ ariyasāvikābhāvato satthuvasena “sapitikā dhītā”ti vatvā satthu sammukhā dhammassavanena
analyzed: sayam ariya sāvikā abhāvato satthu vasena sa pitikā dhītā ati vatvā satthu sammukhā dhamma ssavanena
translated: Because she herself was not an ariyan disciple, she spoke of herself as the Teacher’s daughter, saying “I am the Teacher’s daughter who drinks the milk” .

original: tassā visesādhigamaṃ paccāsīsantī “dasabale khamanteyeva khamissāmī”ti āha. Kadariyanti thaddhamacchariṃ.
analyzed: tassāḥ visesa adhigamam paccāsīsantī dasabale khamantā iya iva khamissāmi iti āha
translated: And she said “I will forgive, even though the One of Ten Powers is angry” , meaning that she would forgive the bhikkhu even though he was angry. “Stingy” : hard, mean.

original: Suppavāsāvatthu
analyzed: suppavāsā vatthu
translated: The story of Suppiya

original: 263. Chaṭṭhe paṇītadāyikānanti paṇītarasavatthūnaṃ dāyikānaṃ. Āyuno ṭhitihetuṃ bhojanaṃ
analyzed: chaṭṭhe paṇīta dāyikānam ti paṇīta rasa vatthūnam dāyikānam āyuno ṭhiti hetum bhojanam
translated: In the sixth , “givers of choice food” : givers of choice tastes and requisites.

original: dentī āyuṃ deti nāma. Esa nayo vaṇṇaṃ detītiādīsu. Tenāha – “pañca ṭhānānī”ti. Kammasarikkhakañcetaṃ
analyzed: dentī āyum deti nāma esa nayaḥ vaṇṇam deti iti ādīsu tena āha pañca ṭhānāni iti
translated: When she gives food as a cause for the maintenance of life, she gives life. The same method applies in the case of “giving beauty” and so on. Therefore it is said: “Five things” .🔽And showing that the fruit is similar to the deed, he said: “Having given life” , and so on.

original: phalanti dassento “āyuṃ kho pana datvā”tiādimāha. Tattha datvāti dānahetu. Bhāginīti
analyzed: phalanti dassentaḥ āyum kho pana da tvā iti ādim āha tattha da tvā ati dāna hetu bhāginī iti
translated: Herein, having given is on account of the gift.

original: bhāgavatī laddhuṃ bhabbā.
analyzed: bhāgavatī laddhum bhabbā
translated: A sharer is a possessor, one who is able to obtain.

original: Suppiyāvatthu
analyzed: suppiyā vatthu
translated: The story of Suppiyā

original: 264. Sattame ūrumaṃsaṃ chinditvā dāsiyā adāsīti āgataphalā viññātasāsanā ariyasāvikā
analyzed: sattame ūru maṃsam chinditvā dāsiyā adāsī iti āgata phalā viññāta sāsanā ariya sāvikā
translated: In the seventh , “having cut off a piece of her thigh” : an ariyan disciple who has attained the fruit and has understood the Master’s Dispensation

original: attano sarīradukkhaṃ acintetvā tassa bhikkhuno rogavūpasamameva paccāsīsantī attano
analyzed: attano sarīra dukkham a cintetvā tassa bhikkhuno roga vūpasamam eva paccāsīsantī attano
translated: does not consider her own bodily pain, but rather the bhikkhu’s recovery from his illness. Therefore she said: “I will give, even though I am a sharer of the bliss of the One of Ten Powers” .

original: ūrumaṃsaṃ chinditvā dāsiyā adāsi. Satthāpi tassā tathāpavattaṃ ajjhāsayasampattiṃ🔽disvā “mama sammukhībhāvūpagamanenevassā vaṇo ruhitvā sañchavi jāyati, phāsubhāvo
analyzed: ūru maṃsam chinditvā dāsiyāḥ adāsi satthā api tassā tathā pavattam ajjhāsaya sampattim  disvā mama sammukhībhāva upagamanena ivassā vaṇaḥ ruhitvā jāyati phāsu bhāvaḥ
translated: and gave the flesh of her thighs to the slave-woman. The Teacher, seeing that her disposition was such that she had acted in this way,

original: hotī”ti ca disvā “pakkosatha na”nti āha. Sā cintesīti “sabbalokassa hitānukampako
analyzed: hoti iti ca disvā pakkosatha na nti āha sā cintesi iti sabba lokassa hita anukampako
translated: and seeing that her wound had healed and that her beauty had been restored by her coming into his presence, said, “Send for her.” She reflected, “The Teacher, who is compassionate to all the world,

original: satthā na maṃ dukkhāpetuṃ pakkosati, atthettha kāraṇa”nti cintesi. Attanā katakāraṇaṃ
analyzed: satthā na mama dukkhāpetum pakkosati attha ittha kāraṇan ti cintesi attanā kata kāraṇam
translated: does not send for me to afflict me; there must be some reason for this.” She told the reason for her act.

original: sabbaṃ kathesīti buddhānubhāvavibhāvanatthaṃ kathesi, na attano daḷhajjhāsayatāya🔽vibhāvanatthaṃ. Gilānupaṭṭhākīnaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesīti agaṇitattadukkhā gilānānaṃ
analyzed: sabbam kathesi iti buddha anubhāva vibhāvana attham kathesi na attanaḥ daḷha jjhāsaya tāya  vibhāvana attham gilāna upaṭṭhākīnam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi iti agaṇita tta dukkhā gilānānam
translated: She told the whole story, in order to glorify the power of the Buddha. She did not tell it because she was desirous of showing the strength of her own disposition.

original: bhikkhūnaṃ gelaññavūpasamane yuttappayuttāti gilānupaṭṭhākīnaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesīti.
analyzed: bhikkhūnam gelañña vūpasamane yutta ppayuttā ati gilāna upaṭṭhākīnam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi iti
translated: He placed her at the head of those who minister to the sick. He placed her at the head of those who minister to the sick, because she was a Bhikkhunī who was not indifferent to the suffering of sick Bhikkhus, but was ever ready to minister to them.

original: Kātiyānīvatthu
analyzed: kātiyānīvatthu
translated: The Story of Kātiyānī

original: 265. Aṭṭhame aveccappasannānanti ratanattayaguṇe yāthāvato ñatvā pasannānaṃ, so panassa
analyzed: aṭṭhame avecca ppasannānam ti rata nattaya guṇe yāthāvataḥ ñatvā pasannānam so pana assa
translated: In the eighth story, “Those who are confirmed in the faith,” the reference is to those who are confirmed in the faith in the virtues of the Three Jewels, as they really are.

original: pasādo maggenāgatattā kenaci akampanīyo. Adhigatenāti maggādhigameneva adhigatena.
analyzed: pasādaḥ maggena āgata ttā kenaci a kampanīyaḥ adhigatena ati magga adhigamena iva adhigatena
translated: and because it has come by the path, it cannot be shaken by anyone. ‘By what has been reached’: by what has been reached through the attainment of the path.

original: “Avigatenā”ti vā pāṭho, tassattho “kadāci avigacchantenā”ti. So appadhaṃsiyo ca hoti,
analyzed: avigatena ati vā pāṭho tassa attho kadāci a vigacchantena ati so appadhaṃsiyaḥ ca hoti
translated: Or the reading is ‘avigatenā’, the meaning of which is ‘by what never departs’. It is not easily destroyed,

original: tasmā vuttaṃ – “adhigatena acalappasādenā”ti. Tattha kāyasakkhiṃ katvāti pamukhaṃ
analyzed: tasmā vuttam adhigatena acala ppasādena ati tattha kāya sakkhim katvā ati pamukham
translated: therefore it is said: ‘by unshakable confidence that has been reached’. Herein, ‘making bodily witness’: making the body the foremost,

original: katvā, vacanatthato pana nāmakāyena desanāya sampaṭicchanavasena sakkhibhūtaṃ katvāti
analyzed: katvā vacana atthato pana nāmakāyena desanāya sampaṭicchana vasena sakkhi bhūtam katvā ati
translated: but in the sense of the meaning, the meaning is: ‘making oneself a witness by way of acquiescence in the teaching through the body-mass’.

original: attho. Ummaggaṃ khanitvāti gharasandhicchedanena antopavisanamaggaṃ khanitvā. Dullabhassavananti
analyzed: attho ummaggam khanitvā ti ghara sandhi chedanena anta upavisana maggam khanitvā dullabha ssavanam
translated: ‘Having dug a tunnel’: having dug a passage for entering inside by cutting through the wall of the house. ‘Hard to hear’:

original: dullabhasaddhammassavanaṃ. Mahāpathavī pavisitabbā bhaveyyāti avīcippavesanaṃ vadati.
analyzed: dullabha saddhamma ssavanam mahā pathavī pavisitabbā bhaveyya ati avīci ppavesanam vadati
translated: hard to hear the True Dhamma. ‘The great earth would have to be entered’: he says this is like entering Avīci.

original: Nakulamātāvatthu
analyzed: nakula mātāvatthu
translated: The Story of Nakula’s Mother

original: 266. Navame vissāsakathaneneva nakulamātā nakulapitā ca satthuvissāsikā nāma jātāti
analyzed: navame vissāsa kathanena iva nakula mātā nakula pitā ca satthuvissāsikā nāma jātā ati
translated: In the ninth story, by the narration of confidence, Nakula’s mother and Nakula’s father became those who had confidence in the Teacher,🔽and

original: vuttaṃ – “vissāsikānanti vissāsakathaṃ kathentīnaṃ upāsikāna”nti. Gahapatānīti gehasāminī.
analyzed: vuttam vissāsikānam ti vissāsa katham kathentīnam upāsikānam ti gahapatānī iti geha sāminī
translated: “Women who can be trusted” means laywomen who can be trusted to tell the truth. “Householder” means a householder’s wife.

original: Vuttamevāti upāsakapāḷiyaṃ nakulapitukathāyaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: vuttam eva ati upāsaka pāḷiyam nakula pitu kathāyam vutta nayam eva
translated: “As already stated” means in the way already stated in the story of Nakula’s mother in the lay disciples’ section.

original: Kāḷīkuraragharikāvatthu🔽267. Dasame anussavenevāti paccakkhato rūpadassanena satthu sammukhā dhammassavanena
analyzed: kāḷī kurara gharikā vatthu  dasame anussavena iva ati paccakkhataḥ rūpa dassanena satthu sammukhā dhammassavanena
translated: The story of the crow and Kāḷīgaṅgā

original: ca vinā kevalaṃ anussavaneneva parassa vacanaṃ anugatassavaneneva uppannena pasādena.
analyzed: ca vinā kevalam anussavanena iva parassa vacanam anugatassavanena iva uppannena pasādena
translated: In the tenth case, “through mere report” means through mere faith in the words of another, through mere hearing.

original: Anussavikappasādanti anussavato āgatappasādaṃ.
analyzed: anussavika ppasādam ti anussavataḥ āgata ppasādam
translated: “Faith through report” means faith that comes through report.

original: (Sattamaetadaggavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.)🔽Upāsikāpāḷisaṃvaṇṇanā samattā.
analyzed: sattama etad agga vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  upāsikā pāḷi saṃvaṇṇanā samattā
translated: The seventh section of the first vagga is finished.🔽The commentary on the section on laywomen is finished.🔽The commentary on the Fulfiller of Aspirations

original: Niṭṭhitā ca manorathapūraṇiyā
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca manorathapūraṇiyā
translated: is finished.

original: Aṅguttaranikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the Fours

original: Etadaggavaggavaṇṇanāya anuttānatthadīpanā.🔽15. Aṭṭhānapāḷi (paṭhamavagga)
analyzed: paṭhama vagga
translated: is finished.

original: (15) 1. Aṭṭhānapāḷi-paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the first vagga of the Fours is finished.

original: 268. Aṭṭhānapāḷivaṇṇanāyaṃ avijjamānaṃ ṭhānaṃ aṭṭhānaṃ, natthi ṭhānanti vā aṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: aṭṭhāna pāḷivaṇṇanāyam a vijjamānam ṭhānam aṭṭhānam natthi ṭhānanti vā aṭṭhānam
translated: Or the “impossible” is that which is not a possibility.

original: Anavakāsoti etthāpi eseva nayo. Tadatthanigamanameva hi “netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”ti🔽vacananti. Tenāha – “ubhayenapī”tiādi. Yanti kāraṇatthe paccattavacanaṃ. Hetuattho
analyzed: anavakāsaḥ ti ettha api esa iva nayo tad attha nigamanam eva hi na itam ṭhānam vijjati iti  vacanam ti tena āha ubhayena api itiādi yanti kāraṇa atthe paccatta vacanam hetu atthaḥ
translated: The “unavailable” is to be interpreted in the same way. For the words “that is impossible” are a conclusion drawn from the meaning of the words “there is no possibility.”🔽That is why he said “by both” , etc. The word yanti is a demonstrative pronoun in the sense of reason.🔽The meaning of “reason” is the meaning of cause.

original: cettha kāraṇatthoti āha – “yanti yena kāraṇenā”ti. Ukkaṭṭhaniddesenettha diṭṭhisampatti
analyzed: ca ittha kāraṇa atthaḥ iti āha yanti yena kāraṇena ati ukkaṭṭha niddesena ittha diṭṭhi sampatti
translated: That is why he said “yanti is the reason why” . The perfection of view is stated here by the word “extreme” .

original: veditabbāti vuttaṃ – “maggadiṭṭhiyā sampanno”ti. Kuto panāyamattho labbhatīti? Liṅgato,🔽liṅgaṃ cetassa niccato upagamanappaṭikkhepo. Catubhūmakesūti idaṃ catutthabhūmakasaṅkhārānaṃ
analyzed: veditabbā iti vuttam magga diṭṭhiyā sampannaḥ ti kutas pana ayam atthaḥ labbhati iti liṅgato  liṅgam cetassa niccatas upagamana paṭikkhepo catu bhūmakesu ti idam catuttha bhūmaka saṅkhārānam
translated: That is why he said “one who is perfected in the view of the path” . But how is this meaning obtained? From the gender.🔽For the word “extreme” is in the feminine gender, and the prohibition of the assumption of the permanence of consciousness is in the feminine gender.

original: ariyasāvakassa visayabhāvūpagamanato vuttaṃ, na pana te ārabbha niccato upagamanasabbhāvato.
analyzed: ariya sāvakassa visaya bhāva upagamanataḥ vuttam na pana te ārabbha niccatas upagamana sabbhāvato
translated: The words “in the four bases” are said because the four bases are the province of the noble disciple, not because the assumption of permanence is made in regard to them.

original: Vakkhati hi “tadabhāve catutthabhūmakasaṅkhārā panā”tiādinā. Abhisaṅkhatasaṅkhāraabhisaṅkharaṇakasaṅkhārānaṃ🔽sappadesattā nippadesasaṅkhāraggahaṇatthaṃ “saṅkhatasaṅkhāresū”ti vuttaṃ, lokuttarasaṅkhārānaṃ
analyzed: hi tad abhāve catuttha bhūmaka saṅkhārā panāti ādinā  sa padesa ttā nippadesa saṅkhāra ggahaṇa attham saṅkhata saṅkhāresu iti vuttam
translated: The words “in the formations of the formed” are said in order to include the formations that are not formations of the formed,🔽but he himself gives the reason for excluding the supramundane formations.

original: pana nivattane kāraṇaṃ sayameva vakkhati. Etaṃ kāraṇaṃ natthīti tathā upagamane setughāto
analyzed: pana nivattane kāraṇam sayam eva vakkhati etam kāraṇam natthi iti tathā upagamane setu ghāto
translated: There is no reason for that, and if one were to assume it, there would be a breach of the principle of the bridge.

original: natthi. Tejussadattāti saṃkilesavidhamanatejassa adhikabhāvato. Tathā hi te gambhīrabhāvena🔽duddasā akusalānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ na hontīti. Idaṃ pana pakaraṇavasena vuttaṃ. Appahīnavipallāsānañhi🔽santānesu kusaladhammānampi te ārammaṇaṃ na honti.
analyzed: na atthi saṃkilesa vidhamana tejassa adhika bhāvataḥ tathā hi te gambhīra bhāvena  duddasāḥ akusalānam ārammaṇam na honti iti idam pana pakaraṇa vasena vuttam appahīna vipallāsānam hi  santānesu kusala dhammānam pi te ārammaṇam na honti
translated: “The light of the sun”: the light of the sun that disperses the darkness of defilement, because of its predominance. For it is because of their profundity that they are not objects for unprofitable consciousness.🔽This is said by way of the present sutta. For they are not objects even for profitable consciousness in the mental continuities of those who have not abandoned perversion,🔽because of the perversion that consists in taking as pleasant what is in fact painful.

original: 269. Asukhe sukhanti vipallāso ca idha sukhato upagamanassa ṭhānanti dassento “ekanta…pe…
analyzed: asukhe sukhanti vipallāso ca idha sukhatas upagamanassa ṭhānanti dassento ekantape
translated: And showing that the perversion that consists in taking as pleasant what is in fact painful is the reason for taking what is in fact painful as pleasant, he said: “Bhikkhus, I do not say that there is a single thing that is pleasant. I do not say that there is a single thing that is painful. I do not say that there is a single thing that is pleasant and painful. I do not say that there is a single thing that is neither pleasant nor painful” .

original: attadiṭṭhivasenā”ti padhānadiṭṭhimāha. Gūthanti gūthaṭṭhānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā nibbānassa
analyzed: atta diṭṭhi vasena iti padhāna diṭṭhim āha gūtham ti gūtha ṭhānam diṭṭhiyāḥ nibbānassa
translated: “By way of the view of self” is the view of the supremacy of the ascetic practices. “Dung” is a place for dung. The fact that Nibbāna is not the domain of views has been stated below.

original: avisayabhāvo heṭṭhā vutto evāti kasiṇādipaṇṇattisaṅgahatthanti vuttaṃ.🔽270. Paricchedoti paricchindanaṃ paricchijja tassa gahaṇaṃ. Svāyaṃ yesu niccādito🔽upagamanaṃ sambhavati, tesaṃ vasenayeva kātabboti dassento “sabbavāresu vā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: avisaya bhāvaḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ evā ti kasiṇa ādi paṇṇatti saṅgaha ttham ti vuttam  paricchedaḥ ti paricchindanam tassa gahaṇam yesu  upagamanam sambhavati tesam vasena yā iva kātabbaḥ iti dassentaḥ sabba vāresu vā tiādim āha
translated: The words “in order to include the kasiṇa, etc.,” are said.🔽“Definition” is the delimitation, the apprehending of it by defining. This should be done only by way of those things in regard to which the assumption of permanence, etc.,🔽is possible. Showing this, he says, “in all the passages,” etc.

original: Sabbavāresūti “niccato upagaccheyyā”tiādinā āgatesu sabbesu suttapadesu. Puthujjano
analyzed: sabba vāresu iti niccatas upagaccheyya ati ādinā āgatesu sabbesu sutta padesu puthujjanaḥ
translated: “In all the passages” means in all the passages of the sutta that occur in the phrase, “he would assume as permanent,” etc.

original: hīti hi-saddo hetuattho. Yasmā yaṃ yaṃ saṅkhāraṃ puthujjano niccādivasena gaṇhāti,
analyzed: hi iti hi saddaḥ hetu atthaḥ yasmai yam yam saṅkhāram puthujjanaḥ nicca ādi vasena gaṇhāti
translated: The word “but” has the meaning of a reason. Because whatever formation a worldling assumes as permanent, etc.,

original: taṃ taṃ ariyasāvako aniccādivasena gaṇhanto yāthāvato jānanto taṃ gāhaṃ taṃ diṭṭhiṃ🔽vissajjeti, tasmā yattha gāho, tattha vissajjanāti catubhūmakasaṅkhārā idha saṅkhāraggahaṇena
analyzed: tam tam ariya sāvakaḥ anicca ādi vasena gaṇhantaḥ yāthāvataḥ jānantaḥ tam gāham tam diṭṭhim  vissajjeti tasmai yattha gāho tattha catu bhūmaka saṅkhārāḥ idha saṅkhāra ggahaṇena
translated: the noble disciple, by assuming it as impermanent, etc., and by knowing it as it really is, abandons that assumption and that view.

original: na gayhantīti attho.
analyzed: na gayhanti iti attho
translated: Therefore, wherever there is an assumption, there is an abandonment. The fourfold basis of formations is not included here by the word “formations.”🔽This is the meaning.

original: 271. Puttasambandhena mātupitusamaññā dattakittimādivasenapi puttavohāro loke dissati,
analyzed: putta sambandhena mātu pitu samaññā putta vohāro loke dissati
translated: In the world, the mother and father are called by the names of son and daughter by reason of the relationship of child, as in the case of the son of Dhataki, etc.,

original: so ca kho pariyāyenāti nippariyāyena siddhaṃ taṃ dassetuṃ – “janikāva mātā, janakova
analyzed: so ca kho pariyāyena ati nippariyāyena siddham tam dassetuṃ janikā ava mātā janakā uva
translated: and that is figurative. In order to show that which is established by the primary meaning, it is said: “The mother is the one who gives birth, the father is the one who causes the birth.”

original: pitā”ti vuttaṃ. Tathā ānantariyakammassa adhippetattā “manussabhūtova khīṇāsavo arahāti
analyzed: pitā iti vuttam tathā ānantariya kammassa adhippeta ttā manussa bhūtaḥ uva khīṇa āsavaḥ arahā ti
translated: Likewise, because the one who is intended is the one who has destroyed the cankers while being a human being, it is said: “The one who is intended is the one who has destroyed the cankers while being a human being, the Arahant.”

original: adhippeto”ti vuttaṃ. “Aṭṭhānameta”ntiādinā “mātuādīnaṃyeva jīvitā voropane ariyasāvakassa🔽abhabbabhāvadassanato tadaññaṃ ariyasāvako jīvitā voropetīti idaṃ atthato āpannamevā”ti
analyzed: adhippeto ti vuttam aṭṭhānam etat ti ādinā mātu ādīnam yeva jīvitā voropane ariya sāvakassa  abhabba bhāva dassanato tad aññam ariya sāvakaḥ jīvitā voropeti iti idam atthataḥ āpannam eva ati
translated: Because it is shown that a noble disciple is incapable of depriving his mother, etc., of life, it is implied that he is incapable of depriving anyone else of life.

original: maññamāno vadati – “kiṃ pana ariyasāvako aññaṃ jīvitā voropeyyā”ti? “Aṭṭhānametaṃ
analyzed: maññamānaḥ vadati kim pana ariya sāvakaḥ aññam jīvitā voropeyya ati aṭṭhānam etam
translated: Thinking that this is so, he says: “But how could a noble disciple deprive anyone else of life?”

original: anavakāso, yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ
analyzed: anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo sañcicca pāṇam jīvitā voropeyya na itam ṭhānam
translated: Because of the statement: “It is impossible, it cannot happen that a person who has attained to right view could deprive his mother or his father or his perfected one of life,”

original: vijjatī”ti vacanato “etampi aṭṭhāna”nti vuttaṃ. Tenevāha – “sace hī”tiādi. Evaṃ sante
analyzed: vijjati iti vacanato etam pi aṭṭhānam ti vuttam tena iva āha sace hi itiādi evam sante
translated: he says: “This also is impossible.” Therefore he says: “If, however, it were possible,” etc.

original: kasmā “mātara”ntiādinā visesetvā vuttanti āha – “puthujjanabhāvassa panā”tiādi. Tattha
analyzed: kasmā mātaranti ādinā visesetvā vuttanti āha puthujjana bhāvassa pana atiādi tattha
translated: Why is it said in the way beginning, “mother” ? —He said, “But the state of being an ordinary man” , etc., in order to show the reason for that.🔽Herein,

original: baladīpanatthanti saddhādibalasamannāgamadīpanatthaṃ. Ariyamaggenāgatasaddhādhibalavasena
analyzed: bala dīpana ttham ti saddhā ādi bala samannāgama dīpana ttham ariya maggena āgata saddhā ādhi bala vasena
translated: as to the meaning of “strength”: as to the meaning of “endowment with the strength of faith, etc.”,

original: hi ariyasāvako tādisaṃ sāvajjaṃ na karoti.🔽275. Pañcahi kāraṇehīti idamettha nipphādakāni tesaṃ pubbabhāgiyāni ca kāraṇāni kāraṇabhāvasāmaññena
analyzed: hi ariya sāvakaḥ tādisam sāvajjam na karoti  pañcahi kāraṇehi iti idam ettha nipphādakāni tesam pubbabhāgiyāni ca kāraṇāni kāraṇa bhāva sāmaññena
translated: for it is by the strength of faith, etc., that have been brought in by the noble path that a noble disciple does not do such a blameworthy deed.🔽As to the five reasons: this is said by taking the five reasons as a single reason since they are similar in being reasons for the schism, not because they are all of the same function.

original: ekajjhaṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ, na pana sabbesaṃ samānayogakkhamattā. Ākārehīti kāraṇehi.
analyzed: ekajjham gahetvā vuttam na pana sabbesam samāna yogakkhama ttā ākārehi iti kāraṇehi
translated: As to the meaning of “cause”: as to the meaning of “reason.”

original: Anussāvanenāti anurūpaṃ sāvanena. Bhedassa anurūpaṃ yathā bhedo hoti, evaṃ bhinditabbānaṃ
analyzed: anussāvanena ati anurūpam sāvanena bhedassa anurūpam yathā bhedaḥ hoti evam bhinditabbānam
translated: As to the proclamation: as to the proclamation in conformity with the schism. In conformity with the schism means in such a way that the schism comes about.

original: bhikkhūnaṃ attano vacanassa sāvanena viññāpanena. Tenāha – “nanu tumhe”tiādi. Kaṇṇamūle
analyzed: bhikkhūnam attanaḥ vacanassa sāvanena viññāpanena tena āha nanu tumhā itiādi kaṇṇamūle
translated: By proclaiming, by making known, his own words to the bhikkhus who are to be split. Hence he said, “Have you not?” , etc.

original: vacībhedaṃ katvāti etena pākaṭaṃ katvā bhedakaravatthudīpanaṃ vohāro, tattha attano
analyzed: vacībhedam katvā iti etena pākaṭam katvā bheda kara vatthu dīpanam vohāraḥ tattha attano
translated: By making a division in their hearing: by making it clear, by making known the subject of the schism. Herein, the speech is the proclamation of his own words.

original: nicchitamatthaṃ rahassavasena viññāpanaṃ anussāvananti dasseti.
analyzed: nicchita mattham rahassa vasena viññāpanam anussāvananti dasseti
translated: He shows that the announcement is the making known by way of a secret of the matter that has been decided.

original: Kammameva uddeso vā pamāṇanti tehi saṅghabhedasiddhito vuttaṃ, itare pana tesaṃ sambhārabhūtā.
analyzed: kammam eva uddesaḥ vā pamāṇam ti tehi saṅgha bheda siddhitaḥ vuttam itare pana tesam sambhāra bhūtā
translated: The action itself is the motion or the standard, he says, because the schism of the Order is accomplished by means of these. The others are the requisites for that.

original: Tenāha – “vohārā”tiādi. Tatthāti voharaṇe. Cutianantaraṃ phalaṃ anantaraṃ nāma, tasmiṃ
analyzed: tena āha tattha ati voharaṇe cuti anantaram phalam anantaram nāma tasmin
translated: Hence he says ‘the terms’ and so on. Therein is in the terms. The fruit that is next to the action is called next to the action.

original: anantare niyuttāni, tannibbattanena anantarakaraṇasīlāni, anantarappayojanāni cāti
analyzed: anantare niyuttāni tad nibbattanena anantara karaṇa sīlāni anantara ppayojanāni ca ati
translated: They are bound to that, they are of the nature of causing the next action to arise by their arising, they are the next purpose,

original: ānantariyāni, tāni eva kammānīti ānantariyakammāni.
analyzed: ānantariyāni tāni eva kammāni iti ānantariya kammāni
translated: therefore they are next-to-action , and they are the actions themselves, therefore they are next-to-action actions.

original: Kammatoti “evaṃ ānantariyakammaṃ hoti, evaṃ ānantariyakammasadisa”nti evaṃ kammavibhāgato.
analyzed: kammato ti evam ānantariya kammam hoti evam ānantariya kamma sadisanti evam kamma vibhāgato
translated: As to action: ‘The next-to-action action is like this, the next-to-action action is similar to this’—thus as to the analysis of the action.

original: Dvāratoti kāyadvārato. Kappaṭṭhitiyatoti “idaṃ kappaṭṭhitiyavipākaṃ, idaṃ na kappaṭṭhitiyavipāka”nti
analyzed: dvārato ti kāya dvārato kappaṭṭhitiyato ti idam kappaṭṭhitiya vipākam idam na kappaṭṭhitiya vipākam ti
translated: As to door: by the bodily door. As to duration of the aeon: ‘This has ripening that lasts for the duration of the aeon, this has ripening that does not last for the duration of the aeon’—

original: evaṃ kappaṭṭhitiyavibhāgato. Pākasādhāraṇādīhīti “idamettha vipaccati, idaṃ na vipaccatī”ti
analyzed: evam pāka sādhāraṇa ādīhi iti idam ettha vipaccati idam na vipaccati iti
translated: thus as to the analysis of the duration of the aeon. As to ripening, sharing, and so on: ‘This ripens here, this does not ripen here’—

original: vipaccanavibhāgato, gahaṭṭhapabbajitānaṃ sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇato, ādi-saddena vedanādivibhāgato ca.
analyzed: vipaccana vibhāgataḥ gaha ṭṭha pabbajitānam sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇataḥ ādi saddena vedanā ādi vibhāgataḥ ca
translated: and by way of the opposite, and by way of what is common and uncommon to householders and those gone forth, and by way of feeling, etc., which are included by the word “etc.”

original: Kammato tāva vinicchayo vuccatīti sambandho. Yasmā manussattabhāve ṭhitasseva kusaladhammānaṃ🔽tikkhavisadabhāvāpatti, yathā tiṇṇaṃ bodhisattānaṃ bodhittayanibbattiyaṃ, evaṃ manussabhāve
analyzed: kammato tāva vinicchayo vuccati iti sambandho yasmā manussatta bhāve ṭhitassa iva kusala dhammānam  tikkha visada bhāva āpatti yathā tiṇṇam bodhisattānam bodhi ttaya nibbattiyam evam manussa bhāve
translated: The connection is this: the exposition of kamma is stated. Because it is only one who is a human being that can attain the sharpness and clarity of profitable states

original: ṭhitasseva edisānaṃ akusaladhammānampi tikkhavisadabhāvāpattīti āha – “manussabhūtassevā”ti.
analyzed: ṭhitassa iva edisānam akusala dhammānam pi tikkha visada bhāva āpatti iti āha manussa bhūtassa iva iti
translated: just as it is only one who is a human being that can attain the three kinds of enlightenment, so too it is only one who is a human being that can attain the sharpness and clarity of unprofitable states. That is why he said “only a human being.”

original: Pākatikamanussānampi ca kusaladhammānaṃ visesappatti vimānavatthuaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttanayeneva
analyzed: pākatika manussānam pi ca kusala dhammānam visesa ppatti vimāna vatthu aṭṭhakathāyam vutta nayena iva
translated: And the attainment of distinction in profitable states by ordinary human beings should be understood in the way stated in the Commentary on the “Vimāna Vatthu.”

original: veditabbā. Yathāvutto ca attho samānajātiyassa vikopane garutaro, na tathā vijātiyassāti
analyzed: veditabbā yathā vuttaḥ ca attho samāna jātiyassa vikopane garutaraḥ na tathā vijātiyassa ati
translated: And the meaning stated is more serious when it is one of the same kind that is violated, not when it is one of a different kind.

original: vuttaṃ – “manussabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ vā”ti. Liṅgaparivatte ca so eva ekakammanibbatto
analyzed: vuttam manussa bhūtam mātaram vā pitaram vā ati liṅga parivatte ca saḥ eva eka kamma nibbatto
translated: That is why he said “a mother or a father who is a human being.” And when there is a change of sex, the same person is born again by that kamma.

original: bhavaṅgappabandho jīvitindriyapabandho ca, na aññoti āha – “api parivattaliṅga”nti.
analyzed: bhavaṅga ppabandho jīvitindriya pabandho ca na añño ti āha api parivatta liṅgam ti
translated: and the continuity of the life faculty.🔽The same method applies in the case of one who attains arahantship.

original: Arahattaṃ pattepi eseva nayo. Tassa vipākantiādi kammassa ānantariyabhāvasamatthanaṃ.
analyzed: arahattam patte pi esa eva nayo tassa vipāka nti ādi kammassa ānantariya bhāva samatthanaṃ
translated: The words “the kamma that is its result” and so on are a statement of the immediacy of the kamma.

original: Catukkoṭiyañcettha sambhavati. Tattha paṭhamā koṭi dassitā, itarāsu visaṅketabhāvaṃ
analyzed: catukkoṭiyam ca ittha sambhavati tattha paṭhamā koṭi dassitā itarāsu visaṅketa bhāvam
translated: Here the four alternatives are possible. The first alternative has been stated. The other three are stated by the words “But if he” and so on.

original: dassetuṃ – “yo panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yadipi tattha visaṅketo, kammaṃ pana garutaraṃ
analyzed: dassetum yaḥ pana iti ādi vuttam yadi api tattha visaṅketo kammam pana garutaram
translated: Though there is no doubt about the other three alternatives, the kamma is so heavy that it should be feared.🔽This is the question: a discussion that arises from a desire to know.

original: ānantariyasadisaṃ bhāyitabbanti āha – “bhāriyaṃ…pe… tiṭṭhatī”ti. Ayaṃ pañhoti ñāpanicchānibbattā kathā.
analyzed: ānantariya sadisam bhāyitabbanti āha tiṭṭhati iti ayam pañho ti ñāpa nicchā nibbattā kathā
translated: With the intention: with the purpose.

original: Abhisandhināti adhippāyena. Ānantariyaṃ phusatīti maraṇādhippāyeneva ānantariyavatthuno
analyzed: abhisandhinā iti adhippāyena ānantariyam phusati iti maraṇa adhippāyena iva ānantariya vatthuno
translated: He touches the threshold: this is said because the threshold of the offense has been crossed by the mere intention to kill.

original: vikopitattā vuttaṃ. Ānantariyaṃ na phusatīti ānantariyavatthuabhāvato ānantariyaṃ
analyzed: vikopita ttā vuttam ānantariyam na phusati iti ānantariya vatthu abhāvato ānantariyam
translated: He does not touch the threshold: the threshold of the offense is not reached because there is no offense.

original: na hoti. Sabbattha hi purimaṃ abhisandhicittaṃ appamāṇaṃ, vadhakacittaṃ pana tadārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: na hoti sabbattha hi purimam abhisandhi cittam appamāṇam vadhaka cittam pana tad ārammaṇam
translated: In all cases, the intention to kill is immeasurable, but the intention to kill that has that as its object is immeasurable.

original: jīvitindriyañca ānantariyabhāve pamāṇanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Saṅgāmacatukkaṃ sampattavasena🔽yojetabbaṃ. Yo hi parasenāya aññañca yodhaṃ pitarañca kammaṃ karonte disvā yodhassa
analyzed: jīvita indriyam ca ānantariya bhāve pamāṇam ti daṭṭhabbam saṅgāma catukkam sampatta vasena  yojetabbam yaḥ hi para senāya aññañca yodham pitaram ca kammam karonte disvā yodhassa
translated: and the life faculty is the measure in the state of proximity.

original: usuṃ khipati “etaṃ vijjhitvā mama pitaraṃ vijjhissatī”ti, yathādhippāyaṃ gate pitughātako🔽hoti. “Yodhe viddhe mama pitā palāyissatī”ti khipati, usuṃ ayathādhippāyaṃ gantvā🔽pitaraṃ māreti, vohāravasena pitughātakoti vuccati, ānantariyaṃ pana natthīti. Coracatukkaṃ
analyzed: usum khipati etam vijjhitvā mama pitaram vijjhissati iti yathā adhippāyam gate pitu ghātako  hoti yodhe viddhe mama pitā palāyissati iti khipati usum a yathā adhippāyam gantvā  pitaram māreti vohāra vasena pitu ghātako ti vuccati ānantariyam pana natthi iti cora catukkam
translated: The four cases of battle should be construed according to the way in which they are reached. For if someone sees another warrior and his father fighting in the enemy’s army and throws a spear at the warrior thinking “After piercing him I shall pierce my father,” and the spear goes as intended, he becomes guilty of parricide.🔽If he throws it thinking “After my father has been pierced he will flee,” and the spear goes otherwise than intended and kills his father, he is called a parricide according to conventional usage, but there is no immediate result.

original: pana yo “coraṃ māressāmī”ti coravesena gacchantaṃ pitaraṃ māreti, ānantariyaṃ phusatītiādinā
analyzed: pana yaḥ coram māressāmi iti cora vesena gacchantam pitaram māreti ānantariyam phusati iti ādinā
translated: But the four cases of thieves should be construed according to the following: If someone kills his father who is going along in the guise of a thief thinking “I shall kill a thief,” he contacts an immediate result.🔽“By that same means” means by that same instrument.

original: yojetabbaṃ. Tenevāti teneva payogena. Arahantaghātako hotiyevāti arahato māritattā
analyzed: yojetabbam tena iva ati tena iva payogena arahanta ghātakaḥ arahataḥ mārita ttā
translated: “He becomes guilty of parricide” is said because the father is killed.

original: vuttaṃ, puthujjanasseva taṃ dinnaṃ hotīti etthāyamadhippāyo – yathā vadhakacetanā
analyzed: vuttam puthujjanassa iva tat dinnam hoti iti ettha ayam adhippāyaḥ yathā vadhaka cetanā
translated: The intention here is this: “It is given to the ordinary man only” is said because the intention to kill

original: paccuppannārammaṇāpi pabandhavicchedanavasena jīvitindriyaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā pavattati,
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇā api pabandha vicchedana vasena jīvitindriyam ārammaṇam katvā pavattati
translated: The life faculty occurs with the object of the life faculty by the severance of the bond of the object of past and future,

original: na evaṃ cāgacetanā. Sā hi cajitabbavatthuṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā cajanamattameva hoti,
analyzed: na evam cāga cetanā sā hi cajitabba vatthum ārammaṇam katvā cajana mattam eva hoti
translated: but not so the volition of giving up. For that is merely the giving up of the object to be given up,

original: aññasantakabhāvakaraṇañca tassa cajanaṃ, tasmā yassa taṃ santakaṃ kataṃ, tasseva dinnaṃ hotīti.
analyzed: añña santaka bhāva karaṇam ca tassa cajanam tasmai yassa tam santakam katam tassa iva dinnam hoti iti
translated: and the giving up of that is the making of it another’s property. So it is given to him by whom it is made another’s property.

original: Lohitaṃ samosaratīti abhighātena pakuppamānaṃ sañcitaṃ hoti. Mahantataranti garutaraṃ. Sarīrappaṭijaggane viyāti satthurūpakāyappaṭijaggane viya.
analyzed: lohitam samosarati iti abhighātena pakuppamānam sañcitam hoti mahantataranti garutaram sarīra paṭijaggane viya ati satthu rūpa kāya paṭijaggane viya
translated: “The blood is disturbed”: it is disturbed by the blow and becomes concentrated. “More serious”: more grave. “As in the case of the care of the body of the enemy”: as in the case of the care of the body of an enemy.

original: Asannipatiteti idaṃ sāmaggiyadīpanaṃ. Bhedo ca hotīti saṅghassa bhedo ca hoti. Vaṭṭatīti🔽saññāyāti “īdisaṃ karaṇaṃ saṅghabhedāya na hotī”ti saññāya. Tathā navato ūnaparisāyāti
analyzed: a sannipatitā iti idam sāmaggiya dīpanam bhedo ca hoti iti saṅghassa bhedo ca hoti vaṭṭati iti  saññāya ati īdisam karaṇam saṅgha bhedāya na hoti iti saññāya tathā navatas ūna parisāya ati
translated: “Without coming together”: this shows the absence of a gathering together. “There is a schism”: there is a schism in the Community. “It is carried out”:🔽“By the perception”: by the perception “Such action does not constitute a schism of the Community.” “In that way by a gathering of less than nine”:

original: avirodhato atthayojanā daṭṭhabbā. Sesānīti saṅghabhedato aññāni ānantariyakammāni.🔽Yadi tāni ahosikammasaṅkhaṃ gacchanti, evaṃ sati kathaṃ nesaṃ ānantariyatā cutianantaraṃ
analyzed: avirodhataḥ attha yojanā daṭṭhabbā sesāni iti saṅgha bhedataḥ aññāni ānantariya kammāni  yadi tāni ahosikamma saṅkham gacchanti evam sati katham na īsam ānantariya tā cuti anantaram

original: vipākadānābhāvato. Atha sati phaladāne cutianantaro eva etesaṃ phalakālo, na aññoti🔽phalakālaniyamena niyatatā icchitā, na phaladānaniyamena. Evampi niyataphalakālānaṃ
analyzed: vipāka dāna abhāvataḥ atha sati phala dāne cuti anantaraḥ eva etesam phala kālaḥ na  phala kāla niyamena niyata tā icchitā na phala dāna niyamena

analyzed: aññesam pi upapajja vedanīyānam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyānam ca niyata tā āpajjeyya tasmā  vipāka dhamma dhammānam paccaya antara vikala tā ādīhi a vipaccamānānam pi attanaḥ sabhāvena
translated: And in that case, then the kamma that is “effective in the next birth” and that which is “effective later than the next birth” would also be “immediately effective” since their fruit is due to ripen on the occasion of the next existence, not on any other occasion.🔽So the “immediately effective” state is asserted not by way of the fruit’s being due to ripen on the occasion of the next existence, but by way of the fruit’s being due to ripen on the same occasion as the kamma, not on any other occasion.🔽And in that case, then the kamma that is “effective in the next birth” and that which is “effective later than the next birth” would also be “immediately effective” since their fruit is due to ripen on the same occasion as the kamma, not on any other occasion.

original: vipākadhammatā viya balavatā ānantariyena vipāke dinne avipaccamānānampi ānantariyānaṃ

analyzed: niyatā ānantariya tā ca veditabbā avassañca ānantariya sabhāvā tatas eva niyata sabhāvā  ca tesam pavattī iti sampaṭicchitabbam etam aññassa balavataḥ ānantariyassa abhāve sati
translated: And it should be understood that it is next to it because it occurs with a nature that is next to that of the action. And it should be admitted that it is fixed and next to it because it gives its fruit only after that action,

original: cutianantaraṃ ekantena phaladānato.🔽Nanu evaṃ aññesampi upapajjavedanīyānaṃ aññasmiṃ vipākadāyake asati cutianantarameva🔽ekantena phaladānato niyatasabhāvā ānantariyasabhāvā ca pavatti āpajjatīti? Nāpajjati
