translated: The mention of the six occasions, namely, descent from the Tusita heaven, entry into the womb, birth, renunciation, attainment of enlightenment, and the great act of giving kasina, is merely an illustration, because the quaking of the earth occurs at the time of the great aspiration, etc., as well.

original: pakampanassa labbhanato. Āṇākhettaṃ nāma yaṃ ekajjhaṃ saṃvaṭṭati vivaṭṭati ca, āṇā
analyzed: pakampanassa labbhanataḥ āṇākhettam nāma yam ekajjham saṃvaṭṭati vivaṭṭati ca āṇā
translated: The sphere of influence is that which contracts and expands together with the command.

original: pavattati āṇāya tannivāsidevatānaṃ sirasā sampaṭicchanena, tañca kho kevalaṃ buddhānaṃ🔽ānubhāveneva, na adhippāyavasena. Adhippāyavasena pana “yāvatā vā pana ākaṅkheyyā”ti
analyzed: pavattati āṇāya tad nivāsi devatānam sirasā sampaṭicchanena tat ca kho kevalam buddhānam  ānubhāvena iva na adhippāya vasena adhippāya vasena pana yāvatā vā pana ākaṅkheyya ati
translated: It is set in motion by the deities who are the guardians of the door of the city of the Thirty-three, by their bowing their heads in obedience to the command of the Buddha, and that is only by the Buddha’s power, not by their own wish. But by their own wish, it is said, it goes as far as they want it to go.

original: vacanato tato parampi āṇā vatteyyeva.🔽Na uppajjantīti pana atthīti “na me ācariyo atthi, sadiso me na vijjatī”tiādiṃ imissā
analyzed: vacanataḥ tatas parampi āṇā vatteyya iva  na uppajjanti iti pana atthi iti na me ācariyaḥ atthi sadisaḥ me na vijjati itiādim imissā
translated: It is only by the Buddha’s power that it is heard by the deities who are the guardians of the command, and they accept it by bowing their heads. And that is only by the Buddha’s power, not by their own intention. But if it were by their own intention, then the command would continue to be carried out even after that, since it is said, “Or for as long as he may wish” .🔽But it is not the case that it is not heard.

original: lokadhātuyā ṭhatvā vadantena bhagavatā “kiṃ panāvuso, sāriputta, atthetarahi aññe
analyzed: lokadhātuyā ṭhatvā vadantena bhagavatā kim pana āvuso sāriputta attha itarahi aññe
translated: The Blessed One, who was dwelling in this world-sphere, said, “I have no teacher. There is no one equal to me,” and so on.

original: samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā bhagavatā samasamā sambodhiyanti, evaṃ puṭṭho ahaṃ, bhante,
analyzed: samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā bhagavatā samasamā sambodhiyanti evam puṭṭhaḥ aham bhante
translated: “But, friend Sāriputta, are there any other ascetics or brahmins who are equal to the Blessed One in enlightenment?”

original: ‘no’ti vadeyya”nti vatvā tassa kāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ – “aṭṭhānametaṃ anavakāso, yaṃ ekissā
analyzed: no ti vadeyyanti vatvā tassa kāraṇam dassetuṃ aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yam ekissā
translated: “If I were to say that there are, venerable sir, I would be saying what is not fact.

original: lokadhātuyā dve arahanto sammāsambuddhā apubbaṃ acarimaṃ uppajjeyyu”nti imaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: lokadhātuyā dve arahantaḥ sammāsambuddhāḥ apubbam acarimam uppajjeyyunti imam suttaṃ
translated: It is impossible, it cannot happen that in one world-sphere two perfectly enlightened Buddhas should arise.”

original: āharantena dhammasenāpatinā ca buddhakhettabhūtaṃ imaṃ lokadhātuṃ ṭhapetvā aññattha🔽anuppatti vuttā hotīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: āharantena dhammasenāpatinā ca buddha khetta bhūtam imam lokadhātum ṭhapetvā aññattha  anuppatti vuttā hoti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: except in this world-sphere which is the Buddha’s field. This is the intention.

original: Ekatoti saha, ekasmiṃ kāleti attho, so pana kālo kathaṃ paricchinnoti carimabhave🔽paṭisandhiggahaṇato paṭṭhāya yāva dhātuparinibbānāti dassento, “tatthā”tiādimāha.🔽Anacchariyattāti dvīsupi uppajjamānesu acchariyattābhāvatoti attho. Dvīsupi uppajjamānesu🔽anacchariyatā, kimaṅgaṃ pana bahūsūti dassento, “yadi cā”tiādimāha. Buddhā nāma majjhe🔽bhinnasuvaṇṇaṃ viya ekasadisāti tesaṃ desanāpi ekarasā ekadhāti āha – “desanāya ca
analyzed: ekato ti saha ekasmin kāle iti attho so pana kālo katham paricchinno ti carima bhave  paṭisandhi ggahaṇataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva dhātu parinibbānā ti dassentaḥ tattha atiādim āha  an acchariyattā ati dvīsupi uppajjamānesu acchariyattā bhāvato ti atthaḥ dvīsupi uppajjamānesu  kim aṅgam pana bahūsu iti dassentaḥ yadi ca ati ādim āha buddhāḥ nāma majjhe  bhinna suvaṇṇam viya eka sadisā ati tesam desanā api ekarasā ekadhā iti āha desanāya ca
translated: ‘Together’: together with, in one time, is the meaning. But how is that time delimited? Showing this, he said, ‘Therein,’ etc.

original: visesābhāvato”ti. Etenapi anacchariyattameva sādheti. Vivādabhāvatoti etena vivādābhāvatthaṃ
analyzed: visesa abhāvataḥ ti etena api sādhā iti vivāda bhāvataḥ ti etena vivāda abhāvattham
translated: ‘It is not surprising’: the meaning is that it is not surprising when two arise, let alone many. Showing this, he said, ‘If two’ … ‘Buddhas’ are alike like a piece of gold in the middle of which a flaw has been filled. Therefore their teaching is of one taste, of one mode. Hence he said, ‘And because there is no difference in their teaching.’ This also proves that it is not surprising. ‘Because there is no dispute’ .

original: dve buddhā ekato na uppajjantīti dasseti. Etaṃ kāraṇanti etaṃ anacchariyatādikāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: dve buddhāḥ ekatas na uppajjanti iti dasseti etam kāraṇam ti etam anacchariya tā ādi kāraṇam
translated: He shows that two Buddhas do not arise together. “For this reason”: for this reason of non-marvelousness, etc.

original: Tatthāti milindapañhe.🔽Ekaṃ eva buddhaṃ dhāretīti ekabuddhadhāraṇī. Etena evaṃsabhāvā ete buddhaguṇā, yena
analyzed: tattha ati milinda pañhe  ekam eva buddham dhāreti iti eka buddha dhāraṇī etena evaṃsabhāvāḥ ete buddha guṇāḥ yena
translated: “There”: in the Milindapañha.

original: dutiyabuddhaguṇe dhāretuṃ asamatthā ayaṃ lokadhātūti dasseti. Paccayavisesanipphannānañhi
analyzed: dutiya buddha guṇe dhāretum asamatthā ayam lokadhātū ti dasseti paccaya visesa nipphannānam hi
translated: “Bearing one Buddha”: bearing one Buddha. By this he shows that these Buddha-qualities are of such a nature that this world-system is incapable of bearing a second set of Buddha-qualities. For the difference in weight of qualities produced by a difference in conditions

original: guṇadhammānaṃ bhāriyo viseso mahāpathaviyāpi dussahoti sakkā viññātuṃ. Tathā hi abhisambodhisamaye
analyzed: guṇa dhammānam bhāriyaḥ visesaḥ mahā pathaviyā api dussahaḥ ti sakkā viññātum tathā hi abhisambodhi samaye
translated: can be known to be so great that it is beyond the capacity even of the great earth. For thus, at the time of the Supreme Perfect Awakening,

original: upagatassa lokanāthassa guṇabhāraṃ bodhirukkhassa tīsupi disāsu mahāpathavī sandhāretuṃ🔽nāsakkhi. Tasmā “na dhāreyyā”ti vatvā tameva adhāraṇaṃ pariyāyantarehi pakāsento
analyzed: upagatassa lokanāthassa guṇa bhāram bodhi rukkhassa tīsu pi disāsu mahā pathavī sandhāretum  na asakkhi tasmai na dhāreyya iti vatvā tam eva a dhāraṇam pariyāya antarehi pakāsentaḥ
translated: the great earth was unable to bear the weight of the qualities of the Lord of the World who had come to the foot of the Bodhi Tree in all three directions.🔽Therefore, after saying “would not bear,” he shows that very non-bearing by other synonyms,

original: “caleyyā”tiādimāha. Tattha caleyyāti paripphandeyya. Kampeyyāti pavedheyya. Nameyyāti
analyzed: caleyya atiādim āha tattha caleyya ati paripphandeyya kampeyya ati pavedheyya nameyya ati
translated: saying “would tremble,” etc. There, “would tremble” means it would shake. “Would quake” means it would quake. “Would quake violently” means it would quake violently.

original: ekapassena nameyya. Onameyyāti osīdeyya. Vinameyyāti vividhaṃ ito cito ca nameyya.
analyzed: eka passena nameyya onameyya ati osīdeyya vinameyya ati vividham itas citas ca nameyya
translated: He should bend it in one direction. He should bend it down: he should lower it. He should bend it in various ways: he should bend it in various ways, here and there.

original: Vikireyyāti vātena thusamuṭṭhi viya vippakireyya. Vidhameyyāti vinasseyya. Viddhaṃseyyāti
analyzed: vikireyya ati vātena thusa muṭṭhi viya vippakireyya vidhameyya ati vinasseyya viddhaṃseyya ati
translated: He should scatter it: he should scatter it like a handful of chaff blown about by the wind. He should destroy it: he should annihilate it. He should crush it:

original: sabbaso viddhastā bhaveyya. Tathābhūtā ca na katthaci tiṭṭheyyāti āha – “na ṭhānamupagaccheyyā”ti.
analyzed: sabbasas viddhastā bhaveyya tathābhūtā ca na katthaci tiṭṭheyya ati āha na ṭhānam upagaccheyya iti
translated: he should crush it completely. And when it is in that condition, it will not stand anywhere, thus he said: “It will not stand anywhere.”

original: Idāni tattha nidassanaṃ dassento, “yathā, mahārājā”tiādimāha. Tattha eke puriseti🔽ekasmiṃ purise. Samupādikāti samaṃ uddhaṃ pajjati pavattatīti samupādikā, udakassa
analyzed: idāni tattha nidassanam dassentaḥ yathā mahā rājāti ādim āha tattha eke purisa iti  ekasmin purise samupādikā ati samam uddham pajjati pavattati iti samupādikā udakassa
translated: Now, showing the illustration there, he said: “As, sire,” and so on. Herein, one man:

original: upari samaṃ gāminīti attho. “Samuppādikā”tipi paṭhanti, ayamevattho. Vaṇṇenāti saṇṭhānena.
analyzed: upari samam gāminī iti paṭhanti ayam eva atthaḥ vaṇṇena ati saṇṭhānena
translated: in one man. A current: a current that flows up evenly is a sam-upādikā . The meaning is that it flows evenly over the water. They also read sam-uppādikā , but the meaning is the same. In colour: in shape.

original: Pamāṇenāti ārohena. Kisathūlenāti kisathūlabhāvena, pariṇāhenāti attho. Dvinnampīti
analyzed: pamāṇena ati ārohena kisathūlena ati kisathūla bhāvena pariṇāhena ati atthaḥ dvinnam pi iti
translated: In size: in height. In thickness: in thickness, is the meaning of kisathūla. In both:

original: dvepi, dvinnampi vā sarīrabhāraṃ.
analyzed: vā sarīra bhāram
translated: in both two, or in the bodily burden of two.

original: Chādentanti rocentaṃ ruciṃ uppādentaṃ. Tandikatoti tena bhojanena tandibhūto. Anonamitadaṇḍajātoti🔽yāvadatthaṃ bhojanena onamituṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya anonamanadaṇḍo viya jāto. Sakiṃ bhutto
analyzed: rocentam rucim uppādentam tandikatoti tena bhojanena tandi bhūtaḥ  yāvadattham bhojanena onamitum a sakkuṇeyya tāya an onamana daṇḍaḥ viya jātaḥ sakim bhutto
translated: “It covers” : it produces the delight of those who are greedy. “He is as if made of dough” :

original: vameyyāti ekampi ālopaṃ ajjhoharitvā vameyyāti attho.
analyzed: vameyya iti ekam pi ālopam ajjhoharitvā vameyya iti attho
translated: he is as if made of dough because he is unable to bend down to eat as much as he wants. “If he eats once” : the meaning is, if he swallows even one mouthful.

original: Atidhammabhārena pathavī calatīti dhammena nāma pathavī tiṭṭheyya. Sā kiṃ teneva🔽calati vinassatīti adhippāyena pucchati. Puna thero “ratanaṃ nāma loke kuṭumbaṃ sandhārentaṃ
analyzed: ati dhamma bhārena pathavī calati iti dhammena nāma pathavī tiṭṭheyya sā kim tena iva  calati vinassati iti adhippāyena pucchati puna theraḥ ratanam nāma loke kuṭumbam sandhārentam
translated: “The earth quakes with the weight of the Dhamma” : the earth would stand by the Dhamma. But why does it quake and perish by that very thing? This is the meaning of the question.🔽The Elder replied, “In the world, a cart is considered a treasure because it carries the family’s belongings and is dear to the people.

original: abhimatañca lokena attano garusabhāvatāya sakaṭabhaṅgassa kāraṇaṃ atibhārabhūtaṃ
analyzed: abhimatam ca lokena attanaḥ garusa bhāva tāya sakaṭa bhaṅgassa kāraṇam atibhāra bhūtam
translated: But because it is too heavily loaded, it breaks down.

original: diṭṭhaṃ. Evaṃ dhammo ca hitasukhavisesehi taṃsamaṅgīnaṃ dhārento abhimato ca viññūnaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭham evam dhammo ca hita sukha visesehi taṃsamaṅgīnam dhārentaḥ abhimataḥ ca viññūnam
translated: In the same way, the Dhamma is considered dear to the wise because it carries those who are its followers to the highest happiness and welfare.

original: gambhīrappameyyabhāvena garusabhāvattā atibhārabhūto pathavīcalanassa kāraṇaṃ hotī”ti
analyzed: gambhīra ppameyya bhāvena garusa bhāva ttā atibhāra bhūto pathavī calanassa kāraṇam hoti iti
translated: But because it is too heavily loaded with the weight of the profundity and immeasurability, it becomes the cause of the quaking of the earth.”

original: dassento, “idha, mahārāja, dve sakaṭā”tiādimāha. Eteneva tathāgatassa mātukucchiokkamanādikāle
analyzed: dassentaḥ mahā rāja dve sakaṭāti ādim āha etena iva tathāgatassa mātukucchi okkamana ādi kāle
translated: “Here, sire, are two carts” and so on. By this the reason for the quaking of the earth at the time of the Tathāgata’s descent from the Tusita heaven and so on is also praised.

original: pathavīkampanakāraṇaṃ saṃvaṇṇitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ekassāti ekasmā, ekassa vā sakaṭassa
analyzed: pathavī kampana kāraṇam saṃvaṇṇitam ti daṭṭhabbam ekassa ati ekasmai ekassa vā sakaṭassa
translated: One cart: from one, or for one cart.

original: ratanaṃ, tasmā sakaṭā gahetvāti attho.
analyzed: ratanam tasmā sakaṭāḥ gahetvā ati attho
translated: Jewel: a gem. Therefore, the meaning is: “taking the carts.”

original: Osāritanti uccāritaṃ, vuttanti attho. Aggoti sabbasattehi aggo. Jeṭṭhoti vuddhataro.🔽Seṭṭhoti pasatthataro. Visiṭṭhehi sīlādīhi guṇehi samannāgatattā visiṭṭho. Uggatatamoti
analyzed: osāritam ti uccāritam vuttam ti attho aggo ti sabba sattehi aggaḥ jeṭṭhaḥ ti vuddhataro  seṭṭhaḥ ti pasatthataraḥ visiṭṭhehi sīla ādīhi guṇehi samannāgata ttā visiṭṭhaḥ uggatatamaḥ ti
translated: Utter: pronounced; the meaning is: spoken. Foremost: the foremost of all beings. Chief: more senior.🔽Best: more esteemed. Excellent: endowed with excellent virtues such as virtue and so on. Supreme:

original: uttamo. Pavaroti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Natthi etassa samoti asamo. Asamā pubbabuddhā,
analyzed: uttamaḥ pavaraḥ ti tassa iva vevacanam na atthi etassa samaḥ ti asamaḥ asamā pubbabuddhā
translated: highest. Peerless: a synonym for that. Matchless: there is no equal to this. Unequalled: the former Buddhas are unequalled.

original: tehi samoti asamasamo. Natthi etassa paṭisamo paṭipuggaloti appaṭisamo. Natthi etassa
analyzed: tehi samaḥ ti asamasamaḥ natthi etassa paṭisamo paṭipuggalo ti appaṭisamaḥ natthi etassa
translated: Equal to them: unequalled. No equal: there is no equal person to this. No rival: there is no rival to this.

original: paṭibhāgoti appaṭibhāgo. Natthi etassa paṭipuggaloti appaṭipuggalo.
analyzed: paṭibhāgaḥ ti appaṭibhāgaḥ natthi etassa paṭipuggalo ti appaṭipuggalo
translated: No counterpart: there is no counterpart to this.🔽No equal: there is no equal person to this.

original: Sabhāvapakatikāti sabhāvabhūtā akittimā pakati. Kāraṇamahantattāti kāraṇānaṃ mahantatāya,
analyzed: sabhāva pakatikā ati sabhāva bhūtā akittimā pakati kāraṇa mahantattā ati kāraṇānam mahantatāya
translated: “By nature and by kind”: by nature and by kind it is unblamable. “Because of the greatness of the cause”: because of the greatness of the causes,

original: mahantehi buddhakaradhammehi pāramisaṅkhātehi kāraṇehi buddhaguṇānaṃ nibbattitoti
analyzed: mahantehi buddha kara dhammehi pārami saṅkhātehi kāraṇehi buddha guṇānam nibbattitaḥ ti
translated: which are called perfections and are the causes of the Buddha-qualities. What is meant is: the Buddha-qualities are produced by great causes.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Pathavīādīni mahantāni vatthūni, mahantā cakkavāḷādayo attano attano🔽visaye ekekāva, evaṃ sammāsambuddhopi mahanto attano visaye eko eva. Ko ca tassa🔽visayo? Buddhabhūmi, yāvatakaṃ vā ñeyyaṃ. “Ākāso viya anantavisayo bhagavā eko eva
analyzed: vuttam hoti pathavī ādīni mahantāni vatthūni mahantā cakkavāḷa ādayo attanaḥ attanaḥ  visaye evam sammāsambuddhaḥ api mahantaḥ attanaḥ visaye ekaḥ eva kaḥ ca tassa  visayaḥ buddha bhūmi yāvatakam vā ñeyyam ākāsaḥ viya ananta visayaḥ bhagavā ekaḥ eva
translated: The great elements such as earth, etc., are great because they are the bases of great world-spheres such as the Cakkavāḷa, etc., which are great in extent.🔽In the same way, the Perfectly Enlightened One is great because he is the basis of the great Buddha-qualities. And what is his extent? The plane of the Buddhas, or else the extent of the knowable.

original: hotī”ti vadanto paracakkavāḷesupi dutiyassa buddhassa abhāvaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: hoti iti vadanto para cakkavāḷesu pi dutiyassa buddhassa abhāvam dasseti
translated: “The Blessed One is great in extent like space, for he is the only one.” By this statement the Master shows that there is no second Buddha even in other world-spheres.🔽“By this very expression”: by the very expression “in a single world-sphere.”

original: Imināva padenāti “ekissā lokadhātuyā”ti iminā eva padena. Dasa cakkavāḷasahassāni
analyzed: iminā ava padena ati ekissā lokadhātuyā ati iminā eva padena dasa cakkavāḷa sahassāni
translated: Ten thousand world-spheres are included,

original: gahitānīti jātikhettāpekkhāya gahitāni. Ekacakkavāḷenevāti iminā eva ekacakkavāḷena,
analyzed: gahitāni iti jāti khetta apekkhāya gahitāni eka cakkavāḷena iva ati iminā eva eka cakkavāḷena
translated: because the Buddha-field is considered to be that extent. “By a single world-sphere”: by a single world-sphere such as this one.

original: na yena kenaci. Yathā “imasmiṃyeva cakkavāḷe uppajjantī”ti vutte imasmimpi cakkavāḷe
analyzed: na yena kenacid yathā imasmin yeva cakkavāḷe uppajjanti iti vutte imasmin pi cakkavāḷe
translated: Not by any one. Just as when it is said, “They arise in this very world-sphere,” it is proper to delimit them by this world-sphere,

original: jambudīpe eva, tatthāpi majjhimadese evāti paricchindituṃ vaṭṭati, evaṃ “ekissā lokadhātuyā”ti
analyzed: jambudīpe eva tattha api majjhima dese eva ati paricchinditum vaṭṭati evam ekissā lokadhātuyā ati
translated: and in this world-sphere by the Rose-Apple Island, and there by the Middle Land, so too, when it is said, “in one world-sphere,”

original: jātikhette adhippetepi imināva cakkavāḷena paricchindituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: jāti khette adhippete pi iminā ava cakkavāḷena paricchinditum vaṭṭati
translated: it is proper to delimit it by this world-sphere, which is the field of the birth of beings.

original: Paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽15. Aṭṭhānapāḷi (dutiyavagga)
analyzed: paṭhama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  dutiya vagga
translated: The commentary on the first section is ended.🔽The text on the bases (second section)

original: (15) 2. Aṭṭhānapāḷi-dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the text on the bases (second section)

original: 278. Vivādupacchedatoti vivādupacchedakāraṇā. Dvīsu uppannesu yo vivādo bhaveyya,🔽tassa anuppādoyevettha vivādupacchedo. Ekasmiṃ dīpetiādinā dīpantarepi ekajjhaṃ na
analyzed: vivāda upacchedataḥ ti vivāda upaccheda kāraṇā dvīsu uppannesu yaḥ vivādaḥ  tassa anuppādaḥ yā iva itthā vivāda upacchedaḥ ekasmin dīpa iti ādinā dīpa antare pi ekajjham na
translated: By the cutting off of disputes: by the cause of the cutting off of disputes. When two arise, there would be a dispute.🔽The cutting off of the dispute here is just the non-arising of that. He shows that it does not arise even in another world-sphere, such as the one that is illuminated, etc.,

original: uppajjati, pageva ekadīpeti dasseti. Sopi parihāyethāti cakkavāḷassa padese eva pavattitabbattā parihāyeyya.
analyzed: uppajjati pageva eka dīpe iti dasseti saḥ api parihāyetha ati cakkavāḷassa padese eva pavattitabba ttā parihāyeyya
translated: let alone in one world-sphere. That also would be lost: because it would have to occur only in the region of the world-sphere, it would be lost.

original: 279-280. Manussattanti manussabhāvo tasseva pabbajjādiguṇānaṃ yoggabhāvato. Liṅgasampattīti
analyzed: manussa ttanti manussa bhāvaḥ tassa iva pabbajja ādi guṇānam yogga bhāvataḥ liṅga sampatti iti
translated: “Humanity” is the human state, since it is a condition for the possession of the qualities of going forth, etc. “The possession of sex” is

original: purisabhāvo. Hetūti manovacīpaṇidhānapubbikā hetusampadā. Satthāradassananti satthusammukhībhāvo.
analyzed: purisa bhāvaḥ hetu uti manaḥ vacī paṇidhāna pubbikā hetu sampadā satthāra dassananti satthu sammukhībhāvaḥ
translated: the male sex. “The cause” is the possession of the cause, which is the prior volition and aspiration. “The sight of the Master” is the presence of the Buddha.

original: Pabbajjāti kammakiriyavādīsu tāpasesu, bhikkhūsu vā pabbajjā. Guṇasampattīti abhiññādiguṇasampadā.🔽Adhikāroti buddhe uddissa adhiko kāro, savisesā upakārakiriyā adhiko sakkāroti vuttaṃ
analyzed: pabbajjā ati kamma kiriya vādīsu tāpasesu bhikkhūsu vā pabbajjā guṇa sampattī iti abhiññā ādi guṇa sampadā  adhikāro ti buddhe uddissa adhikaḥ kāro sa visesā upakāra kiriyā adhiko sakkāro ti vuttaṃ
translated: “Going forth” is the going forth among the ascetics who profess the doctrine of kamma or among the bhikkhus. “The possession of the qualities” is the possession of the qualities of the higher spiritual attainments, such as the direct knowledges.

original: hoti. Chandova chandatā, sammāsambodhiṃ uddissa sātisayo kattukamyatākusalacchando.
analyzed: hoti chandaḥ iva chandatā sammāsambodhim uddissa sa atisayaḥ kattu kamya tā kusala chando
translated: “The service” is the service rendered to the Buddha, which is superior, distinguished, and special. “The aspiration” is the wholesome aspiration, the strong desire to do what is to be done, directed towards the supreme enlightenment.

original: Aṭṭhadhammasamodhānāti etesaṃ aṭṭhannaṃ dhammānaṃ samāyogena. Abhinīhāroti kāyapaṇidhānaṃ.
analyzed: aṭṭha dhamma samodhānā ati etesam aṭṭhannam dhammānam samāyogena abhinīhāro ti kāya paṇidhānam
translated: “The concurrence of the eight factors” is the combination of these eight factors. “The resolution” is the bodily aspiration.

original: Samijjhatīti nipphajjati. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthāro pana paramatthadīpaniyā cariyāpiṭakavaṇṇanāya
analyzed: samijjhati iti nipphajjati ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ pana paramattha dīpaniyā cariyā piṭaka vaṇṇanāya
translated: “Is fulfilled” means is accomplished. This is the brief explanation here. The detailed explanation is given in the commentary on the Cariyāpiṭaka, which elucidates the ultimate truth.

original: vuttanayena veditabbo. Sabbākāraparipūramevāti paripuṇṇalakkhaṇatāya sattuttamādīhi
analyzed: vutta nayena veditabbo sabba ākāra paripūram eva ati paripuṇṇa lakkhaṇa tāya sattu uttama ādīhi
translated: It should be understood in the way stated.🔽In every respect complete: endowed in every respect with the thirty-two marks, with the supernormal powers, etc.,

original: sabbākārena sampannameva. Na hi itthiyā kosohitavatthaguyhatādi sambhavati. Dutiyapakati
analyzed: sabba ākārena sampannam eva na hi itthiyā kosohita vattha guyha tā ādi sambhavati dutiya pakati
translated: with the ten powers, etc., and with the eighteen principal qualities of a Buddha. For a woman cannot have a sheathed penis, etc.,

original: ca nāma paṭhamapakatito nihīnā eva. Tenevāha – anantaravāre “yasmā”tiādi.
analyzed: ca nāma paṭhama pakatitaḥ nihīnāḥ eva tena iva āha anantara vāre
translated: and the second sex is inferior to the first. That is why he says “because” , etc.

original: 281. Idha purisassa tattha nibbattanatoti imasmiṃ manussaloke purisabhūtassa tattha🔽brahmaloke brahmattabhāvena nibbattanato. Tena asatipi purisaliṅge purisākārā brahmāno🔽hontīti dasseti. Taṃyeva ca purisākāraṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ bhagavatā “yaṃ puriso brahmattaṃ
analyzed: idha purisassa tattha nibbattanato ti imasmin manussa loke purisa bhūtassa tattha  brahma loke brahmatta bhāvena nibbattanato tena asati pi purisa liṅge purisa ākārāḥ brahmānaḥ  honti iti dassa iti tam yeva ca purisa ākāram sandhāya vuttam bhagavatā yam puriso brahmattam
translated: Herein, because of his rebirth there as a male: because he is reborn there in the Brahmā-world in the male sex of a Brahmā,🔽it is shown that the Brahmās have the appearance of a male even though they have no male organ. And it is with reference to that same appearance of a male that the Blessed One said: “What a male might do by means of a male organ a Brahmā does by means of his appearance” . That is why he says “even though they are similar” , and so on.

original: kāreyyā”ti. Tenevāha – “samānepī”tiādi. Yadi evaṃ itthiyo brahmaloke na uppajjeyyunti
analyzed: kāreyyā iti tena iva āha samāne pi itiādi yadi evam itthiyaḥ brahma loke na uppajjeyyun ti
translated: If that is so, then women cannot be reborn in the Brahmā-world,

original: āha – “brahmatta”ntiādi.
analyzed: āha
translated: he says “Brahmā” , and so on.

original: 290-295. “Kāyaduccaritassā”tiādipāḷiyā kammaniyāmo nāma kathito. Samañjanaṃ samaṅgo,
analyzed: kāya duccaritassa ati ādi pāḷiyā kammaniyāmaḥ nāma kathitaḥ samañjanam samaṅgo
translated: The “law of kamma” is stated in the text with the words “because of misconduct in body” , and so on. Samañña is the same as saṅgaha ;

original: samannāgamo, so etassa atthīti samaṅgī, samannāgato, samañjanasīlo vā samaṅgī, pubbabhāge
analyzed: samannāgamaḥ saḥ etassa atthi iti samaṅgī samannāgataḥ samañjana sīlaḥ vā samaṅgī pubbabhāge
translated: He who has this is “endowed” , “possessed” of it. Or he is “endowed” because he is of a kind to mix ,

original: upakaraṇasamudāyato pabhuti āyūhanavasena āyūhanasamaṅgītā, sanniṭṭhāpakacetanāvasena🔽cetanāsamaṅgitā. Cetanāsantativasena vā āyūhanasamaṅgitā, taṃtaṃcetanākkhaṇavasena
analyzed: upakaraṇa samudāyataḥ āyūhana vasena āyūhana samaṅgītā sanniṭṭhāpaka cetanā vasena  cetanā samaṅgi tā cetanā santati vasena vā āyūhana samaṅgi tā taṃ taṃ cetanā kkhaṇa vasena
translated: in the sense of accumulating from the time of the equipment onwards. He is “endowed” in the sense of the volition that consummates.

original: cetanāsamaṅgītā. Katūpacitassa avipakkavipākassa kammassa vasena kammasamaṅgitā.🔽Kamme pana vipaccituṃ āraddhe vipākappavattivasena vipākasamaṅgitā. Kammādīnaṃ upaṭṭhānakālavasena🔽upaṭṭhānasamaṅgitā. Kusalākusalakammāyūhanakkhaṇeti kusalakammassa akusalakammassa
analyzed: cetanā samaṅgī tā katu upacitassa avipakka vipākassa kammassa vasena kamma samaṅgi tā  kamme pana vipaccitum āraddhe vipāka ppavatti vasena vipāka samaṅgi tā kamma ādīnam upaṭṭhāna kāla vasena  upaṭṭhāna samaṅgi tā kusala akusala kamma āyūhana khaṇe ti kusala kammassa akusala kammassa
translated: Or he is “endowed” in the sense of the continuity of volition. He is “endowed” in the sense of the volition of each moment. He is “endowed” in the sense of kamma by virtue of the kamma whose result has not yet matured that has been stored up.🔽But when the kamma has begun to yield its result he is “endowed” in the sense of the rebirth-linking that is the result of that kamma. He is “endowed” in the sense of the manifestation of kamma, etc., by virtue of the time when kamma, etc., are manifested.

original: ca samīhanakkhaṇe. Tathāti iminā kusalākusalakammapadaṃ ākaḍḍhati. Yathā kataṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: ca samīhana kkhaṇe tathā iti iminā kusala akusala kamma padam ākaḍḍhati yathā katam kammam
translated: The “time of accumulating profitable and unprofitable kamma” is the time of accumulating profitable and unprofitable kamma. “Thus” refers to the profitable and unprofitable kamma. “As it is done” means🔽as it is done by the doer.

original: phaladānasamatthaṃ hoti, tathā kataṃ upacitaṃ. Vipākārahanti dutiyabhavādīsu vipaccanārahaṃ.
analyzed: phala dāna samattham hoti tathā katam upacitam dutiya bhava ādīsu
translated: and it is capable of giving its fruit, then it is stored up in that way. It is due to be experienced in due course in the next becoming, and so on.🔽The construction of the words should be understood in this way: “The sign of rebirth occurs in the consciousness of those who are being reborn.”

original: Uppajjamānānaṃ upapattinimittaṃ upaṭṭhātīti yojanā. Upapattiyā uppajjanassa nimittaṃ
analyzed: uppajjamānānam upapatti nimittam upaṭṭhāti iti yojanā upapattiyāḥ uppajjanassa nimittam
translated: The sign of rebirth is the cause of rebirth,

original: kāraṇanti upapattinimittaṃ, kammaṃ, kammanimittaṃ, gatinimittañca. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽pana gatinimittavaseneva yojanā dassitā. Kammakammanimittānampi upaṭṭhānaṃ yathārahaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇam ti upapatti nimittam kammam kamma nimittam gati nimittam ca aṭṭhakathāyam  pana gati nimitta vasena iva yojanā dassitā kamma kamma nimittānam pi upaṭṭhānam yathāraham
translated: of arising again.🔽But in the commentary the construction is given only as the sign of the destiny.🔽The occurrence of kamma and the sign of kamma should be understood as appropriate.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Yānissa tāni pubbe katāni kammāni, tānissa tasmiṃ samaye olambanti ajjholambanti
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam yāni issa tāni pubbe katāni kammāni tāni issa tasmin samaye olambanti ajjholambanti
translated: “Whatever kamma he has done in the past comes to him, comes right up to him,🔽comes face to face with him” .

original: abhilambanti”ti vacanato sāyanhe mahantānaṃ pabbatakūṭānaṃ chāyā viya āsannamaraṇassa
analyzed: abhilambanti iti vacanataḥ sāyanhe mahantānam pabbata kūṭānam chāyā viya āsanna maraṇassa
translated: Just as the shadow of a great mountain peak comes in the evening, so kamma that has had opportunity to ripen in the consciousness of a being whose death is near,

original: sattassa citte supine viya vipaccituṃ katokāsaṃ kammaṃ, tassa nimittaṃ gatinimittaṃ
analyzed: sattassa citte supine viya vipaccitum kata ukāsam kammam tassa nimittam gati nimittam
translated: and the sign of that kamma, and the sign of the destiny,

original: upatiṭṭhateva. Calatīti parivattati. Ekena hi kammunā tajje nimitte upaṭṭhite paccayavisesavasena
analyzed: upatiṭṭhatā iva calati iti parivattati ekena hi kammunā tajje nimitte upaṭṭhite paccaya visesa vasena
translated: It is “moving” because it is changing. For when a sign has arisen due to a certain action, then through a special condition,

original: tato aññena kammunā tadaññassa nimittassa upaṭṭhānaṃ parivattanaṃ. Sesā niccalā avasesā
analyzed: tatas aññena kammunā tad aññassa nimittassa upaṭṭhānam parivattanam sesā niccalā avasesā
translated: the arising of another sign due to another action is a change. The rest are “immovable” because they are not changing.

original: catubbidhāpi samaṅgitā niccalā aparivattanato.
analyzed: catubbidhā api samaṅgi tā niccalā a parivattanato
translated: The remaining four kinds are immovable.

original: Sunakhavājikoti sunakhehi migavājavasena vajanasīlo, sunakhaluddakoti attho. Talasantharaṇapūjanti
analyzed: sunakha vājikā iti su nakhehi miga vāja vasena vajana sīlo su nakha luddakaḥ ti attho
translated: “Dog-trapper” : one who traps dogs by the method of hunting deer with dogs; the meaning is, a dog-hunter. “The worship of the floor-covering” : the worship of the floor with flowers.

original: bhūmitalassa pupphehi santharaṇapūjaṃ. Āyūhanacetanā kammasamaṅgitāvasenāti kāyaduccaritassa
analyzed: bhūmi talassa pupphehi santharaṇa pūjam āyūhana cetanā kamma samaṅgi tā vasena ati kāya duccaritassa
translated: “By the volition of accumulation and by the concurrence of action” : by the volition that brings about the completion of bodily misconduct through the accumulation of action,

original: aparāparaṃ āyūhanena sanniṭṭhāpakacetanāya tasseva pakappane kammakkhayakarañāṇena🔽akhepitattā yathūpacitakammunā ca samaṅgibhāvassa vasena.
analyzed: apara aparam āyūhanena sanniṭṭhāpaka cetanāya tassa iva pakappane kamma khaya kara ñāṇena  a khepita ttā yathā upacita kammunā ca samaṅgi bhāvassa vasena
translated: and by the concurrence with the action that has been performed through the knowledge that brings about the exhaustion of action.

original: Kammanti akusalakammaṃ. Tasmiṃyeva khaṇeti āyūhanakkhaṇeyeva. Tassāti kammasamaṅgino
analyzed: kammanti akusala kammam tasmin yeva khaṇe ti āyūhana khaṇe yeva tassa ati kamma samaṅginaḥ
translated: “Action” : unwholesome action. “In that same moment” : in the very moment of accumulation. “That” : of the concurrence of action.

original: puggalassa saggo vārito, tañce kammaṃ vipākavāraṃ labheyyāti adhippāyo. Saggo vāritoti
analyzed: puggalassa saggaḥ vārito tat ce kammam vipāka vāram labheyya ati adhippāyaḥ saggaḥ vārito ti
translated: and heaven is barred to the person, and if that kamma were to get an opportunity to ripen.” “Heaven is barred”

original: ca nidassanamattaṃ. Manussalokopissa vāritovāti. Apare pana purimehi vipākāvaraṇassa🔽anuddhaṭattā “tasmiṃyeva khaṇe”ti ca avisesena vuttattā taṃ dosaṃ pariharituṃ “āyūhitakammaṃ
analyzed: ca nidassana mattam apare pana purimehi vipāka āvaraṇassa  anuddhaṭa ttā tasmin yeva khaṇe iti ca avisesena vutta ttā tam dosam pariharitum āyūhita kammam
translated: is said merely by way of illustration. The human world is also barred. But others, in order to avoid the fault of the omission of the previously mentioned obstruction to result,🔽and of the non-distinction of “at that moment,” say: “Kamma that is stored up is kamma that is done and stored up in the continuity of aggregates, and it is kamma that is stored up in the continuity of aggregates and has not lost its potency.”

original: nāmā”tiādimāha. Yadā kammaṃ vipākavāraṃ labhatīti idaṃ katokāsassa appaṭibāhiyattā
analyzed: nāma ati ādim āha yadā kammam vipāka vāram labhati iti idam kata ukāsassa appaṭibāhiya ttā
translated: “When kamma gets an opportunity to ripen” is said because the opportunity is not denied.

original: vuttaṃ. Tathā hi bhagavā tatiyapārājikavatthusmiṃ paṭisallīyi, imasmiṃ sutte “kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī”ti
analyzed: vuttam tathā hi bhagavā tatiya pārājika vatthusmim paṭisallīyi imasmin sutte kāya duccarita samaṅgī iti
translated: For the Blessed One, in the case of the third offense entailing expulsion, was secluded, and in this sutta he says “one who is associated with bodily misconduct.”

original: āgatattā vipākūpaṭṭhānasamaṅgitā na labbhanti.
analyzed: āgata ttāḥ vipāka upaṭṭhāna samaṅgi tāḥ na labbhanti
translated: Therefore it is not possible to be associated with the manifestation of result.

original: (Dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.)
analyzed: dutiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: (The commentary on the second sub-chapter is finished.)

original: Aṭṭhānapāḷivaṇṇanāyaṃ anuttānatthadīpanā niṭṭhitā.🔽16. Ekadhammapāḷi
analyzed: aṭṭhāna pāḷi vaṇṇanā ayam anuttānatthadīpanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words of the “Basis” is finished.🔽The one-thing discourse

original: (16) 1. Ekadhammapāḷi-paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā
translated: The first sub-chapter of the one-thing discourse

original: 296. Ekadhammapāḷivaṇṇanāyaṃ idha dhamma-saddo sabhāvattho “kusalā dhammā”tiādīsu
translated: In the commentary on the section on the one idea here the word idea dhamma has the meaning of individual essence sabhāva, as in the passages beginning “Profitable ideas” .🔽That is why it is said, “of one individual essence” .

original: viyāti āha – “ekasabhāvo”ti. Ekantenāti ekaṃsena, avassanti attho. Vaṭṭeti saṃsāravaṭṭe.
analyzed: viya iti āha eka sabhāvaḥ iti ekantena ati ekaṃsena avassanti attho vaṭṭa iti saṃsāra vaṭṭe
translated: In the sense of “in one way” means in the sense of “in one way only” .🔽In the sense of “without fail” .🔽In the round of rebirths means in the round of rebirths .🔽For the purpose of dispassion means for the purpose of non- delighting .

original: Nibbindanatthāyāti anabhiramanatthāya. Virajjanatthāyāti arajjanatthāya. Virajjanāyāti🔽palujjanāya. Tenevāha – “vigamāyā”ti. Rāgādīnaṃ nirodhāyāti maggañāṇena rāgādīnaṃ
analyzed: nibbindana tthāya ati an abhiramana tthāya virajjana tthāya ati a rajjana tthāya virajjanāya ati  tena iva āha vigamāya ati rāga ādīnam nirodhāya ati magga ñāṇena rāga ādīnam
translated: For the purpose of fading away means for the purpose of non-greasing .🔽For the purpose of fading away completely means for the purpose of falling away .🔽That is why it is said, “for the purpose of abandoning” .🔽For the purpose of cessation of lust, etc., means for the purpose of cessation of lust, etc., by means of the path- knowledge .

original: nirodhanatthāya. Maggañāṇena nirodhanaṃ nāma accantaṃ appavattikaraṇanti āha – “appavattikaraṇatthāyā”ti.🔽Yathā khādanīyassa mukhe katvā khādanaṃ nāma yāvadeva ajjhoharaṇatthaṃ, evaṃ rāgādīnaṃ
analyzed: nirodhana atthāya magga ñāṇena nirodhanam nāma accantam appavatti karaṇanti āha appavatti karaṇa tthāya ati  yathā khādanīyassa mukhe katvā khādanam nāma yāvat eva ajjhoharaṇa attham evam rāga ādīnam
translated: The cessation of lust, etc., by means of the path-knowledge is the making of them not liable to occur again, which is why it is said, “for the purpose of making them not liable to occur again” .

original: nirodhanaṃ vaṭṭanirodhanatthamevāti vuttaṃ – “vaṭṭasseva vā nirujjhanatthāyā”ti.
analyzed: nirodhanam vaṭṭa nirodhana attham eva ati vuttam vaṭṭassa iva vā nirujjhana tthāya ati
translated: Just as the eating of what is put in the mouth is only for the purpose of swallowing, so too the cessation of lust, etc., is only for the purpose of the cessation of the round of rebirths, which is why it is said, “for the purpose of the cessation of the round of rebirths” .

original: Yasmā kilesesu khīṇesu itaraṃ vaṭṭadvayampi khīṇameva hoti, tasmā mūlameva gaṇhanto
analyzed: yasmā kilesesu khīṇesu itaram vaṭṭa dvayam pi khīṇam eva hoti tasmā mūlam eva gaṇhantaḥ
translated: Since when defilements are exhausted the other two rounds are also exhausted, he who takes the root

original: “upasamāyāti kilesavūpasamanatthāyā”ti āha. Saṅkhatadhammānaṃ abhijānanaṃ nāma tattha
analyzed: upasamāya ati kilesa vūpasamana atthāya ati āha saṅkhata dhammānam abhijānanam nāma tattha
translated: “For the purpose of tranquilizing” means for the purpose of tranquilizing defilements. “For the purpose of discerning” means the discerning of formed dhammas.

original: lakkhaṇattayāropanamukhenevāti āha – “aniccādi…pe… abhijānanatthāyā”ti. Sambujjhitabbāni
analyzed: lakkhaṇa ttayā āropana mukhena iva ati āha anicca ādipe abhijānana tthāya ati sambujjhitabbāni
translated: “By the method of superimposition of the characteristic” means by the method of superimposing the characteristic of impermanence, etc.

original: nāma cattāri ariyasaccāni tabbinimuttassa ñeyyassa abhāvato. “Catunnaṃ saccānaṃ bujjhanatthāyā”ti
analyzed: nāma cattāri ariya saccāni tad vinimuttassa ñeyyassa abhāvataḥ catunnam saccānam bujjhana tthāya ati
translated: “The four noble truths are to be awakened to” means that the four noble truths are to be awakened to because there is nothing else to be known apart from them.

original: vatvā tayidaṃ bujjhanaṃ yassa ñāṇassa vasena ijjhati, tassa ñāṇassa vasena dassetuṃ
analyzed: vatvā tayā idam bujjhanam yassa ñāṇassa vasena ijjhati tassa ñāṇassa vasena dassetuṃ
translated: Having said “For the purpose of awakening to the four noble truths,” in order to show that by the power of that knowledge this awakening is successful,🔽it is said, “Awakening is called … .”

original: – “bodhi vuccatī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Appaccayanibbānassāti amatadhātuyā.
analyzed: bodhi vuccati itiādi vuttam appaccaya nibbānassa ati amata dhātuyā
translated: “The deathless Nibbāna” means the deathless element.🔽“For the purpose of arousing enthusiasm” means for the purpose of arousing a liking for the meditation subject.

original: Ussāhajananatthanti kammaṭṭhāne abhiruciuppādanāya. Visakaṇṭakoti guḷassa vāṇijasamaññā.
analyzed: ussāha janana atthanti kammaṭṭhāne abhiruci uppādanāya visakaṇṭakaḥ ti guḷassa vāṇija samaññā
translated: “Sugarcane” is a name for the merchant.

original: “Kismiñci dese desabhāsā”ti keci. Ucchuraso samapākapakko cuṇṇādīhi missetvā piṇḍīkato
analyzed: kismiñci dese desa bhāsāti keci ucchu rasaḥ cuṇṇa ādīhi missetvā piṇḍīkataḥ
translated: “In some place, in the language of that place” some say.

original: guḷo, apiṇḍīkato phāṇitaṃ. Pākavisesena khaṇḍakhaṇḍasedito khaṇḍo, malābhāvaṃ āpanno sakkarā.
analyzed: guḷaḥ a piṇḍīkataḥ phāṇitam pāka visesena khaṇḍa khaṇḍa seditaḥ khaṇḍaḥ mala abhāvam āpanno sakkarā
translated: “Sugar” is a lump of sugar made by mixing molasses with flour, etc. “Treacle” is molasses. “Crystal sugar” is sugar that has been crushed into pieces by the excellence of its cooking. “Raw sugar” is sugar that has not reached the state of being free from impurities.

original: Saratīti sati. Anu anu saratīti anussati, anu anurūpā satītipi anussati. Duvidhaṃ🔽hotīti payojanavasena duvidhaṃ hoti. Cittasampahaṃsanatthanti pasādanīyavatthusmiṃ🔽pasāduppādanena bhāvanācittassa paritosanatthaṃ. Vipassanatthanti vipassanāsukhatthaṃ.
analyzed: sarati iti sati anu anu sarati iti anussati anu anurūpā sati iti pi anussati duvidham  hoti iti payojana vasena duvidham hoti citta sampahaṃsana attham pasādanīya vatthusmiṃ  pasāda uppādanena bhāvanā cittassa paritosana attham vipassana ttham ti vipassanā sukha attham
translated: It is mindfulness because it remembers . It is recollection because it remembers again and again . It is also recollection because it is a suitable form of mindfulness .🔽It is twofold : it is twofold as to purpose. For the purpose of gladdening the mind : for the purpose of gladdening the mind of development by arousing confidence in a confidence-inspiring object. For the purpose of insight : for the purpose of the happiness of insight. For when the mind is concentrated by access concentration, it succeeds by the happiness of insight.

original: Upacārasamādhinā hi citte samāhite vipassanāsukhena ijjhati. Cittuppādoti bhāvanāvasena🔽pavatto cittuppādo. Upahaññati patihaññati paṭikūlattā ārammaṇassa. Tato eva ukkaṇṭhati,
analyzed: upacāra samādhinā hi citte samāhite vipassanā sukhena ijjhati cittuppādaḥ ti bhāvanā vasena  pavattaḥ cittuppādaḥ upahaññati patihaññati paṭikūla ttā ārammaṇassa tatas eva ukkaṇṭhati
translated: The arising of consciousness : the arising of consciousness that occurs by way of development.🔽It is assailed, it is struck, because the object is unlovely. Therefore it is dissatisfied,🔽it abandons the meditation subject, and it is without enjoyment because of the non-attainment of the enjoyment of development. It is confident,

original: kammaṭṭhānaṃ riñcati, nirassādo hoti bhāvanassādassa alabbhanato. Pasīdati buddhaguṇānaṃ
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānam riñcati nirassādaḥ hoti bhāvanā ssādassa a labbhanataḥ pasīdati buddha guṇānaṃ
translated: because the special qualities of the Buddha inspire confidence. And it is free from the hindrances because of the absence of doubt and the other hindrances.

original: pasādanīyattā. Tathā ca kaṅkhādicetokhilābhāvena vinīvaraṇo hoti. Dametvāti nīvaraṇanirākaraṇena
analyzed: pasādanīya ttā tathā ca kaṅkha ādi cetaḥ khila abhāvena vinīvaraṇaḥ nīvaraṇa nirākaraṇena
translated: It is controlled :

original: nibbisevanaṃ katvā. Evaṃ kammaṭṭhānantarānuyuñjanena cittaparidamanassa upamaṃ dassento, “katha”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: nibbisevanam katvā evam kammaṭṭhāna antara anuyuñjanena citta paridamanassa upamam dassentaḥ katham iti ādim āha
translated: In the passage beginning “How? ” he shows the simile for the taming of the mind by the method of pursuing the meditation subject.

original: Ko ayaṃ…pe… anussarīti ko ayaṃ mama abbhantare ṭhatvā anussari. Pariggaṇhantoti bāhirakaparikappitassa
analyzed: kaḥ ayam pe anussari iti kaḥ ayam mama abbhantare ṭhatvā anussari pariggaṇhanto ti bāhiraka parikappitassa
translated: “Who is this that remembers? ”: who is this that stands within me and remembers?

original: anussarakassa sabbaso abhāvadassanametaṃ. Tenāha – “na añño kocī”ti. Disvāti pariyesananayena
analyzed: anussarakassa sabbasas abhāva dassanam etam tena āha na aññaḥ koci iti disvā iti pariyesana nayena
translated: “Examining”: this is the seeing that there is no such thing as an external memory-maker imagined by theorists.🔽“Having seen”: having seen the mind itself, of the kind described, as the only memory-maker by the method of searching out,

original: vuttappakāraṃ cittameva anussarīti disvā sabbampetanti etaṃ hadayavatthuādippabhedaṃ
analyzed: vutta ppakāram cittam eva anussarīti disvā etam hadaya vatthu ādi ppabhedam
translated: “all this”: all this, classed as the heart- basis, etc.,

original: sabbampi. Idañca rūpaṃ purimañca arūpanti idaṃ ruppanasabhāvattā rūpaṃ, purimaṃ ataṃsabhāvattā
analyzed: sabbam pi idam ca rūpam purimam ca arūpam ti idam rūpa na sabhāvattā rūpam purimam
translated: “this form and that formless” : this is form because it has the nature of distension ; that is formless because it has not that nature.🔽In brief, he defines form and the formless.

original: arūpanti saṅkhepato rūpārūpaṃ vavatthapetvā. Pañcakkhandhe vavatthapetvāti yojanā.
analyzed: arūpam ti saṅkhepataḥ rūpa arūpam vavatthapetvā pañca kkhandhe vavatthapetvā iti yojanā
translated: The construction is: having defined the five aggregates.🔽“Origination” is the source.🔽“Cessation” is the sign of cessation.

original: Sambhāvikāti samuṭṭhāpikā. Tassāti samudayasaccassa. Nirodhoti nirodhanimittaṃ. Appanāvāroti
analyzed: sambhāvikā ati samuṭṭhāpikā tassa ati samudaya saccassa nirodho ti nirodha nimittam appanā vāro ti
translated: “The path” is the path of practice.

original: yathāraddhāya desanāya nigamanavāro.
analyzed: yathā āraddhāya desanāya nigamana vāraḥ
translated: “The conclusion” is the summing up of the teaching as begun.

original: 297. Eseva nayoti iminā yvāyaṃ “taṃ paneta”ntiādinā atthanayo buddhānussatiyaṃ vibhāvitoti
analyzed: esa iva nayo ti iminā yvā ayam tam pana itanti ādinā attha nayaḥ buddha anussatiyam vibhāvitoti
translated: This is the method: by this he points out that the method of meaning stated in the section beginning, “But this recollection of the Buddha” is the same in each case.

original: atidisati, svāyaṃ atideso payojanavasena navasupi anussatīsu sādhāraṇavasena vuttopi
analyzed: atidisati svā ayam atidesaḥ payojana vasena anussatīsu sādhāraṇa vasena vuttaḥ api
translated: This pointing out is stated in the case of all nine recollections as a general method,

original: ānāpānassatiādīsu tīsu vipassanatthāneva hontīti iminā apavādena nivattitoti tāsaṃ
analyzed: āna apāna ssati ādīsu tīsu vipassana thānā eva honti iti iminā apavādena nivattito ti tāsam
translated: but it is excluded in the case of the three recollections of mindfulness occupied with the body, mindfulness of breathing, and the perception of loathsomeness in nutriment, since they are not of such meaning.

original: ekappayojanatāva daṭṭhabbā. Dhamme anussati dhammānussatīti samāsapadavibhāgadassanampi
analyzed: eka ppayojana tā ava daṭṭhabbā dhamme anussati dhamma anussati iti samāsa pada vibhāga dassanam pi
translated: So their meaning should be understood as being of one kind only. The word “recollection” in “recollection of the Dhamma” is a noun formed by adding the abstract suffix -tā to the root smarati .🔽The meaning of the word is shown by the words “Having defined the Dhamma in this way” .

original: vacanatthadassanapakkhikamevāti āha – “ayaṃ panettha vacanattho”ti. Dhammaṃ ārabbhāti
analyzed: vacana attha dassana pakkhikam eva ati āha ayam pana ittha vacana attho ti dhammaṃ ārabbha ati
translated: The words “Having defined virtue in this way” and so on are also stated in order to show the meaning of the words.🔽The words “Having defined gods in this way” are stated in order to show the meaning of the words in the case of the recollection of gods.🔽Herein, the words “Having defined gods in this way” show the meaning of the words in the recollection of gods.

original: hi dhammassa anussatiyā visayabhāvadassanametaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi. Sīlaṃ ārabbhāti🔽attano pārisuddhisīlaṃ ārabbha. Cāgaṃ ārabbhāti attano cāgaguṇaṃ ārabbha. Devatā
analyzed: hi dhammassa anussatiyāḥ visaya bhāva dassanam etam esa nayo sesesu pi sīlam  attano pārisuddhi sīlam ārabbha cāgam ārabbha ati attano cāga guṇam ārabbha devatā
translated: The words “Having defined virtue in this way” show the meaning of the words in the recollection of virtue.🔽The words “Having defined generosity in this way” show the meaning of the words in the recollection of generosity.

original: ārabbhāti ettha devatāguṇasadisatāya attano saddhāsīlasutacāgapaññāsu devatāsamaññā.
analyzed: ārabbha ati ettha devatā guṇa sadisa tāya attano saddhā sīla suta cāga paññāsu devatā samaññā
translated: The words “Having defined gods in this way” show the meaning of the words in the recollection of gods. Herein, the gods are called gods because they possess such and such special qualities similar to those of gods. They are called gods because they possess faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom similar to that of gods.

original: Bhavati hi taṃsadisepi tabbohāro yathā “tāni osadhāni, esa brahmadatto”ti ca. Tenāha
analyzed: bhavati hi tad sadise pi tad bohāraḥ yathā tāni ca tena āha
translated: For such expressions as “those herbs, that Brahmadatta” are used. Hence it is said:🔽

original: – “devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā”tiādi. Tattha devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvāti “yathārūpāya🔽saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tattha upapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā🔽saṃvijjati. Yathārūpena sīlena, yathārūpena sutena, yathārūpena cāgena, yathārūpāya🔽paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tattha upapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā paññā
analyzed: devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā atiādi tattha devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā iti yathārūpāya  saddhāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tattha upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā saddhā  saṃvijjati yathārūpena sīlena yathārūpena sutena yathārūpena cāgena yathārūpāya  paññāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tattha upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā paññā
translated: For such a one, too, there is a basis for the ascription of the name in the way already stated, as in the case of the herbs and Brahmadatta . That is why he said:

original: saṃvijjatī”ti evaṃ devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā. Assāsapassāsanimittaṃ nāma tattha
analyzed: saṃvijjati iti evam devatā sakkhi ṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā assāsa passāsa nimittam nāma tattha
translated: “Having made the deities his witness” and so on. Herein, having made the deities his witness is having made the deities his witness in this way: “The deities who have reappeared there are endowed with such faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom as I have.”🔽The sign of in-breaths and out-breaths is the counterpart sign obtained by him there.

original: laddhabbappaṭibhāganimittaṃ. Gatāti ārammaṇakaraṇavasena upagatā pavattā.
analyzed: laddhabba paṭibhāga nimittam gatā ati ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena upagatā pavattā
translated: Gone is the meaning of arrived at, reached, by making that the object.🔽Extinguishes here is cessation, Nibbāna.

original: Upasammati ettha dukkhanti upasamo, nibbānaṃ. Accantameva ettha upasammati vaṭṭattayanti
analyzed: ettha dukkhanti upasamaḥ nibbānam accantam eva ettha upasammati vaṭṭattayanti
translated: The three rounds of becoming are extinguished in it utterly,

original: accantūpasamo, nibbānameva. Khiṇoti khepeti kileseti khayo, ariyamaggo. Te eva upasametīti🔽upasamo, ariyamaggo eva. Khayo ca so upasamo cāti khayūpasamo. Tatracāyaṃ upasamo
analyzed: nibbānam eva khiṇoti khepeti kileseti khayaḥ ariya maggo te eva upasameti iti  upasamaḥ ariya maggo eva khayaḥ ca saḥ upasamaḥ ca ati khayūpasamaḥ tatra ca ayam upasamaḥ
translated: is complete peace, Nibbāna. It is a destroyer, a burner, a remover of defilements, thus it is destruction, the Noble Path. It is that which completely pacifies them,🔽thus it is peace, the Noble Path. It is that destruction and it is peace, thus it is destruction and peace. Herein, this is the peace,🔽🔽

original: dhammo evāti dhammānussatiyā upasamānussati ekasaṅgahoti? Saccaṃ ekasaṅgaho dhammabhāvasāmaññe
analyzed: dhammaḥ eva ati dhamma anussatiyāḥ upasama anussati eka saṅgaho ti saccam eka saṅgahaḥ dhamma bhāva sāmaññe
translated: and the uttermost peace is Nibbāna. The noble path is what “destroys” , “scatters” , “dispels” defilements, thus it is “destruction” . It is “peace” because it “makes them come to rest” , thus it is “peace” . It is “destruction” and it is “peace” , thus it is “destruction and peace” . Herein, is this “recollection of peace” included in the “recollection of the Dhamma”?—Yes, it is included in the “recollection of the Dhamma” since the “recollection of peace” is itself the Dhamma.

original: adhippete, saṅkhatadhammato pana asaṅkhatadhammo sātisayo uḷāratamapaṇītatamabhāvatoti
analyzed: adhippete saṅkhata dhammataḥ pana asaṅkhata dhammo sa atisayaḥ uḷāratama paṇītatama bhāvato ti
translated: But it is stated separately in order to show that the unformed element is superior to the formed element in the sense of being more excellent, sublime, and refined, though it is included in the “recollection of the Dhamma” because of the identity of essence of the Dhamma.

original: dīpetuṃ visuṃ nīharitvā vuttaṃ. Imameva hi visesaṃ sandhāya bhagavā – “dhammānussatī”ti
analyzed: dīpetum visum nīharitvā vuttam imam eva hi visesam sandhāya bhagavā dhamma anussati iti
translated: For with this very distinction in mind the Blessed One spoke first of the “recollection of the Dhamma” and then of the “recollection of peace” , since when one recollects it it appears as more peaceful than the other recollections.

original: vatvāpi upasamānussatiṃ avoca anussarantassa savisesaṃ santapaṇītabhāvena upaṭṭhānato.🔽Evañca katvā idha khayūpasamaggahaṇampi samatthitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yatheva hi samānepi
analyzed: vatvā api upasama anussatim avoca anussarantassa sa visesam santa paṇīta bhāvena upaṭṭhānato  evam ca katvā idha khaya upasama gahaṇam pi samatthitanti daṭṭhabbam yathā iva hi samāne pi
translated: And it should be regarded as included in the “recollection of destruction” too, since it is peace.🔽For just as, although the supramundane Dhamma is of one kind only, it is nevertheless divided into four “recollections of the Dhamma” according to the distinction of the four paths, so too it is divided into five “recollections of peace” according to the distinction of the five paths beginning with the stream-enterer’s .

original: lokuttaradhammabhāve “yāvatā, bhikkhave, dhammā saṅkhatā vā asaṅkhatā vā, virāgo
analyzed: lokuttara dhamma bhāve yāvatā bhikkhave dhammā saṅkhatāḥ vā asaṅkhatāḥ vā virāgo
translated: And just as, although the supramundane Dhamma is of one kind only, it is nevertheless divided into four “recollections of the Dhamma” according to the distinction of the four fruits, so too it is divided into four “recollections of the cessation of the six bases for contact” according to the distinction of the four fruits.🔽And just as, although the supramundane Dhamma is of one kind only, it is nevertheless divided into four “recollections of the Dhamma” according to the distinction of the four paths, so too it is divided into four “recollections of the cessation of the six bases for contact” according to the distinction of the four paths.

original: tesaṃ aggamakkhāyatī”tiādivacanato maggaphaladhammehi nibbānadhammo sātisayo, evaṃ
analyzed: tesam aggam akkhāyati iti ādi vacanataḥ magga phala dhammehi nibbāna dhammaḥ sa atisayaḥ evam
translated: and is reckoned their chief. ” So the Nibbāna element is more excellent than the states of path and fruition.

original: phaladhammato maggadhammo kilesappahānena acchariyadhammabhāvato, tasmā accantūpasamena
analyzed: phala dhammataḥ magga dhammaḥ kilesa ppahānena acchariya dhamma bhāvataḥ tasmai accantu upasamena
translated: And so too the path states are more excellent than the fruition states because of their special qualities of abandoning defilements and being a wonder.🔽That is why it should be understood that the words “with the cessation of that same feeling “ include the cessation of defilements too.

original: saddhiṃ khayūpasamopi gahitoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vipassanatthāneva hontīti kasmā vuttanti?🔽“Ekantanibbidāyātiādivacanato”ti keci, taṃ akāraṇaṃ buddhānussatiādīsupi tathā desanāya🔽āgatattā. Yathā pana buddhānussatiādīni kammaṭṭhānāni vipassanatthāni honti, nimittasampahaṃsanatthānipi
analyzed: saddhim khaya upasamaḥ api gahitoti daṭṭhabbam vipassana tthānā iva honti iti kasmā vuttan ti  ekanta nibbidāya ati ādi vacanataḥ ti keci tam akāraṇam buddha anussati ādīsu pi tathā desanāya  āgata ttā yathā pana buddha anussati ādīni kammaṭṭhānāni vipassana atthāni honti nimitta sampahaṃsana atthāni pi
translated: Why is it said that they are only for insight?🔽Some say that it is because of the words “For the purpose of complete dispassion” . But that is not a reason, because the teaching is given in that way in the case of the recollection of the Buddha, etc., too.

original: honti, na evametāni, etāni pana vipassanatthānevāti tathā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: honti na evam etāni etāni pana vipassana tthānā eva ati tathā vuttam
translated: But just as the recollections of the Buddha, etc., are meditation subjects that are only for insight and are also for the purpose of gladdening faith, so these are only for insight.

original: Paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The first chapter is finished.

original: 16. Ekadhammapāḷi
translated: The Collection of Threads

original: (16) 2. Ekadhammapāḷi-dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā
translated: The second chapter of the Collection of Threads

original: 298. Micchā passati tāya, sayaṃ vā micchā passati, micchādassanameva vā tanti micchādiṭṭhi,
analyzed: micchā passati tāya sayam vā micchā passati micchā dassanam eva vā micchā diṭṭhi
translated: He sees wrongly: he himself sees wrongly, or it is wrong view.

original: yaṃ kiñci viparītadassanaṃ. Tenāha – “dvāsaṭṭhividhāyā”tiādi. Micchādiṭṭhi etassāti
analyzed: yam kiñci viparīta dassanam tena āha dvāsaṭṭhi vidhāya atiādi micchādiṭṭhi etassa ati
translated: and any wrong view. Hence he said “in the sixty-two ways” and so on.

original: micchādiṭṭhiko. Tassa micchādiṭṭhikassa.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikaḥ tassa micchādiṭṭhikassa
translated: He who has wrong view is a “wrong-view man.”

original: 299. Sammā passati tāya, sayaṃ vā sammā passati, sammādassanamattameva vā tanti sammādiṭṭhi.🔽Pañcavidhāyāti kammassakatājhānavipassanāmaggaphalavasena pañcavidhāya. Tattha jhānacittuppādapariyāpannaṃ
analyzed: sammā passati tāya sayam vā sammā passati sammādassana mattam eva vā sammādiṭṭhi  pañcavidhāya ati kammassaka tā jhāna vipassanā magga phala vasena pañcavidhāya tattha jhāna cittuppāda pariyāpannam
translated: He sees rightly by means of it, or he himself sees rightly, or it is just the seeing rightly, thus it is right view .

original: ñāṇaṃ jhānasammādiṭṭhi, vipassanāñāṇaṃ vipassanāsammādiṭṭhi.🔽302. Pañcasu khandhesu “nicca”ntiādinā pavatto anupāyamanasikāro.
analyzed: ñāṇam jhāna sammādiṭṭhi vipassanā ñāṇam vipassanā sammādiṭṭhi
translated: In the five ways: in the five ways of the fruit of the jhāna, of insight, of the path, of fruition attainment, and of reviewing knowledge. Herein, knowledge included in the occurrence of jhāna consciousness is right view as jhāna; knowledge of insight is right view as insight.🔽. Wrong attention is attention that is not a means.🔽. Right attention is attention that is a means.

original: 303. “Anicca”ntiādinā pavatto upāyamanasikāro. Yāva niyāmokkamanāti yāva micchattaniyāmokkamanā.
analyzed: aniccanti ādinā pavattaḥ upāya manasikāraḥ yāva niyāma ukkamanā ati yāva micchatta niyāma ukkamanā
translated: As far as the descent to a lower level: as far as the descent to a wrong view.🔽But the method of the descent to a wrong view should be understood in the way stated in the commentary to the Sāmaññaphala Sutta .

original: Micchattaniyāmokkamananayo pana sāmaññaphalasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ taṭṭīkāya ca vuttanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: micchatta niyāma ukkamana nayaḥ pana sāmaññaphalasuttavaṇṇanāyam tad ṭīkāya ca vutta nayena iva veditabbo
translated: The method of non-transgression of the wrong course should be understood in the way stated in the commentary to the Sāmaññaphala Sutta.🔽

original: 304. Ayaṃ tividhā saggāvaraṇā ceva hotīti kammapathappattiyā mahāsāvajjabhāvato vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ayam tividhā sagga āvaraṇā ca iva hoti iti kammapatha pattiyāḥ mahā sāvajja bhāvataḥ vuttam
translated: This is the three-fold hindrance to heaven, and so it is said to be very blameworthy in that it prevents the obtaining of the path of action.

original: Saggāvaraṇāya hontiyā maggavibandhakabhāve vattabbameva natthīti vuttaṃ – “maggāvaraṇā
analyzed: sagga āvaraṇāya hontiyā magga vibandhaka bhāve vattabbam eva natthi iti vuttam magga āvaraṇā
translated: As to the hindrance to heaven, there is nothing to be said about its preventing the path, and so it is said that it is a hindrance to the path.

original: cā”ti. “Sassato loko”tiādikā dasavatthukā antaggāhikā micchādiṭṭhi. Maggāvaraṇāva
analyzed: ca ati sassataḥ loka uti ādikā dasa vatthukā antaggāhikā micchādiṭṭhi magga āvaraṇa āva
translated: The ten views of the eternalist type beginning with “The world and self are eternal” are a hindrance to the path,

original: hoti viparītadassanabhāvato, na saggāvaraṇā akammapathapattitoti adhippāyo. Idaṃ
analyzed: hoti viparīta dassana bhāvataḥ na sagga āvaraṇā akammapatha pattito ti adhippāyaḥ idam
translated: because they are a wrong view, but they are not a hindrance to heaven, because they are not a path of action. This is the purport.🔽But this rule is rejected,

analyzed: hattha mudda ādinā viññāpana kāle tāya diṭṭhiyā sahajātam kāya kammam na ca ittha vacī kamma āsaṅkā  uppādetabbā pāṇa ghāta ādīnam yeva adhippeta ttā diṭṭha ānulomikam kāya kammanti yathā paresam  pākaṭam hoti evam diṭṭhiyā anulomikam katvā pavattitam kāya kammam tena āha samādinnam  gahitam parāmaṭṭhanti tattha atiādi su viññeyyam eva iminā yathā vuttāya

Should be understood as applied : should be understood as applied as in the ninth sutta. The resolve is the fixing of the mind : here the word “resolve” should be taken as “wish” .

original: Dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.

translated: “A being destined for omniscience”: a being who shares in omniscience. The word “and” includes the perfected beings who have fulfilled the perfections and some disciples who are bodhisattvas.

analyzed: paramā ti mahā sāvajja bhāvena paramā ukkaṃsa gatā ti attho tesanti ānantariya kammānam  paricchedo ti vipāka vasena pariyosānam vaṭṭassa mūlam tatas tad samaṅgī puggalo vaṭṭassa
translated: “Supreme”: most blameworthy, most reprehensible, is the meaning. “Their”: of the actions of immediate retribution.🔽“Limit”: their end by way of result. The root of the round is the round itself. The person who is a member of the round is called

original: khāṇūti vuccati. Tenāha – “tāyā”tiādi. Tañce gāhaṃ na vissajjeti, tassa punapi tabbhāvāvahattā
analyzed: khāṇū ti vuccati tena āha tāya atiādi tat ce gāham na vissajjeti tassa puna pi tad bhāva āvaha tā

analyzed: vuttam bhavataḥ vuṭṭhānam natthi iti na pana sabbaso vuṭṭhānassa abhāvato yādise  hi paccaye paṭicca ayam tam dassanam okkanto puna kadāci tad paṭipakkhe paccaye paṭicca
translated: “There is no escape from becoming” is said, but not because there is no escape at all.🔽For if this view has come about in him through certain conditions, it cannot be said that it will not happen again through the same conditions at some time or another.

original: tato sīsukkhipanamassa na hotīti na vattabbaṃ. Akusalañhi nāmetaṃ abalaṃ dubbalaṃ,
analyzed: tatas sīsu khipanam assa na hoti iti na vattabbam akusalam hi nāma etat abalam dubbalam

translated: And in the Papañcasūdanī it is said:

translated: “But is he determined in only one individual existence, or in another one too? He is determined in only one. But by practice he approves of that view in another existence too.”

analyzed: vuttam ca sumaṅgalavilāsiniyam pi vuttam
translated: And in the Sumaṅgalavilāsinī it is said:

translated: “But those who, having adopted their doctrine, sit and recite and discuss it in their meeting places by day and night,

analyzed: sa tekicchāḥ honti tathā dutiya ādīsu sattame buddhānam pi atekicchāḥ anivattinaḥ ariṭṭha kaṇṭaka sadisāḥ
translated: In the first javana, the defilements are still to be abandoned. So too in the second and third. But in the seventh, even the Buddhas cannot cure him. He is incurable, irreversible, like a stump-eater or a thorn-eater.

original: tattha koci ekaṃ dassanaṃ okkamati, koci dve, koci tīṇipi, ekasmiṃ okkantepi dvīsu🔽tīsu okkantesupi niyatamicchādiṭṭhikova hoti. Patto saggamaggāvaraṇañceva mokkhamaggāvaraṇañca,🔽abhabbo tassattabhāvassa anantaraṃ saggampi gantuṃ, pageva mokkhaṃ, vaṭṭakhāṇu nāmesa
analyzed: tattha koci ekam dassanam okkamati koci dve koci tīṇi pi ekasmin okkante pi dvīsu  tīsu okkantesu pi niyatam icchādiṭṭhikaḥ uva hoti patto sagga magga āvaraṇam ca iva mokkha magga āvaraṇam ca  abhabbaḥ tad satta bhāvassa anantaram saggam pi gantum pagā iva mokkham vaṭṭakhāṇu nāma īsa
translated: “Some people enter the stream in the first javana, some in the second, some in the third. Even when one has entered the stream, and two or three have entered the stream,🔽he has definitely entered the wrong path. He has blocked the path to heaven and the path to liberation.🔽He is incapable of going to heaven in that same existence, much less of attaining liberation. He is a ‘tree-stump in the cycle of rebirths.’

original: satto pathavigopako, yebhuyyena evarūpassa bhavato vuṭṭhānaṃ natthī”ti.
analyzed: sattaḥ pathavi gopakaḥ yebhuyyena evarūpassa bhavataḥ vuṭṭhānam natthi iti
translated: He is a ‘ground-covering animal.’ For the most part, there is no escape for him from such an existence.”

original: Piṭṭhicakkavāḷeti jhāyamānacakkavāḷassa parato ekasmiṃ okāse. Yaṃ jhāyamānānaṃ ajjhāyamānānañca🔽cakkavāḷānamantaraṃ, yattha lokantarikanirayasamaññā, tādise ekasmiṃ okāse. Paccatiyevāti
analyzed: piṭṭhi cakkavāḷa iti jhāyamāna cakkavāḷassa paratas ekasmin okāse yam jhāyamānānam ajjhāyamānānam ca  cakkavāḷānam antaram yattha lokantarika niraya samaññā tādise ekasmin okāse paccatiyā iva ati
translated: In the space between the burning and the burnt world-spheres,🔽in a place like that. ‘It burns on’:

original: cakkavāḷe jhāyamāne ajjhāyamānepi attano kammabalena paccatiyeva.
analyzed: cakkavāḷe jhāyamāne ajjhāyamāne pi attano kamma balena paccatiyā iva
translated: even when the world-sphere is burning and has burnt out, it burns on by the power of its own kamma.

original: 311. Catutthe “mā khalī”ti vacanaṃ upādāya evaṃladdhanāmoti taṃ kira sakaddamāya
analyzed: catutthe mā khali iti vacanam upādāya evaṃladdha nāma iti tam kira sa kaddamāya
translated: In the fourth, the name is derived from the words ‘Don’t be careless’.

original: bhūmiyā telaghaṭaṃ gahetvā gacchantaṃ, “tāta, mā khalī”ti sāmiko āha. So pamādena🔽khalitvā patitvā sāmikassa bhayena palāyituṃ āraddho. Sāmiko upadhāvitvā sāṭakakaṇṇe
analyzed: tela ghaṭam gahetvā gacchantam tāta mā khalī iti sāmikaḥ āha saḥ u pamādena  khalitvā patitvā sāmikassa bhayena palāyitum āraddhaḥ sāmikaḥ upadhāvitvā sāṭaka kaṇṇe
translated: It seems that a man was going along with a pot of oil on his head, and his master said to him, ‘Don’t be careless, my good man.’🔽Through carelessness he stumbled, fell, and started to run away for fear of his master.🔽The master ran after him and seized the hem of his garment.

original: aggahesi. So sāṭakaṃ chaḍḍetvā acelako hutvā palāto paṇṇena vā tiṇena vā paṭicchādetumpi
analyzed: aggahesi saḥ sāṭakam chaḍḍetvā acelakaḥ hutvā palātaḥ paṇṇena vā tiṇena vā paṭicchādetum pi
translated: He threw off his garment and ran away naked, not knowing to cover himself with leaves or grass.

original: ajānanto jātarūpeneva ekaṃ gāmaṃ pāvisi. Manussā taṃ disvā “ayaṃ samaṇo arahā appiccho,
analyzed: a jānantaḥ jātarūpena iva ekam gāmam pāvisi manussā tam disvā ayam samaṇaḥ arahā appiccho
translated: He went to a village in his natural state. People saw him and said, ‘This ascetic is an arahat, so little does he care,

original: natthi iminā sadiso”ti pūvabhattādīni gahetvā upasaṅkamitvā “mayhaṃ sāṭakaṃ anivatthabhāvena
analyzed: na atthi iminā sadisaḥ iti pūvabhatta ādīni gahetvā upasaṅkamitvā mayham sāṭakam anivattha bhāvena
translated: There is none equal to me.” Taking with him cakes, rice, etc., he went to the ascetic and said, “Because I have no cloth to wear,

original: idaṃ uppanna”nti tato paṭṭhāya sāṭakaṃ labhitvāpi na nivāsesi, tadeva ca pabbajjaṃ
analyzed: idam uppannan ti tatas paṭṭhāya sāṭakam labhitvā api na nivāsesi tat eva ca pabbajjam
translated: I have attained this.” Thereafter, even though he received cloth, he did not wear it, but kept it as a token of his renunciation.

original: aggahesi. Tassa santike aññepi aññepīti pañcasatā manussā pabbajiṃsu. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ
analyzed: aggahesi tassa santike aññe api aññe api iti pañca satāḥ manussāḥ pabbajiṃsu tam sandhāya itam
translated: Five hundred people went forth under him. With reference to this it is said:

original: vuttaṃ – “mā khalīti vacanaṃ upādāya evaṃladdhanāmo titthakaro”ti.🔽Samāgataṭṭhāneti dvinnaṃ nadīnaṃ udakappavāhassa sannipātaṭṭhāne. Dvinnaṃ udakānanti
analyzed: vuttam mā khali iti vacanam upādāya evaṃladdha nāmo titthakaroti  samāgata ṭṭhāne iti dvinnam nadīnam udaka ppavāhassa sannipāta ṭṭhāne dvinnam udakānan ti
translated: “Because of the words ‘Do not be empty,’ the teacher of the sect received this name.”🔽At the confluence of two rivers: at the place where the waters of two rivers meet.

original: dvinnaṃ udakappavāhānaṃ. Yathāvuttaṭṭhāne macchaggahaṇatthaṃ khipitabbato khippaṃ,
analyzed: dvinnam udaka ppavāhānam yathāvutta ṭṭhāne maccha ggahaṇa attham khipitabbataḥ khippam
translated: Of two waters: of the waters of two rivers. Because it is thrown in the place described in order to catch fish, it is called “thrown.”

original: kuminaṃ, tadeva idha khippanti vuttaṃ. Tenāha – “kumina”nti. Ucchūhīti udakaucchūhi.
analyzed: kuminam tat eva idha khippanti vuttam tena āha kuminanti ucchūhi iti udaka occhūhi
translated: It is said that it is thrown in the water. Therefore it is said: “thrown in the water.”

original: Tucchapuriso ariyadhammābhāvato. Jhānamattampi hi tassa nattheva, kuto ariyamaggo.
analyzed: tuccha purisaḥ ariya dhamma abhāvataḥ jhāna mattam pi hi tassa nattha iva kutas ariya maggo
translated: An empty man: because he is devoid of the noble Dhamma. For he does not even have jhāna, much less the noble path.

original: Manussakhippaṃ maññeti manussā patitvā byasanappattiatthaṃ oṭṭitaṃ kuminaṃ viya.
analyzed: manussa khippam maññeti manussā patitvā byasana ppatti attham oṭṭitam kuminam viya
translated: He thinks it is a human trap: like a pitfall dug by men for the purpose of causing the misfortune of those who fall into it.

original: Tenāha – “mahājanassā”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha
translated: Hence he said: “For the great multitude” .

original: 312. Pañcamādīsu bāhirakasāsananti avisesena vuttaṃ – tassa sabbassapi aniyyānikattā
translated: In the fifth and following cases, the external doctrine is mentioned without distinction, because it is not conducive to the highest goal.

original: satthupaṭiññassapi asabbaññubhāvato. Tenāha – “tattha hī”tiādi. Gaṇoti sāvakagaṇo.
analyzed: satthu paṭiññassa api asabbaññu bhāvato tena āha tattha hi itiādi gaṇaḥ ti sāvaka gaṇaḥ
translated: And because the teacher is not omniscient. Hence he said: “For there” . A group is a group of disciples.

original: Tathābhāvāyāti ācariyena vuttākāratāya samaṅgibhāvatthaṃ. Jaṅghasatanti bahū aneke
analyzed: tathābhāvāya ati ācariyena vutta ākāra tāya samaṅgi bhāva ttham bahū aneke
translated: For the sake of that state: for the sake of being endowed with the state described by the teacher. A hundred leagues: many, numerous.

original: satte. Samakameva akusalaṃ pāpuṇātīti tesaṃ sabbesaṃ ekajjhaṃ samādapanepi tesaṃ🔽akusalena samakameva akusalaṃ pāpuṇāti ekajjhaṃ bahūnaṃ samādapanepi tathā ussahanassa
analyzed: satte samakam eva akusalam pāpuṇāti iti tesam sabbesam ekajjham samādapane pi tesam  akusalena samakam eva akusalam pāpuṇāti ekajjham bahūnam samādapane pi tathā ussahanassa
translated: He comes to evil only with the evil: even when he brings them all together and combines them, he comes to evil only with the evil.

original: balavabhāvato. Visuṃ visuṃ samādapane vattabbameva natthi. Yathā hi dhammacariyāyaṃ
analyzed: balava bhāvataḥ visum visum samādapane vattabbam eva na atthi yathā hi dhamma cariyā ayam
translated: Even when he brings them together in groups, he comes to evil only with the evil, because his effort is strong. There is nothing to be said about bringing them together individually.🔽For just as it is said that one comes to good only with the good in the case of good conduct,

original: samakamevāti vattabbā kalyāṇamittatā, evaṃ adhammacariyāyaṃ akalyāṇamittatāti.
analyzed: samakam evā ti vattabbā kalyāṇa mitta tā evam adhamma cariyā ayam akalyāṇa mitta tā ti
translated: so it is said that one comes to evil only with the evil in the case of evil conduct.

original: 313. Suṭṭhu akkhāteti ekantato niyyānikabhāvena akkhāte. Satthā ca sabbaññū hotīti
analyzed: suṭṭhu akkhāte ti ekantataḥ niyyānika bhāvena akkhāte satthā ca sabbaññū hoti iti
translated: The Teacher is omniscient:🔽because one who is not omniscient is incapable of teaching the escape from all suffering.

original: asabbaññuno niyyānikabhāvena kathetuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā. Dhammo ca svākkhāto sammāsambuddhappaveditattā.
analyzed: asabbaññunaḥ niyyānika bhāvena kathetum a sakkuṇeyya ttā dhammaḥ ca su ākkhātaḥ sammāsambuddha ppavedita ttā
translated: The Dhamma is well proclaimed: because it is taught by the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽The Saṅgha is practising well: because it is well trained by the Teacher.

original: Gaṇo ca suppaṭipanno satthārā suvinītattā. Samādapako hītiādi suppaṭipattiyā nidassanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: gaṇaḥ ca suppaṭipanno satthārā su vinīta ttā samādapako hi itiādi suppaṭipattiyā nidassanam daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: The one who exhorts: the meaning is, the one who teaches the way of practice.

original: 314. Pamāṇaṃ jānitabbanti “ayaṃ ettakena yāpeti, imassa ettakaṃ dātuṃ yutta”nti evaṃ🔽pamāṇaṃ jānitabbaṃ. Atireke…pe… nibbānasampatti vā natthi durakkhātattā dhammassa.
analyzed: pamāṇam jānitabbanti ayam ettakena yāpeti imassa ettakam dātum yuttam ti evam  pamāṇam jānitabbam atireka īpe nibbāna sampatti vā natthi durakkhāta ttā dhammassa
translated: The measure: the measure should be known thus: “This one can live on so much; it is proper to give him so much.”🔽If he gives more than that, etc.: because the Dhamma is badly proclaimed, there is no attainment of Nibbāna.

original: Tassāti paṭiggāhakassa. Appicchapaṭipadā nāma natthi durakkhāte dhammavinayeti adhippāyo.
analyzed: tassa ati paṭiggāhakassa appiccha paṭipadā nāma natthi durakkhāte dhamma vinaye ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The recipient: the intention is that there is no practice of fewness of wishes in one who receives a gift when the Dhamma and Discipline are badly proclaimed.🔽The giver’s inclination: the inclination to give what is inferior or superior.

original: 315. Dāyakassa vaso nāma uḷāruḷāratābhedo ajjhāsayo. Deyyadhammassa pana thokabahutāva
analyzed: dāyakassa vasaḥ nāma uḷāra uḷāra tā bhedaḥ ajjhāsayaḥ deyya dhammassa pana
translated: The gift: the amount of the gift is small or great.

original: deyyadhammassa vaso nāma. Attano thāmoti yāpanappamāṇaṃ. Yadi hītiādi “katha”ntiādinā
analyzed: deyya dhammassa vasaḥ nāma yāpana ppamāṇam yadi hi itiādi katham itiādinā
translated: “The power of the gift” is the amount of the gift. “His own measure” is the amount needed for his own livelihood. “If he” etc. is the question “How?”

original: saṅkhepato vuttassa atthassa vivaraṇaṃ. Anuppannassāti anuppanno assa puggalassa.🔽Cakkhubhūto hotīti mahājanassa cakkhu viya hoti. Sāsanaṃ ciraṭṭhititaṃ karotīti anuppannalābhuppādanena
analyzed: saṅkhepataḥ vuttassa atthassa vivaraṇam anuppannassa ati anuppannaḥ assa puggalassa  cakkhu bhūtaḥ hoti iti mahājanassa cakkhu viya hoti sāsanam karoti iti anuppanna lābha uppādanena
translated: “The master of the gift” is the one who gives. “His own measure” is the amount needed for his livelihood. “If he does not” and so on is an explanation of the meaning stated in brief in the words “how can he be called a monk?” “Not arisen” means not arisen for that person.

original: mahājanassa pasāduppādanena ca ciraṭṭhitikaṃ karoti.🔽Kuṭumbariyavihāreti kuṭumbariyagāmasannissitavihāre. Bhuñjanatthāyāti tasmiṃyeva🔽gehe nisīditvā bhuñjanatthāya. Gahetvā gamanatthāyāti gehato bahi gahetvā gamanatthāya.🔽Dhurabhattānīti niccabhattāni. Cūḷupaṭṭhākanti veyyāvaccakaraṃ. Vīmaṃsitvāti yathā
analyzed: mahājanassa pasāda uppādanena ca ciraṭṭhitikam karoti  kuṭumbariya vihāra iti kuṭumbariya gāma sannissita vihāre bhuñjana atthāya ati tasmin yeva  gehe nisīditvā bhuñjana tthāya gahetvā gamana tthāya ati gehataḥ bahi gahetvā gamana tthāya  dhura bhattāni iti nicca bhattāni cūḷupaṭṭhākanti veyyāvaccakaram vīmaṃsitvā iti yathā
translated: “He becomes an eye” means he becomes like an eye for the multitude. “He makes the Dispensation last long” means he makes it last long by causing the arising of the unarisen acquisition of the fruit and by causing the arising of faith in the multitude.🔽“In a monastery belonging to a householder” means in a monastery situated near a village of householders. “For the purpose of eating” means for the purpose of eating while sitting in that very house. “For the purpose of taking away” means for the purpose of taking away from the house.

original: uddissa kataṃ na hoti, evaṃ vīmaṃsitvā. Mahājano appiccho bhavituṃ maññatīti mahājano
analyzed: uddissa katam na hoti evam vīmaṃsitvā mahājanaḥ appicchaḥ bhavitum maññati iti mahājanaḥ
translated: “Regular meals” means regular food. “A junior attendant” means a servant. “Having investigated” means having investigated whether it is given with reference to a particular person. “The multitude thinks” means the multitude thinks that it is not right to be stingy.

original: sayaṃ appiccho bhavituṃ maññati diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjanena. Mahājanassāti bahujanassa.
analyzed: sayam appicchaḥ bhavitum maññati diṭṭha anugatim āpajjanena mahā janassa ati bahu janassa
translated: he thinks he can be content himself by following the view of the majority.

original: Avattharitvāti vitthārikaṃ katvā.
analyzed: avattharitvā iti vitthārikam katvā
translated: Having spread out: having made extensive.

original: 316. Pañcātapatappanaṃ catūsu passesu aggisantāpassa upari sūriyasantāpassa ca tappanaṃ,
analyzed: pañca ātapa tappanam catūsu passesu aggi santāpassa upari sūriya santāpassa ca tappanam
translated: The fivefold burning and scorching: the burning and scorching of the four directions, the burning and scorching of the sun above,

original: tañca kho gimhakāle. Chinnappapātapabbatasikharato patanaṃ maruppapātapatanaṃ. Pubbaṇhādīsu
analyzed: tat ca kho gimha kāle chinnappapāta pabbata sikharataḥ patanam maru ppapāta patanam pubbaṇha ādīsu
translated: and that in the hot season. The falling from a cliff, a tree, a rock, or a mountain peak is the falling into a desert.

original: ādiccābhimukhāvaṭṭanaṃ ādiccānuparivattanaṃ.
analyzed: ādicca abhimukha avaṭṭanam ādicca anuparivattanam
translated: The turning about facing the sun in the morning, etc., is the turning about following the sun.

original: 317. Ayampīti svākkhāte dhammavinaye kusītopi. Sāmaññanti tapacaraṇaṃ. Dupparāmaṭṭhanti micchācaritaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ. Nirayāyupakaḍḍhatīti nirayadukkhāya naṃ kaḍḍhati.
analyzed: ayam pi iti su ākkhāte dhamma vinaye kusītaḥ api tapa caraṇam dupparāmaṭṭha nti micchā caritam saṃkiliṭṭham nirayāya upakaḍḍhati iti niraya dukkhāya nam kaḍḍhati
translated: This one too: even one who is lazy in a well-proclaimed Dhamma and Discipline. Ascetic practice: the practice of austerity. Hard to follow: wrongly practiced, defiled. It drags one to hell: it drags one to the suffering of hell.

original: 318. Vuttappakāreti pañcātapatappanādike vuttappakāre.
