original: Atīte buddhassa bhagavato appaṭihataṃ ñāṇaṃ, anāgate buddhassa bhagavato appaṭihataṃ
analyzed: atīte buddhassa bhagavataḥ a paṭihatam ñāṇam anāgate buddhassa bhagavataḥ a paṭihatam
translated: The Blessed One’s cognizance is not in conformity with bodily action, verbal action

original: ñāṇaṃ, paccuppanne buddhassa bhagavato appaṭihataṃ ñāṇaṃ, yāvatakaṃ neyyaṃ, tāvatakaṃ🔽ñāṇaṃ. Yāvatakaṃ ñāṇaṃ, tāvatakaṃ neyyaṃ. Neyyapariyantikaṃ ñāṇaṃ, ñāṇapariyantikaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇam paccuppanne buddhassa bhagavataḥ a paṭihatam ñāṇam yāvatakam na iyyam tāvatakam  ñāṇam yāvatakam ñāṇam tāvatakam neyyam neyya pariyantikam ñāṇam ñāṇa pariyantikam
translated: Knowledge, in the present, of the Realised One, the Fortunate One, is unobstructed, as far as there is a knowable,🔽as far as there is knowledge. As far as there is a knowable, as far as there is knowledge, the knowable is the limit of knowledge,

original: neyyaṃ, neyyaṃ atikkamitvā ñāṇaṃ nappavattati, ñāṇaṃ atikkamitvā neyyapatho natthi,
analyzed: neyyam neyyam atikkamitvā ñāṇam na ppavattati ñāṇam atikkamitvā neyya pathaḥ natthi
translated: knowledge is the limit of the knowable, knowledge does not proceed beyond the knowable, the path of the knowable does not go beyond knowledge,

original: aññamaññapariyantaṭṭhāyino te dhammā, yathā dvinnaṃ samuggapaṭalānaṃ sammā phusitānaṃ
analyzed: aññamañña pariyanta ṭṭhāyino te dhammā yathā dvinnam samugga paṭalānam sammā phusitānam
translated: these things are the limit of each other, just as two oxen yoked by a single yoke,

original: heṭṭhimaṃ samuggapaṭalaṃ uparimaṃ nātivattati, uparimaṃ samuggapaṭalaṃ heṭṭhimaṃ
analyzed: heṭṭhimam samugga paṭalam uparimam na ativattati uparimam samugga paṭalam heṭṭhimam
translated: the ox in front does not go beyond the yoke, the ox behind does not go beyond the yoke,

original: nātivattati, aññamaññapariyantaṭṭhāyino, evamevaṃ buddhassa bhagavato neyyañca ñāṇañca🔽aññamaññapariyantaṭṭhāyino. Yāvatakaṃ neyyaṃ, tāvatakaṃ ñāṇaṃ. Yāvatakaṃ ñāṇaṃ, tāvatakaṃ
analyzed: na ativattati aññamañña pariyanta ṭṭhāyinaḥ evam evam buddhassa bhagavataḥ na iyyat ca ñāṇañca  aññamañña pariyanta ṭṭhāyinaḥ yāvatakam neyyam tāvatakam ñāṇam yāvatakam ñāṇam tāvatakam
translated: they are the limit of each other, so too the knowable and knowledge of the Realised One, the Fortunate One,🔽are the limit of each other. As far as there is a knowable, as far as there is knowledge, the knowable is the limit of knowledge,

original: neyyaṃ, neyyapariyantikaṃ ñāṇaṃ, ñāṇapariyantikaṃ neyyaṃ, neyyaṃ atikkamitvā ñāṇaṃ
analyzed: neyyam neyya pariyantikam ñāṇam ñāṇa pariyantikam neyyam neyyam atikkamitvā ñāṇam
translated: knowledge is the limit of the knowable, knowledge does not proceed beyond the knowable,

original: nappavattati, ñāṇaṃ atikkamitvā neyyapatho natthi. Aññamaññapariyantaṭṭhāyino te
analyzed: na ppavattati ñāṇam atikkamitvā na iyya pathaḥ natthi aññamañña pariyanta ṭṭhāyino te
translated: and does not overshoot the mark. There is no track for the trackless,

original: dhammā. Sabbadhammesu buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇaṃ pavattati.
analyzed: dhammā sabba dhammesu buddhassa bhagavataḥ ñāṇam pavattati
translated: but these ideas are mutually dependent. The Enlightened One’s knowledge extends to all ideas.🔽“ All ideas are bound up with the Enlightened One’s adverting, bound up with his wishing, bound up with his attention,🔽bound up with his cognizance’s uprising. The Enlightened One’s knowledge extends to all creatures. The Enlightened One knows the disposition of all creatures,

original: “Sabbe dhammā buddhassa bhagavato āvajjanappaṭibaddhā ākaṅkhappaṭibaddhā manasikārappaṭibaddhā🔽cittuppādappaṭibaddhā, sabbasattesu buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇaṃ pavattati. Sabbesaṃ
analyzed: sabbe dhammā buddhassa bhagavataḥ āvajjana ppaṭibaddhāḥ ākaṅkha ppaṭibaddhāḥ manasikāra ppaṭibaddhāḥ  cittuppāda paṭibaddhā sabba sattesu buddhassa bhagavataḥ ñāṇam pavattati sabbesam
translated: he knows their underlying tendencies, he knows their mental approach, he knows their mental proclivities,🔽he knows the outcome of their faculties, he knows which creatures are trainable and which are not, he knows the world’s manifold dispositions,

original: sattānaṃ buddho āsayaṃ jānāti, anusayaṃ jānāti, caritaṃ jānāti, adhimuttiṃ jānāti,🔽apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye
analyzed: sattānam buddhaḥ āsayam jānāti anusayam jānāti caritam jānāti adhimuttim jānāti  apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mud indriye su ākāre dvi ākāre su viññāpaye du viññāpaye
translated: he knows the world’s manifold destinations, he knows the world’s manifold elements, he knows the world’s manifold outlooks, he knows the world’s manifold occupations,

original: bhabbā sabbe satte pajānāti, sadevako loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī🔽pajā sadevamanussā antobuddhañāṇe parivattati.
analyzed: bhabbā sabbe satte pajānāti sa devakaḥ lokaḥ sa mārako sa brahmako sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇī 🔽pajā sa deva manussā antar buddha ñāṇe parivattati
translated: he knows the world’s manifold activities, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold dis satisfactions and dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions, he knows the world’s manifold satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisfactions and satisfactions and dis satisf

original: “Yathā ye keci macchakacchapā antamaso timitimiṅgalaṃ upādāya antomahāsamudde parivattanti,
analyzed: yathā ye keci maccha kacchapāḥ antamasaḥ timitimiṅgalam upādāya antar mahā samudde parivattanti
translated: turn and revolve and whirl around in the ocean,

original: evameva sadevako loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā antobuddhañāṇe
analyzed: evam eva sa devakaḥ lokaḥ sa mārako sa brahmakaḥ sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇī pajā sa deva manussā antar buddha ñāṇe
translated: so too, the world with its gods, its Māras, and its Brahmās, this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, turns and revolves and whirls around in the Buddha’s knowledge.

original: parivattati. Yathā ye keci pakkhino antamaso garuḷaṃ venateyyaṃ upādāya ākāsassa
analyzed: parivattati yathā ye keci pakkhinaḥ antamasaḥ garuḷam venateyyam upādāya ākāsassa
translated: Just as all the birds in the sky turn and revolve and whirl around in the sky,

original: padese parivattanti, evameva yepi te sāriputtasamā paññāya, tepi buddhañāṇassa padese
analyzed: padese parivattanti evam eva ye pi te sāriputta samāḥ paññāya te pi buddha ñāṇassa padese
translated: so too, those who are wise like Sāriputta turn and revolve and whirl around in the Buddha’s knowledge.

original: parivattanti, buddhañāṇaṃ devamanussānaṃ paññaṃ pharitvā atighaṃsitvā tiṭṭhati. Yepi
analyzed: parivattanti buddha ñāṇam deva manussānam paññam pharitvā atighaṃsitvā tiṭṭhati ye pi
translated: The Buddha’s knowledge stands out, towers above, surpasses, and overtops the wisdom of the world with its gods, its Māras, and its Brahmās, with its people with their ascetics and brahmins, their gods and humans.

original: te khattiyapaṇḍitā brāhmaṇapaṇḍitā gahapatipaṇḍitā samaṇapaṇḍitā nipuṇā kataparappavādā🔽vālavedhirūpā, vobhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni, te te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā
analyzed: te khattiya paṇḍitāḥ brāhmaṇa paṇḍitāḥ gahapati paṇḍitā samaṇa paṇḍitāḥ nipuṇā kata para ppavādā  vālavedhi rūpāḥ vobhindantāḥ maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhi gatāni te te pañham abhisaṅkharitvā
translated: Those who are wise—whether khattiyas, brahmins, householders, or ascetics—are clever, skilled in debate, and carry on conversations.

original: abhisaṅkharitvā”ti –
analyzed: abhisaṅkharitvā iti
translated: They formulate questions and then formulate other things.”

original: Ādinā niddiṭṭhapāḷiṃ peyyālamukhena saṃkhipitvā dassento “paññāpabhedakusalo pabhinnañāṇo…pe… te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā abhisaṅkharitvā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: ādinā niddiṭṭha pāḷim peyyāla mukhena saṃkhipitvā dassento paññā apabheda kusalo te pañham abhisaṅkharitvā abhisaṅkharitvā atiādim āha
translated: He said “Skilled in the analysis of wisdom, his knowledge analyzed … having formulated question after question” in order to show by way of a summary the text stated in the beginning.

original: Tattha pabhinnañāṇoti atthādīsu pabhedagatañāṇo. “Pabhedañāṇo”tipi paṭhanti, soyeva
analyzed: tattha pabhinna ñāṇo ti attha ādīsu pabheda gata ñāṇo pabheda ñāṇo ti pi paṭhanti saḥ yā iva
translated: Herein, his knowledge analyzed means his knowledge has analyzed out the analysis of meaning and so on. They read “pabhedañāṇo” , but the meaning is the same.

original: attho. Te pañhanti te te attanā adhippetaṃ pañhaṃ. Niddiṭṭhakāraṇāti vissajjitakāraṇā.
analyzed: atthaḥ te pañham ti te te attanā adhippetam pañham niddiṭṭha kāraṇā ati vissajjita kāraṇā
translated: Their question means their question which they themselves intended. The reason stated means the reason given.

original: Upakkhittakāti bhagavato paññāveyyattiyena samīpe khittakā antevāsikā sampajjanti.
analyzed: upakkhittakā ati bhagavataḥ paññā veyyattiyena samīpe khittakāḥ antevāsikā sampajjanti
translated: They were called “questioners” because they were pupils who were placed near the Blessed One by the greatness of his wisdom.

original: Bhavati abhibhavatīti bhūri. Kiṃ? Rāgādiṃ. Upasagge satipi tadeva padaṃ tamatthaṃ
analyzed: bhavati abhibhavati iti bhūri kim rāga ādim upasagge tat eva padam tam attham
translated: Bhūri means “it overcomes” . What? Lust and so on. Although the prefix upa is present, the word is said to convey that meaning

original: vadatīti upasaggena vināpi so attho viññeyyo anekatthattā dhātūnanti vuttaṃ – “abhibhuyyatī”ti.
analyzed: vadati iti upasaggena vinā api saḥ atthaḥ viññeyyaḥ aneka attha ttā dhātūnam ti vuttam
translated: even without the prefix, because of the many meanings of verbal roots.

original: Kārakabyattayena cetaṃ vuttaṃ, tasmā rāgaṃ abhibhuyyatīti sā sā maggapaññā attanā
analyzed: kāraka byattayena ca itam vuttam tasmā rāgam abhibhuyyati iti sā sā magga paññā attanā
translated: This is said with reference to the three kinds of action, therefore it is said “it overcomes lust” . That wisdom of the path itself

original: attanā vajjhaṃ rāgaṃ abhibhuyyati abhibhavati, madatīti attho. Abhibhavatīti sā sā
analyzed: attanā vajjham rāgam abhibhuyyati abhibhavati madati iti atthaḥ abhibhavati iti sā sā
translated: and he overcomes, conquers, crushes, the hate that is to be crushed by that knowledge.🔽The meaning is that he goes beyond it. The knowledge of the fruit is “abundant” because it goes beyond each of the defilements.

original: phalapaññā taṃ taṃ rāgaṃ bhavi abhibhavi maddīti bhūripaññā. “Abhibhavitā”ti vā pāṭho,
analyzed: phala paññā tam tam rāgam bhavi abhibhavi maddī iti bhūri paññā abhibhavitā iti vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: Or alternatively, the reading is “abhibhūta” ,🔽and they also read “abhibhavitvā” .

original: “abhibhavitvā”tipi paṭhanti. Abhibhavitvāti ca kiriyāya siddhabhāvadassanaṃ. Paññā
analyzed: paṭhanti abhibhavitvā ati ca kiriyāya siddha bhāva dassanam paññā
translated: And “abhibhavitvā” should be regarded as showing the state of the act’s being accomplished.

original: ce siddhā, rāgābhibhavo ca siddho evāti. Sesesupi eseva nayo.🔽Rāgādīsu pana rajjanalakkhaṇo rāgo. Dussanalakkhaṇo doso. Muyhanalakkhaṇo moho. Kujjhanalakkhaṇo🔽kodho, upanandhanalakkhaṇo upanāho. Pubbakālaṃ kodho, aparakālaṃ upanāho. Paraguṇamakkhanalakkhaṇo
analyzed: ce siddhā rāga abhibhavaḥ ca siddhaḥ eva ati sesesu pi esa iva nayo  rāga ādīsu pana rajjana lakkhaṇaḥ rāgaḥ dussana lakkhaṇaḥ doso muyhana lakkhaṇaḥ moho kujjhana lakkhaṇo  kodhaḥ upanandhana lakkhaṇaḥ upanāhaḥ pubba kālam kodhaḥ apara kālam upanāhaḥ para guṇa makkhana lakkhaṇaḥ
translated: And if the knowledge is accomplished, then the overcoming of the defilements is also accomplished. The same method of explanation applies in the other cases.🔽As regards greed, etc., greed has the characteristic of lust. Hate has the characteristic of annoyance. Delusion has the characteristic of bewilderment.🔽Anger has the characteristic of irritation. Resentment has the characteristic of continued irritation. Anger is at the beginning, and resentment comes later.

original: makkho, yugaggāhalakkhaṇo palāso. Parasampattikhīyanalakkhaṇā issā, attano sampattiniggūhanalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: makkhaḥ yuga ggāha lakkhaṇaḥ palāsaḥ para sampatti khīyana lakkhaṇā issā attanaḥ sampatti niggūhana lakkhaṇam
translated: Spite has the characteristic of concealing one’s own faults. Jealousy has the characteristic of envy of others’ good qualities.

original: macchariyaṃ. Attanā katapāpappaṭicchādanalakkhaṇā māyā, attano avijjamānaguṇappakāsanalakkhaṇaṃ🔽sāṭheyyaṃ. Cittassa uddhumātabhāvalakkhaṇo thambho, karaṇuttariyalakkhaṇo sārambho.
analyzed: mad śariyam attanā kata pāpa paṭicchādana lakkhaṇā māyā attanaḥ a vijjamāna guṇa ppakāsana lakkhaṇam  sāṭheyyam cittassa uddhumāta bhāva lakkhaṇo thambho karaṇa uttariya lakkhaṇo sa ārambho
translated: Concealment is the concealing of one’s own evil conduct. Deceit is the showing of oneself as having good qualities that one does not have.🔽Haughty is the state of being puffed up with conceit. Violent is the state of being overbearing.

original: Unnatilakkhaṇo māno, abbhunnatilakkhaṇo atimāno. Mattabhāvalakkhaṇo mado, pañcakāmaguṇesu🔽cittavossaggalakkhaṇo pamādo. Bhavati abhibhavati arinti bhūri asarūpato parassa🔽akārassa lopaṃ katvā. Tenāha – “ariṃ maddanipaññāti bhūripaññā”ti. Bhavati ettha
analyzed: unnati lakkhaṇaḥ mānaḥ abbhunnati lakkhaṇaḥ atimānaḥ matta bhāva lakkhaṇaḥ mado pañca kāmaguṇesu  citta vossagga lakkhaṇaḥ pamādaḥ bhavati abhibhavati bhūri asarūpataḥ parassa  akārassa lopam katvā tena āha arim maddani paññā ati bhūri paññā ati bhavati ettha
translated: Pride is the state of being puffed up with conceit. Conceit is the state of being puffed up with conceit. Intoxication is the state of being intoxicated. Negligence is the state of being negligent.🔽The word bhūri is derived from the root bhu, to conquer, with the affix uryat, which is added to verbs in the sense of repetition. Therefore it is said: “Bhūripaññā is one whose wisdom conquers much.”

original: thāvarajaṅgamanti bhūri vuccati pathavī yathā “bhūmī”ti bhūri viyāti bhūripaññā vitthatavipulaṭṭhena
analyzed: thāvara jaṅgamanti bhūri vuccati pathavī yathā bhūmī iti bhūri viyāti bhūri paññā vitthata vipula ṭṭhena
translated: The word bhūri is used in the sense of “earth” in the expression “bhūmi” in the sense of “the earth is full of moving and unmoving beings.”🔽The word bhūripaññā is used in the sense of “one who has much wisdom” in the sense of “one who has wisdom that is extended and vast”

original: sabbaṃ sahatāya ca. Tenāha – “tāyā”tiādi. Tattha pathavisamāyāti vitthatavipulaṭṭheneva
analyzed: sabbam sahatāya ca tena āha tāya atiādi tattha pathavi samāyā ati vitthata vipula ṭṭhena iva
translated: and in the sense of “one who has wisdom that is able to bear everything.” Therefore it is said: “Tāya” , etc. Herein, the word “pathavisamā” is used in the sense of “extended and vast.”

original: pathavisamāya. Vitthatāyāti pajānitabbe visaye vitthatāya, na ekadese vattamānāya.
analyzed: pathavi samāya vitthatāya ati pajānitabbe visaye vitthatāya na eka dese vattamānāya
translated: As to the extent: as to the extent of the domain to be known, not as to the extent of its occurrence in a single place.🔽As to the breadth: as to its being vast.

original: Vipulāyāti uḷārabhūtāya. Samannāgatoti puggalo. Iti-saddo kāraṇatthe, iminā kāraṇena
analyzed: vipulāya ati uḷāra bhūtāya samannāgataḥ ti puggalo iti saddo kāraṇa atthe iminā kāraṇena
translated: Endowed: a person. The word iti has the meaning of cause.

original: puggalassa bhūripaññāya samannāgatattā tassa paññā bhūripaññā nāmāti attho. “Bhūripaññassa
analyzed: puggalassa bhūri paññāya samannāgata ttā tassa paññā bhūripaññā nāma ati atthaḥ bhūri paññassa
translated: The meaning is that because of this cause, the person’s wisdom is called “vast wisdom” because he is endowed with vast wisdom.

original: paññā bhūripaññapaññā”ti vattabbe ekassa paññāsaddassa lopaṃ katvā “bhūripaññā”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Apicāti paññāpariyāyadassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Paññāyametanti paññāya etaṃ. Adhivacananti🔽adhikaṃ vacanaṃ. Bhūrīti bhūte atthe khandhādike ramati saccasabhāvena, diṭṭhi viya
analyzed: paññā bhūri pañña paññā iti vattabbe ekassa paññā saddassa lopam katvā bhūri paññā iti vuttam  apica iti paññā pariyāya dassana attham vuttam paññāyam etat ti paññāye etam adhivacanam ti  adhikam vacanam bhūri iti bhūte atthe khandha ādike ramati sacca sabhāvena viya
translated: Though it should be said “The wisdom of one of vast wisdom is vast wisdom,” the word paññā is omitted and it is said “bhūripaññā.”🔽As to the meaning of “vast”: it delights in what is vast, in the aggregates, etc.,🔽by way of the true nature of what is vast, not in what is not vast, as though it were a view.

original: na abhūteti bhūri. Medhāti asani viya siluccaye kilese medhati hiṃsatīti medhā, khippaṃ
analyzed: na abhūta iti bhūri asani viya siluccaye kilese medhati hiṃsati iti medhā khippam
translated: As to the meaning of “intelligence”: it smashes, it harms, defilements, as a thunderbolt smashes a stone. Or intelligence is the quick grasping and retention of the meaning.

original: gahaṇadhāraṇaṭṭhena vā medhā. Pariṇāyikāti yassuppajjati, taṃ sattaṃ attahitappaṭipattiyaṃ
analyzed: gahaṇa dhāraṇa ṭṭhena vā medhā pariṇāyikā ati yassa uppajjati tam sattam atta hita paṭipattiyam
translated: As to the meaning of “guide”: it guides the person in whom it arises to the practice of what is beneficial for himself.

original: sampayuttadhamme ca yāthāvalakkhaṇappaṭivedhe pariṇetīti pariṇāyikā. Imeheva aññānipi
analyzed: sampayutta dhamme ca yāthāva lakkhaṇa ppaṭivedhe pariṇeti iti pariṇāyikā imehi iva aññāni pi
translated: And it is a bringer because it brings about the penetration of the individual essences of the associated states in accordance with their individual essences.

original: paññāpariyāyavacanāni honti.
analyzed: paññā pariyāya vacanāni honti
translated: And there are other synonyms for understanding:🔽“Abundance of understanding” is the abundance of understanding in him, thus he is “one abundant in understanding” .

original: Paññābāhullanti paññā bahulā assāti paññābahulo, tassa bhāvo paññābāhullaṃ. Tañca
analyzed: paññā bāhullanti paññā bahulā assa ati paññā bahulaḥ tassa bhāvaḥ paññā bāhullam tat ca
translated: And that abundance of understanding is the occurrence of understanding.

original: paññāya bāhullaṃ pavatti evāti tamatthaṃ paññāgarukassa puggalassa vasena dassento,
analyzed: paññāya bāhullam pavatti eva ati tam attham paññā garukassa puggalassa vasena dassento
translated: So showing the meaning of that by way of a person who esteems understanding,

original: “idhekacco paññāgaruko hotī”tiādimāha. Tattha idhekaccoti puthujjanakalyāṇako, ariyo
analyzed: idha ekacco paññā āgarukaḥ hoti itiādim āha tattha idha ekacco ti puthujjana kalyāṇakaḥ ariyaḥ
translated: he said: “Here someone esteems understanding” . Here someone is a good worldling or a noble disciple.

original: vā. Paññā garu ekassāti paññāgaruko. Paññāya carito pavattito paññācarito, paññāya🔽caritaṃ pavattaṃ assāti vā paññācarito. Anulomikakhantiādivibhāgā paññā āsayo etassāti
analyzed: vā paññā garu ekassa ati paññāgarukaḥ paññāya carito pavattitaḥ paññā caritaḥ paññāya  caritam pavattam assa ati vā paññācaritaḥ anulomika khanti ādi vibhāgāḥ paññāḥ āsayaḥ etassa ati
translated: He esteems understanding, thus he is an “esteem-of-understanding” . He has understanding, thus he is “one who has understanding” .

original: paññāsayo. Paññāya adhimutto tanninnoti paññādhimutto. Samussitaṭṭhena paññā dhajo
analyzed: paññā sayo paññāya adhimutto tad ninno ti paññā adhimuttaḥ samussita ṭṭhena paññā dhajo
translated: He has understanding, thus he is “one who has understanding” . The inclination to the analysis of the kind of approval beginning with “in conformity with truth” is his “inclination to understanding” .🔽He is devoted to understanding, thus he is “one devoted to understanding” . The banner of understanding is hoisted for him, thus he is “one who has hoisted the banner of understanding” .

original: etassāti paññādhajo. Paññāketūti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Paññānimittaṃ ādhipateyyaṃ etassāti🔽paññādhipateyyo. Paññāsaṅkhāto vicayo, dhammasabhāvavicinanaṃ vā bahulaṃ etassāti🔽vicayabahulo. Nānappakārena dhammasabhāvavicinanaṃ bahulaṃ assāti pavicayabahulo.
analyzed: etassa ati paññā dhajaḥ paññā ketū ti tassa iva vevacanam paññā nimittam ādhipateyyam etassa ati  paññā ādhipateyyaḥ paññā saṅkhātaḥ vicayaḥ dhamma sabhāva vicinanam vā bahulam etassa ati  vicaya bahulaḥ nānappakārena dhamma sabhāva vicinanam bahulam assa ati pavicaya bahulaḥ
translated: “Banner of understanding” is a synonym for “ensign of understanding.” “Dominion of understanding” is a synonym for “sign of understanding.”🔽“Rich in development of understanding” is a synonym for “rich in investigation of the general characteristics of mental objects.”🔽“Rich in investigation” is a synonym for “rich in investigation of the specific characteristics of mental objects.”

original: Okkhāyanaṃ yāthāvato dhammānaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ bahulaṃ etassāti okkhāyanabahulo. Paññāya🔽tassa tassa dhammassa sammāpekkhanā sampekkhā, sampekkhāya ayanaṃ pavattanaṃ sampekkhāyanaṃ,🔽sampekkhāyanaṃ dhammo pakati assāti sampekkhāyanadhammo. Sampekkhāyanaṃ vā yāthāvato
analyzed: okkhāyanam yāthāvataḥ dhammānam upaṭṭhānam bahulam etassa ati okkhāyana bahulaḥ paññāya  tassa tassa dhammassa sammā apekkhanā sampekkhā sampekkhāya ayanam pavattanam sampekkhāyanam  sampekkhāyanam dhammo pakati assa ati sampekkhāyana dhammo sampekkhāyanam vā yāthāvataḥ
translated: “His banner is wisdom”: the banner is what is borne in front; it is the leader, the forerunner, of the army. Wisdom is borne in front by this bhikkhu, it is his leader, his forerunner, thus he is said to have wisdom as his banner. “His banner is wisdom”: this is a term expressive of his ensign. “He has wisdom as his resort”: wisdom is his resort, his refuge, his island, his recourse, thus he is said to have wisdom as his resort. “He has wisdom as his sovereign”: wisdom is his sovereign, his overlord, thus he is said to have wisdom as his sovereign. “He is rich in discernment”: discernment is discernment consisting in what is reasoned, or discernment consisting in what is well penetrated. He has much of this, thus he is said to be rich in discernment. “He is rich in investigation”: he has much investigation of the general characteristics and specific natures of states in various ways, thus he is said to be rich in investigation.🔽“He is rich in effacement”: effacement is the frequent appearance of states in accordance with actuality. He has much of this, thus he is said to be rich in effacement.🔽“He is rich in right view”: right view is the seeing of states as they are. He has much of this, thus he is said to be rich in right view.🔽“He is rich in right seeing”: right seeing is the occurrence, the appearance, of right view.🔽He has much of this, thus he is said to be rich in right seeing. Or alternatively, right seeing is the nature, the actuality, of seeing as it really is. He has much of this, thus he is said to be rich in right seeing.

original: dassanadhammo sabhāvo etassāti sampekkhāyanadhammo. Sabbaṃ dhammajātaṃ vibhūtaṃ vibhāvitaṃ
analyzed: dassana dhammo sabhāvaḥ etassa ati sampekkhāyana dhammo sabbam dhamma jātam vibhūtam vibhāvitam
translated: “He is rich in development”: he has much development of all kinds of states by making them evident and fully evident.

original: katvā viharaṇasīloti vibhūtavihārī.
analyzed: katvā viharaṇa sīlaḥ iti vibhūta vihārī
translated: Thus he is said to be rich in development.

original: Taccaritotiādīsu taṃ-saddena paññā paccāmaṭṭhā, tasmā tattha “paññācarito”tiādinā
analyzed: tad caritā iti ādīsu tad saddena paññā tasmā tattha paññā caritā iti ādinā
translated: In the case of the words taccarita, etc., the word that is the object of the pronoun is implied by the pronoun, so the meaning should be understood as “one whose practice is that” and so on.

original: attho veditabbo. Sā paññā caritā garukā bahulā assāti taccarito taggaruko tabbahulo.🔽Tassaṃ paññāyaṃ ninno poṇo pabbhāro adhimuttoti tanninno tappoṇo tappabbhāro tadadhimutto.
analyzed: atthaḥ veditabbaḥ sā paññā caritā garukā bahulā assa ati tad caritaḥ tad garukaḥ tad bahulaḥ  paññāyam ninnaḥ poṇaḥ pabbhāraḥ adhimutto ti tad ninnaḥ tad poṇaḥ tad pabbhāraḥ tad adhimuttaḥ
translated: That is to say, he is taccarita, etc., because his practice, his respect, his frequency is that .🔽He is tanninno, etc., because he is sunken, fixed, devoted, and resolved upon that .🔽That is his adhipati, his overlord, and he is come from that, and he is to be governed by that .

original: Sā paññā adhipati tadadhipati, tadadhipatito āgato tadādhipateyyo. Paññāgarukotiādīni
analyzed: sā paññā adhipati tad adhipati tad adhipatitaḥ āgataḥ tad ādhipateyyaḥ paññā garukā uti ādīni
translated: The words paññāgaruko, etc.,

original: “kāmaṃ sevantaṃyeva jānāti, ayaṃ puggalo nekkhammagaruko”tiādīsu viya purimajātito
analyzed: kāmam sevantam yeva jānāti ayam puggalaḥ nekkhamma garukaḥ ti ādīsu viya purima jātitaḥ
translated: are said in the way beginning, “One knows only one who indulges in sense desires as one who respects renunciation” .

original: pabhuti vuttāni. Taccaritotiādīni imissā jātiyā vuttāni. Idāni vuttamevatthaṃ nidassanavasenapi
analyzed: vuttāni tad caritā uti ādīni imissā jātiyā vuttāni idāni vuttam eva attham nidassana vasena api
translated: The words taccarita, etc., are said of this present existence. Now, in order to show the meaning just stated by way of illustration,

original: dassetuṃ – “yathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Evamevantiādīni dassitabbanigamanaṃ.🔽Sīghapaññāti attano visaye sīghappavattikā paññā, yā samāraddhā attano paññākiccaṃ
analyzed: dassetum yathā itiādi vuttam evam eva nti ādīni dassitabba nigamanam 🔽sīgha paññā ati attanaḥ visaye sīgha ppavattikā paññā yā samāraddhā attanaḥ paññā kiccam
translated: he said “Just as” , etc. The words evameva, etc., are the conclusion of the illustration.

original: adandhāyantī avitthāyantī khippameva sampāpeti. Tenāha – “sīghaṃ sīghaṃ sīlāni paripūretī”tiādi.
analyzed: a dandhāyantī a vitthāyantī khippam eva sampāpeti tena āha sīgham sīgham sīlāni paripūreti itiādi
translated: He does not delay, does not procrastinate, but quickly fulfills them. Hence it is said: “He fulfills the precepts quickly, quickly” .

original: Tattha sīghaṃ sīghanti bahūnaṃ sīlādīnaṃ saṅgahatthaṃ dvikkhattuṃ vuttaṃ. Sīlānīti
analyzed: tattha sīgham sīghanti bahūnam sīla ādīnam saṅgahattham dvi kkhattum vuttam sīlāni iti
translated: Herein, quickly, quickly is said twice to include many precepts. Precepts :

original: cārittavārittavasena paññattāni pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlāni, ṭhapetvā vā indriyasaṃvaraṃ🔽tassa visuṃ gahitattā itarāni tividhasīlāni. Indriyasaṃvaranti cakkhādīnaṃ channaṃ
analyzed: cāritta vāritta vasena paññattāni pātimokkha saṃvara sīlāni ṭhapetvā vā indriya saṃvaram  tassa visum gahita ttā itarāni tividha sīlāni cakkha ādīnam channam
translated: the precepts of the Pāṭimokkha restraint consisting in abstinence and undertaking, or else the three kinds of precepts, the precepts of virtue consisting in abstinence, etc.,🔽are called “precepts of virtue.” Restraint of the sense faculties :

original: indriyānaṃ rāgappaṭighappavesaṃ akatvā satikavāṭena nivāraṇaṃ thakanaṃ. Bhojane mattaññutanti
analyzed: indriyānam rāga ppaṭigha pavesam a katvā sati kavāṭena nivāraṇam thakanam bhojane mattaññu tat
translated: having prevented the entry of lust and hate in regard to the six sense objects beginning with visible forms by means of mindfulness, he guards the sense faculties.🔽Knowledge of moderation in food :

original: paccavekkhitaparibhogavasena bhojane pamāṇaññubhāvaṃ. Jāgariyānuyoganti divasassa
analyzed: paccavekkhita paribhoga vasena bhojane pamāṇaññu bhāvam divasassa
translated: he knows the measure in eating by consuming food after reflection.🔽Application to watchfulness :

original: tīsu koṭṭhāsesu rattiyā paṭhamamajjhimakoṭṭhāsesu ca jāgarati na niddāyati, samaṇadhammameva
analyzed: tīsu koṭṭhāsesu rattiyā paṭhama majjhima koṭṭhāsesu ca jāgarati na niddāyati samaṇa dhammam eva
translated: he is watchful, not drowsy, during the three watches of the day and night.

original: karotīti jāgaro, jāgarassa bhāvo, kammaṃ vā jāgariyaṃ, jāgariyassa anuyogo jāgariyānuyogo,
analyzed: karoti iti jāgaraḥ jāgarassa bhāvaḥ kammam vā jāgariyam jāgariyassa anuyogaḥ jāgariya anuyogaḥ
translated: “He does it” is “he is awake.” The state of being awake is “watchfulness.” Or watchfulness is the action. The pursuit of watchfulness is “pursuit of watchfulness.”

original: taṃ jāgariyānuyogaṃ. Sīlakkhandhanti sekkhaṃ vā asekkhaṃ vā sīlakkhandhaṃ. Evamitarepi
analyzed: tam jāgariya anuyogam sīlakkhandhanti sekkham vā asekkham vā sīlakkhandham evam itare pi
translated: That pursuit of watchfulness. “The category of virtue”: the category of virtue of a trainer or of one beyond training. So too with the other categories.

original: khandhā veditabbā. Paññākkhandhanti maggapaññā ca sekkhāsekkhānaṃ lokiyapaññā ca.
analyzed: khandhāḥ veditabbā magga paññā ca sekkha asekkhānam lokiya paññā ca
translated: “The category of understanding”: path understanding and the mundane understanding of trainers and those beyond training.

original: Vimuttikkhandhanti phalavimutti. Vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhanti paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ.
analyzed: vimutti kkhandhanti phala vimutti vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhanti paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam
translated: “The category of deliverance”: the deliverance of fruition. “The category of knowledge and vision of deliverance”: the knowledge of reviewing.

original: Sīghapaññāniddesasadisoyeva lahupaññāniddeso, tathā hāsapaññāniddeso. Javanapaññāniddeso
analyzed: sīgha paññā niddesa sadisaḥ yeva lahu paññā niddesaḥ tathā hāsa paññā niddesaḥ javana paññā niddesaḥ
translated: The description of quick understanding is similar to that of sharp understanding. So too with the description of keen understanding.🔽The description of swift understanding is given in the way beginning, “Understanding that is swift in adverting” .

original: pana kalāpasammasananayena pavatto. Tikkhapaññāniddeso vīriyassa ussukkāpanavasena,
analyzed: pana kalāpa sammasana nayena pavattaḥ tikkha paññā niddesaḥ vīriyassa ussukka āpana vasena
translated: The description of sure understanding is given in the way beginning, “Understanding that is sure in surmounting” .

original: nibbedhikapaññāniddeso sabbaloke anabhiratasaññāvasena pavatto. Tattha turitakiriyā
translated: The description of penetrative understanding is given in the way beginning, “Understanding that is penetrative of the three kinds of feeling” .🔽Herein, quickness is swiftness in action.

original: sīghatā. Adandhatā lahutā. Vegāyitattaṃ khippatā.
analyzed: sīgha tā a dandha tā lahu tā vegāyitattam khippa tā
translated: Lightness is non-sluggishness. Agility is speed.

original: Hāsabahuloti pītibahulo. Sesapadāni tasseva vevacanāni. Atha vā hāsabahuloti mūlapadaṃ.
analyzed: hāsa bahulo ti pīti bahulaḥ sesa padāni tassa iva vevacanāni atha vā hāsa bahulaḥ ti mūla padam
translated: He is full of laughter: full of happiness. The other terms are synonyms for that. Or alternatively, he is full of laughter is the basic term.

original: Vedabahuloti tassā eva pītiyā sampayuttasomanassavedanāvasena niddesapadaṃ. Tuṭṭhibahuloti
analyzed: veda bahulo ti tassāḥ eva pītiyā sampayutta somanassa vedanā vasena niddesa padam tuṭṭhi bahulo ti
translated: He is full of rapture: this is a term for the feeling of joy associated with that happiness. He is full of gladness:

original: nātibalavapītiyā tuṭṭhākāravasena. Pāmojjabahuloti balavapītiyā pamuditabhāvavasena.
analyzed: na ati balava pītiyā tuṭṭha ākāra vasena balava pītiyā pamudita bhāva vasena
translated: through the aspect of gladness due to happiness that is not very strong. He is full of rapture: through the state of rapture due to strong happiness.

original: Sīlāni paripūretīti haṭṭhappahaṭṭho udaggūdaggo sampiyāyamāno sīlāni sampādeti. Pītisomanassasahagatā🔽hi paññā abhirativasena ārammaṇe phullitā vikasitā viya pavattati, na evaṃ upekkhāsahagatāti.🔽Aniccato khippaṃ javatīti “khandhapañcakaṃ anicca”nti vegāyitena pavattati, paṭipakkhadūrībhāvena
analyzed: sīlāni paripūreti iti haṭṭha ppahaṭṭhaḥ udaggu udaggo sampiyāyamānaḥ sīlāni sampādeti pīti somanassa sahagatā  hi paññā abhirati vasena ārammaṇe phullitā vikasitā viya pavattati na evam upekkhā sahagatā ti  aniccataḥ khippam javati iti khandha pañcakam aniccanti vegāyitena pavattati paṭipakkha dūrībhāvena
translated: He fulfils the precepts: he fulfils the precepts with elation, exultation, gladness, and satisfaction.🔽For understanding accompanied by happiness and joy occurs with regard to the object as if it were expanding, as if it were filling the whole body, but understanding accompanied by equanimity does not occur in this way.

original: pubbābhisaṅkhārassa sātisayattā indena vissaṭṭhavajiraṃ viya lakkhaṇaṃ avirajjhantī
analyzed: pubba abhisaṅkhārassa sa atisaya ttā indena vissaṭṭha vajiram viya lakkhaṇam a virajjhantī
translated: He quickly penetrates impermanence: it occurs with the speed of a swift arrow shot by a powerful archer, because it is opposed to the strong prior formation.

original: adandhāyantī aniccalakkhaṇaṃ vegasā paṭivijjhati, tasmā sā javanapaññā nāmāti attho.
analyzed: a dandhāyantī anicca lakkhaṇam vegasā paṭivijjhati tasmā sā javana paññā nāma ati attho
translated: and the characteristic of impermanence is penetrated by insight as a matter of course. So it is called “speedy insight.”🔽The meaning is that it is called “speedy” because it is quick to penetrate the characteristics of impermanence, and so on. The same method of explanation applies in the case of the remaining terms.

original: Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Evaṃ lakkhaṇārammaṇikavipassanāvasena javanapaññaṃ dassetvā🔽balavavipassanāvasena dassetuṃ – “rūpa”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha khayaṭṭhenāti yattha
analyzed: sesa padesu pi esā iva nayaḥ evam lakkhaṇa ārammaṇika vipassanā vasena javana paññam dassetvā  balava vipassanā vasena dassetum rūpa ntiādi vuttam tattha khaya ṭṭhena ati yattha
translated: Having thus shown “speedy insight” by means of insight that has the characteristics as its object,

original: yattha uppajjati, tattha tattheva bhijjanato khayasabhāvattā. Bhayaṭṭhenāti bhayānakabhāvato.🔽Asārakaṭṭhenāti attasāravirahato niccasārādivirahato ca. Tulayitvāti tulābhūtāya🔽vipassanāpaññāya tuletvā. Tīrayitvāti tāya eva tīraṇabhūtāya tīretvā. Vibhāvayitvāti🔽yāthāvato pakāsetvā pākaṭaṃ katvā. Atha vā tulayitvāti kalāpasammasanavasena tulayitvā.
analyzed: yattha uppajjati tattha tattha iva bhijjanataḥ khaya sabhāvattā bhaya ṭṭhena ati bhayānaka bhāvato  asāra kaṭṭhena ati atta sāra virahataḥ ca tulayitvā ati tulā bhūtāya  vipassanā paññāya tuletvā tīrayitvā ati tāya eva tīraṇa bhūtāya tīretvā vibhāvayitvā ati  pakāsetvā pākaṭam katvā atha vā tulayitvā iti kalāpa sammasana vasena tulayitvā
translated: he said “Rūpa” , etc., in order to show it by means of powerful insight. Herein, as to the meaning of “destruction”: wherever it arises, it is destroyed there itself, because it has the nature of destruction. As to the meaning of “terror”: because it is terrifying.🔽As to the meaning of “unprofitable”: because it is devoid of a self that is profitable, and because it is devoid of a permanent core, and so on. Having weighed: having weighed with insight that is like a scale. Having measured: having measured with that same insight that is like a measuring rod. Having defined: having defined it, having made it evident, by showing it as it really is. Or alternatively: having weighed, by weighing it by means of the “contemplation of a component” ;

original: Tīrayitvāti udayabbayānupassanāvasena tīretvā. Vibhāvayitvāti bhaṅgānupassanādivasena
analyzed: tīrayitvā iti udaya bbaya anupassanā vasena tīretvā vibhāvayitvā iti bhaṅga anupassanā ādi vasena
translated: having measured, by measuring it by means of the “contemplation of arising and falling away” ; having defined, by defining it by means of the “contemplation of destruction,” and so on.

original: pākaṭaṃ katvā. Vibhūtaṃ katvāti saṅkhārupekkhānulomavasena phuṭaṃ katvā. Rūpanirodheti🔽rūpakkhandhassa nirodhabhūte nibbāne. Khippaṃ javatīti ninnapoṇapabbhāravasena javati🔽pavattati. analyzed: pākaṭam katvā vibhūtam katvā ati saṅkhāra upekkhā anuloma vasena phuṭam katvā rūpa nirodha iti  rūpakkhandhassa nirodha bhūte nibbāne khippam javati iti ninna poṇa pabbhāra vasena javati  pavattati idāni sikhāppatta vipassanā vasena javana paññam dassetum puna rūpa ntiādi vuttam  ñāṇassa tikkha bhāvaḥ nāma sa visesam paṭipakkha samucchindanena veditabbaḥ ti khippam
translated: and making it evident. Making it evident means making it evident by means of the equanimity about formations. In the cessation of form: in Nibbāna, which is the state of cessation of the form aggregate. It goes quickly: it goes with speed, with swiftness, by means of the state of quick direct-knowledge.🔽Now, in order to point out the quickness of the understanding that goes by means of insight that has reached the state of the successive steps of insight, “Form” is said, etc., is said.🔽The keenness of the knowledge should be understood as the state of cutting off the opposite by means of the state of distinction. Quickly it goes,🔽quickly it penetrates, quickly it enters into.🔽

original: pajahati. Vinodetīti khipati. Byantiṃ karotīti vigatantaṃ karoti. Anabhāvaṃ gametīti
analyzed: pajahati vinodeti iti khipati byantim karoti iti vigata antam karoti anabhāvam gameti iti

analyzed: sabbe saṅkhārā aniccāḥ dukkhāḥ vipariṇāma dhammā saṅkhatā paṭiccasamuppannā khaya dhammā

original: vayadhammā virāgadhammā nirodhadhammā”ti yāthāvato dassanena saccappaṭivedho ijjhati,
analyzed: vaya dhammāḥ virāga dhammāḥ nirodha dhammāḥ ti yāthāvataḥ dassanena sacca ppaṭivedho ijjhati
translated: The penetration of the truths comes about by seeing things as they really are, not otherwise.

original: na aññathāti kāraṇamukhena nibbedhikapaññaṃ dassetuṃ – “sabbasaṅkhāresu ubbegabahulo
analyzed: na aññathā ti kāraṇa mukhena nibbedhika paññam dassetum sabba saṅkhāresu ubbega bahulo
translated: In order to show penetrative understanding by way of cause, it is said: “He becomes one who is much afraid of all formations.

original: hotī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha ubbegabahuloti “sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”tiādinā nayena sabbasaṅkhāresu
analyzed: hoti itiādi vuttam tattha ubbega bahulo ti sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā ati ādinā nayena sabba saṅkhāresu
translated: ” Herein, he becomes one who is much afraid means that he is one who is frequently afraid of all formations by way of the reflection that all formations are impermanent, etc.

original: abhiṇhappavattasaṃvego. Uttāsabahuloti ñāṇabhayavasena sabbasaṅkhāresu bahuso utrastamānaso.🔽Tena ādīnavānupassanamāha. Ukkaṇṭhanabahuloti saṅkhārato uddhaṃ visaṅkhārābhimukhatāya
analyzed: abhiṇha pavatta saṃvego uttāsa bahulaḥ ti ñāṇa bhaya vasena sabba saṅkhāresu bahusas utrasta mānasaḥ  tena ādīnava anupassanam āha ukkaṇṭhana bahulaḥ ti saṅkhārataḥ uddham visaṅkhāra abhimukha tāya
translated: He becomes one who is much terrified means that he is one who is terrified in mind in regard to all formations by way of the fear of knowledge.🔽By this he shows the contemplation of danger. He becomes one who is much disgusted means that he is one who is disgusted with formations because he is turned away from them and is inclined towards the absence of formations.

original: ukkaṇṭhanabahulo. Iminā nibbidānupassanamāha. Aratibahulotiādinā tassā eva aparāparūpapattiṃ.
analyzed: ukkaṇṭhana bahulaḥ iminā nibbida anupassanam āha arati bahulaḥ iti ādinā tassāḥ eva apara apara upapattim
translated: By this he shows the contemplation of dispassion. He becomes one who is much repelled, etc., is a further way of showing the same thing.🔽He becomes one who is turned away means that he is one whose consciousness is turned away from all formations.

original: Bahimukhoti sabbasaṅkhārato bahibhūtaṃ nibbānaṃ uddissa pavattañāṇamukho. Tathā pavattitavimokkhamukho.
analyzed: bahimukhaḥ ti sabba saṅkhārataḥ bahi bhūtam nibbānam uddissa pavatta ñāṇa mukho tathā pavattita vimokkha mukho
translated: He becomes one who is turned towards means that he is one whose consciousness is inclined towards the cessation of all formations.🔽He becomes one who is turned outwards means that he is one whose consciousness is turned towards Nibbāna, which is outside all formations. He becomes one whose mind is turned towards means that he is one whose mind is inclined towards the liberation that occurs in that way.

original: Nibbijjhanaṃ paṭivijjhanaṃ nibbedho, so etissā atthīti nibbedhikā, nibbijjhatīti🔽vā nibbedhikā, sā eva paññā nibbedhikapaññā. Anibbiddhapubbanti anamatagge saṃsāre🔽antaṃ pāpetvā anividdhapubbaṃ. Appadālitapubbanti tasseva atthavacanaṃ, antakaraṇeneva
analyzed: nibbijjhanam paṭivijjhanam nibbedhaḥ saḥ etissā atthi iti nibbedhikā nibbijjhati iti  vā nibbedhikā sā eva paññā nibbedhika paññā a nibbiddha pubbanti anamatagge saṃsāre  antam pāpetvā a nividdha pubbam a padālita pubbam ti tassa iva attha vacanam anta karaṇena iva
translated: Nibbidā is penetration, piercing through; it has that, thus it is nibbedhikā . Or alternatively, it penetrates , thus it is nibbedhikā . That same understanding is nibbedhika understanding. Never before experienced : never before experienced in the beginningless round of rebirths. Never before penetrated : never before penetrated by going to the end of it. Never before burst asunder : this is a synonym for the last. By the act of ending it.

original: appadālitapubbanti attho. Lobhakkhandhanti lobharāsiṃ, lobhakoṭṭhāsaṃ vā.🔽Kāyagatāsativaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: appadālita pubbam ti attho lobha kkhandham ti lobha rāsim lobha koṭṭhāsam vā  kāyagata asati vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Nibbidā is penetration, piercing through; it has that, thus it is nibbedhikā . Or alternatively, it penetrates , thus it is nibbedhikā . That same understanding is nibbedhika understanding. Never before discovered : never before discovered by the end being brought to it in the beginningless round of rebirths. Never before penetrated : this is a synonym for the preceding. The meaning is: never before penetrated by bringing the end to it. Mass of greed : a heap of greed, or a collection of greed. The Description of the Chapter on the Foundation of Mindfulness Consisting in Rapture is finished.

original: 20. Amatavaggavaṇṇanā🔽600-611. Natthi ettha mataṃ maraṇaṃ vināsoti amataṃ, nibbānanti āha – “maraṇavirahitaṃ🔽nibbānaṃ paribhuñjantī”ti. Amatassa vā nibbānassa adhigamahetutāya amatasadisaatappakasukhapatitatāya
analyzed: amata vagga vaṇṇanā  na atthi ettha matam maraṇam vināso ti amatam nibbānam ti āha maraṇa virahitam  nibbānam paribhuñjanti iti amatassa vā nibbānassa adhigama hetutāya amata sadisa atappaka sukha patitatāya
translated: The Description of the Chapter on the Deathless

original: ca kāyagatāsati “amata”nti vuttā. Paribhuñjantīti jhānasamāpajjanena vaḷañjanti.
analyzed: ca kāya gatā asati vuttā paribhuñjanti iti jhāna samāpajjanena vaḷañjanti
translated: There is no death here, no dying, no destruction, thus it is deathless . It is Nibbāna that is referred to here, according to the words: “She enjoys the deathless, Nibbāna, by attaining it” . Or alternatively, since the foundation of mindfulness consisting in rapture is a cause for attaining the deathless Nibbāna, and since it is occupied with the rapture that is a form of bliss, it is called “deathless” . She enjoys : she delights in by attaining jhāna.

original: Viraddhanti anadhigamena virajjhitaṃ. Tenāha – “virādhitaṃ nādhigata”nti. Āraddhanti

original: sādhitaṃ nipphāditaṃ. Tañca paripuṇṇaṃ nāma hotīti āha – “āraddhanti paripuṇṇa”nti.

translated: sādhitaṃ nipphāditaṃ. Tañca paripuṇṇaṃ nāma hotīti āha – “āraddhanti paripuṇṇa”nti.
